loans.name: Foel

texts.es: Foel, de 32 años, es un trabajador padre soltero, que vive en compañía de sus hijos: Jonatan y Erick a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). A las afueras de la localidad se encuentran los sembríos de Foel, que consisten en café, plátanos y palta. Ya tiene 14 años de experiencia en está actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es negociar sus granos a los comerciantes de la ciudad de Villarica; púes ve gustosa el resultado de su esfuerzo. Pero consiente que la cosecha de café es una vez al año. También se dedica a trabajar como peón en una hacienda de café, donde le pagan semanalmente por fertilizar y limpiar los cultivos. Su principal dificultad es obtener el capital necesario para el mantenimiento anual de sus sembríos. Ahora se está preparando para la recolección de los primeros granos maduros de café. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de progreso que le brindan. Foel, dará el primer paso para la apertura de un nuevo negocio que lo considera más rentable, por ello comprará varios ejemplares de cerdos, asimismo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Foel, age 32, is a hardworking single father who lives with his children, Jonathan and Erick, who he cares for and provides an education. He lives in his own home in the town of Unión Palomar in the central Peruvian jungle. Outside of the town, he has land on which he grows coffee, bananas, and avocados. Foel has fourteen years of farming experience. What he enjoys most about his job is negotiating the price of seeds with the merchants in the city of Villarica, and he is rewarded for his efforts. Foel is aware that he can only harvest coffee once a year, so he also works as a laborer on a coffee plantation. He is paid weekly to fertilize and remove weeds. His main difficulty is to obtain the necessary capital to pay for the annual maintenance of his crops. Now he is preparing to gather the first crop of ripe coffee beans.

Foel is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollando Para El Progreso de Prisma” (Developing for the Progress of Prisma). This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for being given the opportunity to make progress. Foel will be taking the first steps toward starting a new business that he considers to be more profitable. He will buy several pigs and invest in the purchase of school supplies for his children.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and acquire school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Tricia Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SOL Y LUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tricia; la socia tiene 36 años de edad, soltera; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora el cual se encuentra ubicado al frente de la universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco, ella lleva años en este negocio el cual le gustaría más adelante poder agrandar su negocio es por ese motivo que ella trabaja con mucho empeño y alegría. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de su fotocopiadora como papeles,tinta entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Tricia, 36, is a member of the “SOL Y LUNA” (Sun & Moon) communal bank which is located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

She alternates her daily chores with a photocopy service business located across the street from San Antonio Abad del Cusco National University.  She’s been in business for years and she’s like to expand the business later on.  Because of this she works with much dedication and joy.

She’s requesting a loan to get supplies, like paper, ink and others, for her photocopier.  She is happy about the loan and commits to repay.

loans.use: to get supplies, like paper, ink and others, for her photocopier.

loans.name: Vepkhia

texts.en:
Vepkhia T. comes from Japana, a small village in the Guria Region. He is 44 years old, married and lives with his wife Tamar, nine- and 10-year-old sons and his mother. Agriculture is the only source of income for the family. 

Vepkhia and Tamar run a small dairy farm with six milk cows and sell approximately 100 kg of traditional Georgian cheese per month in a nearby town. Also the family owns a 1.5 ha plot of land where vegetables, maize, and watermelon are grown. Harvested grain, fruits and vegetables are sold locally to wholesalers. From all the above-mentioned activities the family earns approximately 650 Laris per month.

With the requested credit Vepkhia plans to purchase fertilizers, watermelon seeds, and cultivate the land. 

The income received from watermelon sales will be used for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, watermelon seeds, and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old woman living in Tyre with her husband and her two kids. She has worked at selling shoes for men, women and kids since 1998, but she opened her own business in 2000. She is a hard-working woman, who seeks to help her husband in all of their family's expenses. Her 13 years of experience gave her the customers' trust and the will to buy even though if they don't need something at the present moment. She gives them the motive to earn her products, her customer service is spoken about by most of her clients.

In addition to that, her good quality products are affordable to all of her customers and ordinary citizens. Hanan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the seventh time, in order to buy new summer collections. She is insisting on improving her family's situation through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's summer collections.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last nine years. He is 39 years old and married to Racheal. They have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET  Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming activities.

In the future, Fred hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Volcan Masaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo Volcán Masaya está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Janette de 34 años quien comercializa productos varios de distintas marcas Avon, zermat, boguet…etc. El negocio lo inicio hace 4 años con 500 córdobas en productos zermat actualmente es más diverso.
Ella con el crédito además de invertir en productos pondrá una comideria para seguir progresando.
Las otras integrantes son Mirna de 53 años quien vende medicamentos y Rosario de 25 años alquila y repara caponeras desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Volcán Masaya” Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Janette who is 34 years old and sells various products from different brands (Avon, Zermat, Boguet, etc.). She started her business four years ago with 500 Nicaraguan Córdobas (NIO) of Zermat products, but it is currently more varied.

In addition to using the loan to invest in products, she will also set up an eatery to continue moving forward. The other group members are 53-year-old Mirna who sells medicines and 25-year-old Rosario who has rented and repaired motorcycle taxis for three years.

loans.use: to buy products from Avon, Zermat, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mercy has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Mercy is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has worked in his in quarry in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 32 years old, married to Lucy and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy new tools which he will be using to extract stones.  He normally sells the stones locally.

In future, Patrick hopes to be extracting stones on a large scale and sell them in bigger towns like Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy more tools for extracting stones

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
She is 30 years old and married. She has been in this business of selling fruits like tomatoes, mangoes and pineapple soft drinks for two years.

She request a loan  from BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She has eight children. seven of whom are in school, with the extra profits from her loan.she will be able to pay the school fees of her children and build a new house.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more tomatoes,pineaple for sale.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 28-year-old enterprising businessman. He is married to Jane who is a housewife. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a green grocer business for the past year with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family members.
 
He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add a stock of kale, tomatoes and potatoes to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is to expand his business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To add kale, tomatoes and potatoes to his business.

loans.name: Grupo Hatarinas Group

texts.es:
Epifanía es una mujer de 49 años de edad, ella pertenece a la alcancía Grupo Hatarinas con 7 miembros entre hombres y Mujeres, son personas emprendedoras, que actualmente todos tienen un negocio y un propósito en común para sostener a sus familiares, con sueños por alcanzar y lograr. Epifanía y su conviviente tiene un negocio de venta de platería y en sus ratos libres ella hace acabados en joyas es su mayor habilidad, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 aun son menores de edad y que por ellos tiene que luchar para poder darles lo mejor, gracias al apoyo de  nuestra institución ha podido darles educación y construir su vivienda, con el ultimo préstamo piensa invertir en materiales de plata para trabajos nuevos.
El Señor David no estuvo presente en el desembolso del grupo por motivo de trabajo, por lo cual se incrementa la fotografia lado izquierda, con polo color blanco.
texts.en:
Epifanía is a 49-year-old woman who belongs to the Grupo Hatarinas Communal Bank, which has seven male and female members.  They are enterprising people who all currently have their own businesses, a common goal of supporting their families, and dreams to reach for and attain.

 Epifanía and her live-in partner have a business selling silver and, in her free time, she finishes jewelry, which is her greatest skill.  She has three children, two of whom are still minors.  It is for them that she has to struggle to be able to give them the best, and thanks to the help of this institution, she has been able to give them an education and to build their home.  With this latest loan she plans to invest in silver for new work projects.

David was not present for the group disbursement , which is why he appears in the photograph on the left hand side wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to invest in silver.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 8-22 years.  Her family of 6 people lives in their own house in Hioma, Uganda. 

For 8 years she has been operating a textile shop. She started her business by selling used clothes, but now she sells new textiles in her own shop. She faces a challenge of customers who order and never return to pick up their orders. Her dream is to open another boutique since the business is profitable. 

Christine needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Aurelio

texts.es: EL Sr. Luis es un hombre luchador y con muchas aspiraciones de salir adelante y por ello ha dedicado parte de su vida a trabajar constantemente y poco a poco ha sabido ganarse la admiración de toda su familia; él se dedica a la construcción es operario de albañil, tiene 15 años laborando; empezó como obrero y poco a poco fue escalando y ahora es operador de albañil, gana aproximadamente S/. 360 soles semanales. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de porcinos para la crianza ya que dicho negocio es rentable. Sus sueños y metas es poder implementar su negocio de chanchería y formar su propia crianza y ser reconocido. El Sr. Luis está muy agradecido por el  crédito otorgado ya que con ello va lograr mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a determined man who is always looking to get ahead. That's why he spends part of his life working incessantly, and little by little he has won the admiration of his entire family. He has worked in construction as a bricklayer for 15 years; he started as a laborer and worked his way up, little by little, to a skilled bricklaying position. He earns approximately 360 Nuevos Soles per week. 

He is going to invest the loan into the purchase of pigs that he can raise, since that is a profitable business. His dream and goal is to start a pig raising business, form his own husbandry endeavor and gain recognition. Luis is very grateful for the loan offering because it will allow him to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 34, runs a transportation business through a mini truck. He lives with his two children and wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, located in Kherlen town of Dornod, a province of Mongolia. He has been managing his business since 2007 and could buy a small sized land with his business earnings. Before starting his business, he used to work as a driver in the Mongolian Border Defense Force for many years but had to leave his job due to an illness. 

Now he is planning to boost his income by buying a new truck of a larger size than what currently he has. Having a new truck will benefit him business and help him improve his family's living conditions. Therefore he is requesting a loan to cover the payment for purchasing the new truck.

loans.use: cover the payment for purchasing a new truck.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Marites has a vulcanizing shop that provides motor repairs with her husband as the main repairman. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools needed and to pay for the electricity for the services.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools needed and pay for the electricity for the services.

loans.name: Deysi Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo  se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, este lugar se lo conoce porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca y de allí su nombre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de tres años y seis meses. Su esposo es agente vendedor. Ella lleva dos años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Doña Deysi es una mujer muy trabajadora pues ella trabaja de asistente contable en una pequeña empresa en la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja de tres  a cuatro días de la semana pero por las noches, también vende en su lugar de trabajo a compañeros de trabajo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. 

 Su sueño es tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The “Caminantes de Cristo” communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras.  This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

We met Daysi, 26, here.  She’s married and has a three-and-a-half-year-old son.  Her husband’s a salesman.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the ease in getting loans.

Daysi is a very hardworking woman because she’s employed as an accountant’s assistant in a small firm in the city and she also is a merchant.  She sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and works from three to four days a week during the evenings.  She also sells to her coworkers at her place of employment.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She’s been in this activity for four years and does very well.  This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  Her dream is to have a commercial locale.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Geodolo

texts.en: Geodolo is 52 years old and lives in Bardnersville, Liberia.  She is married and has five children between 22 and 35 years of age.  She did not go to school, but for the past eleven years she has been operating a restaurant.  She makes a lot of profit and she continues to increase the number of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her business.  She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, and onion for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un douanier à la retraite depuis 8 mois.Il est marié et père de 7 enfants , tous à l'école.Sa famille est encore à sa charge.C'est pourquoi il s'est reconverti à l'élevage pour améliorer ses revenus.Il achète des moutons à l'intérieur du pays pour les revendre dans sa localité.Il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter 10 moutons et des aliments de bétail.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un magasin de vente de denrées alimentaires .
texts.en: This borrower retired from being a customs officer eight months ago. He is married and father to seven children, all at school. He still has to provide for his family and this is why he has switched to raising animals to increase his income. He buys sheep inland in order to resell them in his town. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to buy ten sheep and food for livestock. His ambition is to open a grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep and food for livestock.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a 28-year-old, hardworking man from Homabay County. He is married to Millicent and they have two children.

Kevin operates a carpentry business where he makes household items like chairs, tables and others. He has done this for the last five years and is now taking his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use it to buy wood, nails, glue and other materials for his carpentry business.

He hopes to make profits and use it to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and glue for the carpentry workshop

loans.name: Munafa Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Munafa” group. These women are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000.00 SLL each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mariatu is the leader of this group. Mariatu is 43 years old and married with five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Mariatu sells pepper, palm-oil, cabbages, and other products. She has been doing business for the past six years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy eight gallons of palm-oil to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy eight gallons of palm-oil for sale.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en: Wambua is a hardworking businessman who is 25 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He runs a retail shop to make a living. He also does farming to increase his income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. Wambua has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy bread, sugar and rice for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy bread, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: La señora Sofía se dedica a la venta de peluches en la feria principal de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más mercadería para poner variedad y ofrecer a su  clientela peluches de varios colores, tamaños y formas en la época de navidad. Sofía tiene tres   hijos de los cuales uno de ellos ya es independiente .Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona  16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Sofía es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y esta es la primera vez que su solicitud se envía a  Kiva.
texts.en:
Sofía sells stuffed animals at the main fair in the city of El Alto.

The loan that she needs is to buy more merchandise in order to put out more variety.  She wants to offer her customers different colors, sizes, and shapes of stuffed animals for the Christmas season.

Sofía has three children; one of them is already independent.  She lives in her parents’ house in the 16 de Julio zone in the city of El Alto.

Sofía has been a client of Impro since 2008.  This is the first time that her request has been sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy different colors, shapes, and sizes of stuffed animals to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anizah

texts.en:
Anizah is 29 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Anizah works very hard to provide for them.

Anizah runs a business of buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Anizah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is 34 years old and single. His business is repairing worn out shoes. He has been in the business for 4 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to have a good life and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for KES 25,000 to buy leather, soles and glue.

loans.use: To buy leather, soles and glue.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt: O senhor Albino vive numa casa propria com três filhos e a esposa. É militar. Com o presente empréstimo vai adquirir bens para o uso doméstico nomeadamente um colchão medicinal e uma mobilia de sala de jantar composta por uma mesa de 8 cadeiras. Tem como sonho ter a sua casa terminada e com melhores condições habitacionais, adquirir uma viatura e profissionalmente sendo capitão almeja atingir a patencia de Major. Para tal precisa terminar o nivel superior, para melhorar as condições precisa de se beneficiar de mais empréstimo na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mr. Albino lives in a house he owns with three children and his wife. He's in the military. 

With this loan he will buy products for domestic use: a medicinal mattress and a dining room set made up of a table and 8 chairs. 

He dreams of finishing the building work on his house and improving his living conditions, buying a vehicle and reaching the rank of Major as he is currently a captain. In order to do this he needs to complete his higher education and in order to improve his living conditions he needs to solicit a further loan from Hluvuku.

loans.use: buy products for domestic use: a medicinal mattress and a dining room set made up of a table and 8 chairs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 49 years old, married with four children. One of whom is in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
41-year-old Elbrus with his 3 children settled in Salyan region Yenikand village. His family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region. Since 1991 Elbrus has been engaged in butchery to improve his family’s living condition. As he didn\'t have enough funds, he couldn\'t develop his business well enough in the beginning. 
Having borrowed 3 loans from Komak Credit Union  Elbrus significantly expanded his business, bought a lot of cows and calfs, achieved progress in his business and increased his family income.The loans were paid back timely.
He applies for a loan amount of $1500 to buy 20 calves.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet’s husband died of cancer and she must support her 3 children. Duy, the eldest, and Cam Vy, her second, stopped going to school. They were very short of money as Duy had to work as a day laborer to earn money to pay for their father's treatment. Cam Vy helps her mother make pudding, sweet soup, and stewed fruit to sell at a small market. Do, the youngest, is in grade 9.

Tuyet has a small hut with a clay floor. She has only 2000 square meters for growing rice. Mrs Tuyet has repaid her second loan of $50. Tuyet’s family income has increased $1.8/person/month. Her average income is now $11.5 person/month. Now, she want to borrow $75 for her sweet soup business, and for growing rice.

loans.use: Selling sweet soup and stewed fruit

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en: Mrs. Kiem and her husband are both 42 years old. They have 3 children who are between the ages of 9 and 17. They have to support two children who are going to school. They have about 5500 square meters for growing rice and cassava. Mr. Khuong, her husband works as a daily laborer, but this work is only for 6 months in the dry season. Mrs. Kiem and the first son work on their land. A loan from the project helped their family to buy fertilizer for rice and cassava, and their income increased by $1.5/person/month, which averages out to $12/person/month. They are requesting a loan of $100 to improve their rice field and cassava land. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for rice and cassava

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married, mother of two children who are in school. She is an active member of Rurii Mwimuto women group. She has a salon business which is the only source of income. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard towards its success. Elizabeth would like to buy varieties of hair chemicals and makeup materials for her salon. She is applying a loan to be able to buy them at once then she will be repaying her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy chemicals for her salon business

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar is a young man who, upon finding out that his father had been laid off by the paper business where he worked, also saw in his own home urgent economic need. He asked his father's permission to leave school and begin an ecological project that was his father's idea, since they were going through a hard time financially. He was able to achieve his father's dream.

Omar is asking for a loan of $925 USD with a term of 6 months to maintain his machinery and be able to continue developing his father's dream to have financial security and support their family, as a way to repay all the support his father has given him.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Omar es una persona soltera a la que al enterarse de que a su padre lo había despedido de la empresa papelera donde trabajaba y en su hogar el ver la urgente necesidad económica le pidió a su padre permiso para dejar de estudiar y permitirle iniciar el proyecto ecológico de su padre ya que pasaban por una carencia económica muy fuerte, logro desarrollar el sueño de su padre.

Omar esta solicitando un préstamo de USD $ 925 con un plazo de 6 meses para mantenimiento de su maquinaria y poder seguir desarrollando el sueño de su padre a la vez de tener solvencia económica y poder mantener a su familia, agradeciendo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: Machinery Maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify her product offerings

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.en:
Makhbuba is a low income vulnerable woman. She is 39, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Makhbuba and her husband (pictured) have a scant herd of milk cows and sell 60 liters of milk per day to the local milk processing shop and super market. The trade is good and Makhbuba can see that she could sell more milk. This requires more cattle in the herd and so Makhbuba decided to buy a calf to breed to increase monthly income. She applied for a $500 loan to Normicro's Saatli branch for the purpose to buy a calf and increase the number of cattle in her herd.

Note from Normicro Staff: Families the in Azeri countryside are usually male-dominated and, oftentimes, men do not allow people to take pictures of their wives. Looking after cows, harvesting, feeding stuff for cattle is done mainly by men yet the business is the wife's and the loan is requested by the wife.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Elvina

texts.es:
Elvina is a member of the community bank "Los Jasmines", located in the province and district of Moyobamba in the San Martín region. She works selling a variety of cooked legumes from her sales stall in the wholesale food market in the city of Moyobamba.

With this loan of 2000 soles (Peruvian currency) which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy sacks of legumes, both those grown in the jungle region (local legumes such as fréjol huasca, chiclayo) and those produced in the coastal regions (including local legumes known as fréjol canaria and caballero, along with peas, large white lima beans, broad beans and lentils). This will allow her to offer variety to her clientele every day.

At 44, Elvina is a woman concerned about helping her children move ahead. She longs to market bread and cheeses fromn the city of Chachapoyas to complement her fruit sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvina es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Jasmines”, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de menestras cocinadas en sus diferente variedades, los mismos que ofrece en su puesto de ventas ubicado en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Moyabamba.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará menestras en sacos, tanto los que se producen en la región de la selva: fréjol huasca, chiclayo, como lo que se produce en la región de la costa y sierra: fréjol canario, caballero, alverjas, pallares, habas, lentejas y de esa manera ofrecer variedad diariamente a su basta clientela.

Elvira con sus 44 años es una mujer muy preocupada por sus hijos para sacarles adelante. Anhela comercializar panes y quesos de la ciudad de Chachapoyas para complementar su venta .

loans.use: Purchase of legumes (frijoles, lentils, peas, white lima beans, broad beans, etc.)

loans.name: Abdunosir

texts.ru:
Abdunosir F., 38, lives in Vahdat, Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Abdunosir’s main occupation is a driver. In addition, he is farming cattle. Abdunosir plans to use this loan to purchase young bulls to be raised and then resold. Abdunosir plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзов Абдуносир Холбоевич житель города Вахдат.38 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее, по специальности водитель. Кроме того занимается животноводством, для чего и планирует получить кредит. Хочет купить молодых бычков для откормки и реализации. Этот вид деятельности поможет развитию фермерской деятельности, а также улучшить финансовое положение клиента. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Mrs. Filomena Calle lives in her own home, in the zone of Llojeta west of La Paz. She lives with her husband, Mr. Mario Titirico and their three children. Mrs. Filomena knits sweaters for a textile company and her husband works for a construction company.

The requested credit will be used for the construction of a bedroom (stucco and interior paint). This is the second time that they request a loan and their economic analysis qualifies them for it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Filomena Calle vive en casa propia, en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Mario Titirico y sus cinco hijos. La señora Filomena realiza tejidos de chompas a pedido para una tienda textil y su esposo trabaja como empleado de la construcción en una microempresa del ramo. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción en obra fina de una habitación (revoque de estuco y pintura interior). Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Completion of a bedroom in her house

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina J., who comes from the small town of Raiwind, Pakistan, is married with two children: one girl and one boy. Both of her children attend a local school and she hopes that they will be able to do well so that they can find successful jobs in the future. Nagina’s husband, who is a rickshaw driver, had an accident with his rickshaw, and now they are in need of a loan to get it fixed.

There are several other women in her loan group including: Rubina B., who wants to invest in her wheat business; Ramzana B., who wants to expand her wood business; Parween N., who wants to get her rickshaw fixed and Rehana B., who will buy a donkey cart.

loans.use: Fix a rickshaw

loans.name: Malam

texts.en: Malam M. is 30 years old and married with a child.  He is a teacher in an orphanage school in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  With a low salary that could not sustain the family, Malam decided to learn a skill in the afternoon after teaching.   He learned to repair phones and is now providing service to the public.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to establish a workshop and purchase cell phones for sale. Malam  would repay the loan from his salary and business income.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Gam A 2021-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Zebeda J., who is in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to construct a swimming pool at her home. Married to a policeman, Zebeda is 35 years old and the mother of three children ranging from age 2 to 20 who all attend school. Each week Zebeda makes approximately 200 Sudanese pounds in profits, and her goal is to expand the business.

Zebeda is joined in her small group by Susan Y., Esther K., Antonata S., and Mary K.. Susan Y. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy goats for rearing. Esther K. sells charcoal and other goods including milk and sweets at her shop and wants a loan to expand her business. Antonata S. operates a business selling green vegetable and wants to create a small irrigation system for the farm. Mary K. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To construct a swimming pool at her home.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun B., 58, and her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Khat, 58, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married during the Pol Pot regime and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is married and another one is a silk weaver. Two sons are in a local school and one is in university.

Mrs. Saroeun has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Sokhorn is a farmer. He grows rice, tomatoes, and corn on his farm.

Saroeun is requesting a loan of US$100 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil was born in 1947. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan and is settled in the town of Khirdalan. This man is married, with 4 children. Kamil has been selling produce for 11 years. Now he needs a loan of $875 to buy vegetables and fruits to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and historical places. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. She has no children.

Fozia baji's husband is a driver by profession. He has been driving a rented vehicle called an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle) for the last 5 years. Fozia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw so they won't have to pay rent.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Suraiya baji and Shamim baji and Rashida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Shamim baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Marta Alberto

texts.pt:
Marta Alberto M. nasceu no bairro periférico da cidade de Maputo e tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 22, 20, 15 e 4 anos de idade respectivamente, para alem dos seu filhos sustenta uma enteada e um sobrinho que vive com e as vezes ajuda os seus pais em um valor monetário.

Marta estudou ate 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condições para custear os seu estudos, nasceu e cresceu juntos com os seus pais, nunca mudou se de cidade ou província, aos 18 anos se casou e desde então vivem de negocio.

Marta a 10 anos que gere um negocio de tipo loja onde vende roupa e diversos produtos de género alimentício. Abre o estabelecimento as 7_00h e fecha as 18:00h, com tudo tem a destacar as roupas com mais rendimento e saída onde vende um fato por 2000,00mt umas calças por 500,00mt, umas saias variando de 400, 500 e 600,00mt respectivamente. Tem um rendimento mensal variando entre 20000,00mt a 25000,00mt.

Este será o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva com qual pretende aumentar as suas mercadorias e diversificação dos produtos. Conhece a Hluvuku através de amigas que eram clientes. Com o crescimento do negocio pretende construir uma mercearia e uma viatura com tudo conta com apoio do credito.
texts.en:
Marta Alberto M. was born on the outskirts of the city of Maputo and is 40 years old with four children. They're aged 22, 20, 15, and 4, respectively. Besides her children, she supports a stepdaughter and a nephew, who live with them, and sometimes she helps her parents financially. Maria studied until 6th grade and quit due to lack of resources to fund her studies. She was born and raised with her parents, never moving from the city or state. At 18 years old she married, and since then has made her living in business. For the last ten years, Marta has managed a business selling clothing and various food items. She opens the establishment at 7 in the morning and closes at 6 in the evening. She needs to increase income and sales. She sells a suit for 2000 meticais, pants for 500, and skirts for 400, 500, or 600 meticais. She has a monthly income varying between 20000 and 25000 meticais. This will be her first loan with Hluvuku or Kiva. She plans to increase her merchandise and diversification of products. She heard of Hluvuku through friends who were clients. With the growth of her business, she plans to construct a store and get transport. For all of this, she counts on credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of clothing and food

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos Antonio R., tiene 5 años de antigüedad en el rubro del Transporte publico, nacio en la ciudad de cochabanba, Bolivia y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, Bolivia donde refiere que tiene mejores perspectivas laborales. Vive en el domicilio de sus padres. El credito será para la reparacion del motor de su vehículo por lo que acudió a Emprender por recomendación de un amigo El Sr. Marcos Antonio R. tiene 2 hijos pequeños y con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo ayuda a mantener su hogar y a hacer estudiar a sus hijos es socio de la linea de micros 38 y trabaja con mucho esmero.
texts.en:
Mr Marcos Antonio R. has worked for 5 years in public transportation. He was born in the city of Cochabanba, Bolivia, and lives in the city of Santa Cruz, Bolivia, where he believes exists the best prospects for work. He lives with his parents. The loan, of which he learned about through a friend, will be used to repair his vehicle's engine. Mr Marcos Antonio R. has two children. His income allows him to maintain his home and support his children's education. He is a member of the 38 micros and works with great dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his vehicle's engine

loans.name: Hajran Imtiaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Hajran baji is 34 years old and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 30 years. Hajran baji is a seamstress. She charges $2 to $3 per suit stitching. Her husband is I. A., a ticket checker in a local bus. He also has ten years of experience in wholesale work. He buys wheat and rice wholesale and sells to the required customers. Hajran baji is applying for a loan to buy wheat and rice for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Amna baji wants a loan to buy clothes and colored thread for her decorative embroidery business. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zubaida baji wants a loan to repair her motorbikes for her motorbike rental business. Farhana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice wholesale; embroidery materials; an auto-rickshaw; and clothes to resell; and to repair motorbikes

loans.name: Mumtaz Abbas Ali Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 37 years old and married. She lives in the city of Borewala, in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the past 20 years. She completed school through the 6th standard. She couldn’t study further because she started learning art of stitching and embroidery from her mother. 

Her husband is A. A., who is a cobbler by profession. He has 20 years of experience in this business. Mumtaz helps him in this business by embroidering the shoes he makes. They have five children: four sons and one daughter. Her first two sons manufacture furniture. The other children are enrolled in a local school. She successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, beads, and leather) the couple will use to manufacture shoes. 

She is the leader of three people asking for this loan as a group. Ghulam Fatima wants a loan to buy rugs for resale. Sobia Tariq wants a loan to buy computers. She plans to run a computer institute to make the children of her community computer literate. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe making

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 34 years old and lives with her parents, sister and brother. She had been employed with a company but now earns a living growing rice and crops with her sister and brother. She wants to reinvest in her farmland, so she has decided to take out a loan of US $1000 to purchase rice, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase rice, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel T. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high. Emmanuel is a carpenter who is specialized in making furniture at Tatermu near Elmina, a business which he started not too long ago. Emmanuel uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more wood and carpentry tools and equipment for the enhancement of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for building a house so that he can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for himself.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and carpentry tools, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Vásquez  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
El señor Pedro trabaja como empleado en una cooperativa Minera en una población cercana a la ciudad de La Paz. y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa..
Su vivienda, por la antigüedad presenta deterioro de los muros interiores en tres habitaciones, las que serán refaccionadas con el crédito solicitado.
Esta es la tercera que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro Vásquez lives in his own home in the area of Villa Exaltación in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two children. Señor Pedro works as an employee in a mining cooperative in a town near the city of La Paz. His wife is a housewife. Their house, because of its age, has deteriorating interior walls in three rooms, which will be refurbished with the requested credit. This is the third time that they are requesting a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies them favorably so they can gain access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of refurbishing the interior walls of three rooms in their house.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Leonarda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Leonarda se dedica a la venta de comida en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, los días domingos vende comida típica como mondongo y Puca.
Leonarda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la refacción de su casa para trasladar su restaurante.
Leonarda sueña con mejorar su negocio y sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Leonarda is a member of the “Florecer” (“To Flower”) cooperative bank. Leonarda is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Leonarda dedicates herself to the sale of food from a rented location, an activity she conducts every day. On Sundays, she sells typical foods such as mondongo (tripe) and Puca (a beef and potato dish). Leonarda needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in refurbishing her house so she can move her restaurant there. Leonarda dreams of improving her business, and for her children to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish her house and move her restaurant there.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Mrs. Elma T. is 47 years old, married and lives at Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Her other source of income is from making nipa huts (the native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof using nipa leaves). She obtained a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and started to buy nipa. Last May 2005, she became an official member of the cooperative. She was impressed by the programs and services that PMPC offers and that’s why she joined. Now, she applies for PHP 10,000 to buy additional nipa to be used on nipa huts.

loans.use: to buy nipa for nipa hut making

loans.name: Jennypher Carolina

texts.es: La Señora  Jennypher  Carolina R. es originario de la zona 4 del departamento de Totonicapan ella su activid principal es la elaboracion de Canastos manueales  dicha actividad lo aprendio en las manualidades que realizaba en la escuela  recibio un curso en el Intecap para fortalecer sus conocimientos  y se contacto con un cliente para hacer un pedido y la cual le fue muy bien. Al mismo tiempo le sugio iniciar su propio negocio que tambien le esta funcionando, hoy necesita de un credito para ampliar su negocio ya que los materiales que utiliza son muy caros al compralos por unidad y con el credito estara  comprar por mayor le resulta muy favorable el precio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jennypher Carolina R. is originally from zone 4 of Totonicapan state. Her principle activity is making baskets. She learned this craft in school and took a course in Intecap to strengthen her knowledge and a customer contacted her to place an order, and that went well. At that time it was suggested to her that she start her own business that she is now also running. Today she needs a loan to expand her business as the materials she uses are very expensive to buy individually and with this loan she can buy at wholesale which will result in a more favorable price.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making crafts

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 4. She also cares for an additional dependent.

She has owned a small food store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works at her business for eight hours every day and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $60.

She belongs to the Msimamo group loan (Group code 2015) and is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She plans to use the loan to add more items to her current stock and expand her business. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to increase profits, grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock and expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: La señora Maria Nicolása, tiene la edad de 42 años, casada y con  tres hijos dos trabajan y uno cursa los  estudios, su esposo trabaja de chofer, y reside en el barrio 19 de Febrero de la cooperativa dos de Agosto 2 cuatro abajo en la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de  cosméticos y perfumes, desde hace diez años el cual inicio con ahorros, y las costura que ha sido un medio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de ropa, cosmético, y poder ofertar variedad a sus clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por el desarrollo que ha obtenido en su inversión de comercio ya que gracias a los créditos a la largo plazos ha podido generar beneficios en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Maria Nicolása is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children work and one is in school. Her husband is a driver. She lives in the 19 de Febrero neighborhood and is in the 2 de Agosto cooperative in the capital city of Managua. Her business is selling cosmetics and perfumes, which she began 10 years ago with her own savings. Sewing has also been a medium for helping her husband with their expenses. With this, her ninth loan from Afodenic, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and cosmetics to be able to offer a greater variety to her customers. She thanks the institution for the commercial development she has achieved, because the long-term loans have enabled her to benefit in her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the town of La Union, San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Wilma is married and has three small children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Wilma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: La Union, San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: El grupo “Lucero” esta representado por la señora Cecilia y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando juntas su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento con sus pagos. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a actividades comerciales como ser la venta de cosméticos, ropa, comida, pan y masitas en general. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The group “Lucero” is led by Cecilia and consists of 12 members who are now in their second loan cycle together; they have demonstrated responsibility and have fulfilled their payments. The majority of the members run businesses in the sale of cosmetics, clothing, food, bread, and general pastries. Competition in the commercial sector is high but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and drive to work. The loan will be used to acquire materials, supplies, and tools that will help the group generate higher incomes; their families depend on this income and it will afford them a better quality of life. The group has some new members but they are familiar with the loan system and solidarity groups and they are responsible, honest, and hard working people.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation capital (to acquire materials, supplies, and tools).

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 49 years old. Betty is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Betty owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for more than 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

On March 19, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She just finished paying her previous loan of 4,000 PHP. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suma Chuyma Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena Q. es integrante del grupo “Suma Chuyma” que a su vez es parte del Centro Focal “Los Andes” ella tiene 34 años y hace 2 años inicio el negocio de costura de balones, esta actividad la aprendió de uno de sus tíos, vende su producto en diferentes ferias  tales como  la 16 de Julio, Tumusla y otros. Se animó a ingresar a “Suma Chuyma” por invitación a una de sus amigas y porque necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como el cuero y cuerina con los que elabora los balones.

Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de muebles, lana, juguetes, ropa, verduras  y necesitan del crédito para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Maria Elena Q. is a member of the group "Suma Chuyma" (Good Spirit, in Quechua) which, in turn, is part of "Los Andes" focal center. She is 34 years old and started a business sewing soccer balls two years ago. She learned this work from her uncles and sells her products in different markets such as 16 de Julio, Tumusla, and others. She decided to join "Suma Chuyma" after receiving an invitation from one of her friends and because she needed a loan to buy raw materials used to make balls, such as leather and vinyl. The other group members also have their own businesses selling furniture, yarn, toys, clothing, and vegetables, and need loans in order to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (leather and vinyl) and merchandise.

loans.name: María Binicia

texts.es: María Binicia R. H., reside en San Martin municipio del departamento  San Salvador. María tiene 41 años de edad es madre soltera de tres niños aun menores de edad  y estudiantes. María posee su propio negocio de confección de ropa, en taller de María  se elaboran variedad de  vestidos para niñas; que luego María los comercializa en varios puestos de mercado de San Martin, el crédito que solicita María es para compra de insumos que le permitan aumentar su producción de vestidos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Talif

texts.en: Talif R. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in the resturant and is requesting a loan to stock foodstuffs to cook and sell .  Talif is 25 years old and is Married with a husband that is a builder. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase motor bike for carrying passengers BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her resturant

loans.name: Mirembe Group Nuru Nanyojo

texts.en: Nuru N. is a business woman of forty-five years old and the president of her group loan, she is married with eleven children where by six are going to school and she has four dependents schooling too. She deals with fresh food business since the year 2006. She is requesting for the loan to be purchasing more fresh food that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, pumpkins, etc for sale. She wishes to expand on her grocery and more so educate her children for the better of their future.

loans.use: To be purchasing more fresh food that is bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, pumpkins, etc for sale.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 40, is married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. S. sells fish at a local market in her province, and earns approximately $18 USD per day. Her husband works in the agriculture sector, raising cows and growing rice seasonally. He earns $3 USD per day.

The couple work hard every day in the field during the rainy season in order to ensure a good standard of living for the family. S. also has to commute to market every morning to sell fish to her existing customers because she hopes that her fish-selling business will help her to achieve a better standard of living. S. is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase cows for her husband to raise more livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Geogracias

texts.en:
Geogracias B., from the village of Coca St.SWP, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, is 53 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Geogracias owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from handicraft business and whose main income comes directly from selling his handmade work product and he is actively a band member of the church and actively serving the church. Engaged in the business for over a year and he earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Geogracias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for the business. This will be his first loan from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials

loans.name: Goeglino

texts.en:
Goeglino O. is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

Goeglino would like to get a loan to purchase additional groceries. She is planning to purchase a variety of groceries and will significantly expand her groceries business.

Goeglino is 38 years old, married and has four children. She is married to Mr. O. who is a farmer. Her children are doing well in school. She is a committed LAPO client.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Mr. Khin S. is 38 years old and resides in an area of Reusey Kao Commune in Phnom Penh capital, where he lives with his family and other members. He now has five teenage children. One of his daughters works sewing clothing and the remaining four attend school. His wife, Sophal, 43, is a local farmer. To make a living, Khin S. works as a security guard for a garment company. He will use his first loan to buy a plot of land as well as buy rice to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land and to buy rice.

loans.name: Terere Group 2, Mukono

texts.en: M. Ibrahim is a hardworking man. He is married with school-aged children and has a fishing business that he carries out from Terere site, his home area. Fishing is a job that Ibrahim learnt at an early age due to the fact that it is the major activity in the area in addition to farming. From his fishing business, Ibrahim has been able to buy himself a motorcycle that he uses for transportation services and to carry his fish to the market, as well as to buy himself cows that give him milk to sell. Ibrahim needs a loan to be able to buy a fishing net and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Remedios' Group

texts.en:
Remedios G. is from the village of Mabini, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 53 years old. Remedios is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Remedios is widowed and has 5 adult children. Remedios owns & operates a business producing and selling food. Her main income comes from selling cooked food for daily meals. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Remedios from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a cash reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Joseph M.

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old, married, and he has two children.  He is a welder and his wife is a petty trader dealing in assorted soft drinks. Joseph left school in form 4 as a dropout.  He has been a welder for the last ten years.  He worked for a boss who trained him in welding for eight years. Two years ago, Joseph decided to establish his own metal workshop.

He said that the demand for metal doors and windows has increased over the years because of the upsurge of armed robberies.  He is not able to meet all the orders placed by customers because he is limited by inadequate working capital and too little equipment.  That is the main reason why Joseph needs the loan.  

He wants to buy more machines, welding equipment and materials so as to increase his production. If he is successful, he wants to erect his own house. Joseph is very enthusiastic and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy machines and welding equipment

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Kusi KilL. que significa Luna Alegre en quechua, inicia su sexto ciclo con 19 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. frutas, lácteos, artesanía, abarrotes en general, cosméticos, panes, tubérculos, quesos, ropa, servicio D. transporte y tejido D. chompas.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Vilma que es presidenta D. su banco Comunal, Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Vilma venD. ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos, familiares sus ventas son al crédito, además Vilma venD. comida en una feria, Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, ropa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, haciendo un total D. 10,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, verduras, frutas, lanas, leche, artesanía, papa y panes.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener un restaurante, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Kusi KilL., which means "happy moon" in the local quechua language, is beginning its sixth cycle with 19 members. The members all work at different businesses, such as sales of fruit, dairy products, handicrafts, grocery and every day household items, cosmetics, breads, cheeses, clothing, and transportation.

Such is the case of Vilma, the president of her communal bank. Vilma is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Vilma sells clothing to her friends and acquaintances on credit. She also sells food at the local market. Vilma needs her portion of the loan to purchase rice, sugar and clothing.

The members each need different amounts from the total loaned by the bank. They will use the money to purchase fruits and vegetables, rice, dairy products, handicrafts, potatoes and bread. The members share the dream of growing their respective businesses so that their children can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to help each of the members grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara O. is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. In 1994 she started a salon after quitting selling vegetables, as a source of generating income so as to be able to provide basic needs to her children and have her own house. She restocks her salon after a fortnight with goods bought within Kisumu town. Due to the size of her business (which is very small), she has decided to request Ksh.20,000 in form of a loan so as to boost her business by increasing her stock. That will see her income increase with an increase in customers and she will be able to repay it while at the same time saving for future use.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina E. makes bamboo furniture for a living. She has been engaged in her business for more than 28 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a week. In 1997, she joined ASHI to secure access to financial support to help improve her living condition and her ability to engage in more entrepreneurial business activities. She and her husband, Jaime, have successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Their business is continuing to grow, so Angelina is seeking a loan of 25,000 pesos to pay for raw materials including bamboo, rope, nails and other items needed to make furniture.  Angelina requests this loan so that she can sustain the growth of her business and be able to meet the increasing demands of her regular customers. Having this opportunity to receive a loan from Kiva through ASHI will provide a chance to achieve her ambition in life: To renovate her family's home, to earn a good living and to have the financial means to support her family and fund the college education of her children.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to make bamboo furniture

loans.name: Kimberly Ann

texts.en: Kimberly Ann A. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Kimberly Ann is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Kimberly Ann makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Kimberly Ann has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Kimberly Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kimberly Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Kimberly Ann is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to increase her working capital, thereby allowing her to cook more and sell more snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Kimberly Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Wadii

texts.en:
Wadii is a 55-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and child. Fifty-five years ago, he decided to open a mini-market in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. He sells canned food, bread, dairy items, candies, chips, soft drinks and also fruits and vegetables. His mini-market is well known in his region because of his good reputation, welcoming attitude and also because he has competitive prices. This allows him to have a growing number of customers pass by his shop and buy all types of food products. 

Today, Wadii is requesting to borrow $2,000 to increase his purchases of such items as food products, soft drinks, juices, etc., to increase his sales and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To increase his purchases

loans.name: Gerlee

texts.en: Gerlee V. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Baynhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a “ger.” Her oldest son, Dandorj, attends university. Her middle son, Tsedendorj, attends a local secondary school. Her youngest son, Batzorig, is in primary school. Gerlee operates a recycling business in her town. She collects and sells bottles and plastic containers for recycling. She has been operating her business since 2008 and has steadily expanded her business. Previously, Gerlee operated a second-hand products trading business between 2003 and 2008. She is an experienced trader who has great communication skills. Gerlee is an industrious person and has many plans for the future. She says, “My dream is to one day create my own recycling factory.”  She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and to rent another storage place for the materials to be recycled.

loans.use: To rent storage facility for recycling business

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa D. est un comptable retraité âgé de 71 ans. Depuis sa retraite, il s'est lancé dans l'agriculture.Il compte des terres que lui avaient léguées ses parents et qui se sirtuent  dans une zone essentiellement agricole. Il sollicite cependant auprès de U-IMCEC un pre^t de 300 000 FCFA pour acheter de l'engrais afin d'assurer pour ses prochaines récoltes une production importante.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D., aged 71, is a retired accountant.  Since retiring, he got started in agriculture.  He has land that his parents had handed down to him.  It is located in what is basically a farming area.  He is however requesting from U-IMCEC a loan of 300,000 francs CFA for buying manure in order to ensure significant production for the harvests to follow.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying manure

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai T. T. was born in 1971. She has a carpentry workshop. She has three children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband is a carpenter. Mrs. Gai and her husband work together. They produce furniture out of wood (beds, tables, etc.). They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). This is the first time Mrs Gai is participating in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 23 years old, married and has one child.  He has been selling shoes for three years.  Besides, he runs a retail shop. He joined Githurai Vison group in Faulu Kenya. He has gained business ideas through the group.  He also saves money weekly with the group during their meetings.  He is asking for 20,000 KES to buy a stock of shoes to sell. He hopes to provide for his son's quality education.  He wants to move his shop to the city centre, which has a busy environment, in the next 10 years so as to get more customers.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina T. is from the town of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 53 years old. Rufina is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rufina owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rufina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rufina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
