Rufina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rufina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Rufina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lando

texts.en: Lando A. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 37 years old. Lando is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lando raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Lando has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Lando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lando is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lando from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion E. is from the village of Francfort, in Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Concepcion’s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. J. is from the village of Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 29 years old. Oscar is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar plants and harvests rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 45000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Oscar is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Thomas Kiplagat

texts.en:
Thomas Kiplagat C. is a tailor. He is 43 years old and married to Rose Jepkorir Koech. They have four children who are 22, 18, 15, and 12 years old. Thomas earns a profit of 8,500 KES per month from his tailoring business.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully paying back the other loans. He plans to use the loan to buy fabric for making clothes and a modern sewing machine. These items will help him to provide better service to customers.

With the anticipated profits from his expanded business he hopes to begin selling on a wholesale basis in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To buy fabric and a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Batamar Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de BATAMAR est créé le 15 octobre 2010 lors de son inauguration. Il est composé de 42 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les deux principales activité du Banc Villageois est le petit commerce et le maraichage. 

Madame Fatou D. levant la main au milieu du groupe est Présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de deux dans ce domaine d'activité.

Avec son premier crédit avec CAURIE-MF elle va étendre son activité pour accroitre ses bénéfices et réaliser une épargne.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en de la gestion familiale
texts.en:
The “Banc Villageois” of BATAMAR was created October 15, 2010 when it was inaugurated. It is made up of 42 women from the same village. The two main businesses of the Banc Villageois are retail sales and market gardening.

Mrs. Fatou D., who is raising her hand in the middle of the group, is the president of the Banc Villageois. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children. She sells vegetables. She has more than two years' experience in this business.

With her first loan through CAURIE-MF she is going to expand her business in order to increase her profits and have some savings. Her goal is to help her husband with the family management.

loans.use: Build a business selling vegetables

loans.name: Paola Zuleyma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.  Paola;   ella tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus estudios de enfermería, la socia actualmente se encuentra haciendo un curso de especialización en enfermería “Salud Ocupacional”; ella acabo la carrera de enfermería y está haciendo varios cursos para complementar sus estudios realizados. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertirlo en su curso de especialización. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the community bank "ÑAHUPACMAN PURISUN."  The community bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, and Cusco department.  The member is Ms. Paola.  She is 25 years old and single.  This member alternates between her home activities and her nursing studies.  This member now is taking a specialized nursing course called "Occupational Health".  She finished her degree in nursing and is now taking various courses to compliment her completed studies.  This member needs the loan to invest in her specialization course.  This member asks for a loan to invest in her studies.  This member is grateful for and values the loan given through these means and in the same way she promises to fulfill the payments in the established time frame

loans.use: This member asks for a loan to invest in her studies.

loans.name: Hermer Antonio

texts.es:
Hermer de 49 años de edad, reside en Cacaopera departamento de Morazán, vive con sus hijos Elmer Esteban de 8 años, Santos Francisco de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a la reparación de televisores y equipos de sonido tiene su propio taller, Hermer estudio electrónica es por eso que se dedica a este oficio su horario de servicio es de 7:00am a 4:00pm, pero como todo negocio siempre existe una desventaja y en este caso es que los clientes cuando ya están reparados sus electrodomésticos no llegan a recogerlos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos usados y nuevos, ya que en momentos este es un obstáculo para realizar los trabajos que le llegan, con este préstamo el espera poder contar con distintas clases de repuestos que le permita dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
El sueño de él es cancelar puntualmente sin inconvenientes, en un futuro me gustaría comprar un vehículo para realizar reparaciones a domicilio de esta manera obtener ingresos para crecer y apoyar a sus hijos y poder financiarles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Hermer is 49 years old and resides in Cacaopera, a Department of Morazan.  He lives with his sons: Elmer Esteban of 8 years old and Santos Francisco of 4 years old.  He repairs televisions and sound equipment and has his own workshop.  Hermer chose this profession because he studied electricity.  His hours of operation are from 7:00am to 4:00pm.  Like any business, there are always disadvantages and in his case, its that the customers don't always come to pick up their item once it has been repaired.  

Currently, he is applying for this loan in order to purchase used and new spare parts, which sometimes prevents him from completing the jobs given to him.  With this loan, he hopes to be able to obtain a variety of spare parts that would permit him to provide his clients with better service.  In the future, he would like to purchase a vehicle so that he can make home repairs and earn a better living to be able to support and raise his children and pay for their university studies.

loans.use: Purchase of used and new spare parts

loans.name: Keen Kipiko

texts.en:
Keen Kipiko, aged 23, runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” at Bissil in Kajiado. He is married to Faith Nashulae and together they have one child, Keen. He was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

Keen has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his first loan with KADET. With the loan, he plans to purchase another motorbike and employ one person to operate it as he supervises. If this loan improves the business, he plans to buy more motor bikes.

Keen is hardworking and ambitious, and dreams of having many motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañía Aguaity, Barrio Huyvaty de la cuidad de Eusebio Ayala que dista a 21 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Victoriana Martínez ella se dedica a la venta de helados y comestibles,  ella es madre soltero vive sola con su hijo, ella es muy sacrificada trabaja  muy duro para que su hijo pueda estudiar.

La Sra. Victoriana vende helados, hielo,  remedios refrescantes y comestibles por la zona, sale todos los días por las mañanas a vender sus productos por la compañía de Aguaity. 

Doña Victoriana está muy agradecida con la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el capital que le brindo para poder invertir en su negocio y así  tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su pequeño hijo.  
Solicita el préstamo para la compra materia prima para la fabricación de helados.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the Aguaity residential development, in the Huyvaty neighborhood of the city of Eusebio Ayala which is 21km from our Caacupé regional office.

The committee's president is Victoriana Martínez who sells frozen treats and food.  She is a single mother who lives alone with her son.  She is very selfless and works very hard so that her son can study.

Victoriana sells frozen treats, ice, traditional tonics and food in the area.  She goes out every morning to sell her products in the Aguaity residential development.

Victoriana is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the capital that they have given her so that she can invest in her business and thereby enjoy a better quality of life for herself and her young son.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making frozen treats.

loans.use: To buy materials for making frozen treats

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal "Amistad" inicia su septimo  ciclo con 16 socias.
Gardenia tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos, de 3, 7 y 8 años de edad. Durante el día trabaja en la tienda de su suegra. Por la noche vende juguetes en las calles de Ayacucho. Ella inició su negocio porque su hijo está muy enfermo y su tratamiento médico es muy costoso. Gardenia solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio y en el tratamiento médico de su hijo. Gardenia es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 1 año. A ella le gusta la facilidad de obtener un préstamo y las reuniones dos veces por semana y el calendario de amortización. Su sueño es que sus hijos crezcan sanos y salgan adelante.
texts.en:
The “Amistad” (Friendship) Communal Bank is starting its seventh cycle with 16 members.

Gardenia is 31 years old, and she has three children.  They are three, seven, and eight years old.  During the day she works in her mother-in-law’s store.  At night she sells toys on the streets of Ayacucho.  She started her business because her son is very sick, and his medical treatment is very expensive.

Gardenia is requesting the loan to invest in her business and for her son’s medical treatment.

Gardenia has been a member of FINCA Perú for one year.  She likes the ease of getting a loan, the twice a week meetings, and the amortization schedule.

Her dream is for her children to grow healthy and that they get ahead.

loans.use: To buy seasonal toys

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa B. is divorced. Adjoa sells drinks and bags of charcoal in Abura, which she has been doing for some time now. Adjoa wants to expand her business. She is therefore requesting to use the loan to buy additional bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jesinta

texts.en:
Jesinta has a mixed farm that produces coffee, miraa (an herbal stimulant), maize, bananas and vegetables which are all sold locally. She also operates a small business in her hometown of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.

Jesinta is 48 years old and a widowed mother of three children, ages 9, 13 and 25. Two of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to improve her dairy shed and start poultry farming. The extra income from this loan will enable her to improve her family's livelihood. Drought has been her major setback in the farming business.

loans.use: To improve her dairy shed and start poultry farming.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra L. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Myra is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Myra owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. She is also buying and selling vegetables like cabbage, squash and ube (purple yam). Myra has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Myra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myra is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es:
SERGIO ENRIQUE A. G., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJACOMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE CUATRO HIJOS Y TRES DE ELLOS ESTAN EN EL COLEGIO.
DON SERGIO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION. 
SERGIO DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA.
texts.en:
Sergio is from Managua and works as a security agent.  He is the father of a family with four children, three of whom are in school.

Sergio came to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan for improving his home.  He will invest in purchasing construction materials such as cement, sand, and blocks to finish constructing his house of residence.

Sergio says that thanks to the financing received from CEPRODEL he has been able to improve his house.

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO FINISH HIS HOME

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora Ana D. 34 años D. edad es costurera y está casada con el señor Diego D. 31 años D. edad, tienen dos hijos: una nena D. 5 años y un varón D. 2 años D. edad.
La pareja se dedica a la confección desD. hace más D. 2 años con mucho esfuerzo, actualmente ya cuenta con un taller propio. Anteriormente la señora trabajaba para otros pero con ayuda D. su cónyuge supo sacar adelante la micro empresa familiar, ya que el mismo realiza los pedidos para la venta como uniformes escolares, camperas, conjuntos deportivos, etc.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra D. telas para confecciones D. uniformes escolares ya que es temporada alta para dicho rubro y así estaría cumpliendo con todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana is 34 years old and works as a seamstress. She is married to Sr. Diego, age 31. They have two children, a five year old daughter and a two year old son.

This couple has been sewing for more than two years with great effort. They currently have their own workshop. Ana previously worked for other people, but with the help of her husband, she was able to move forward and start a family micro-enterprise. She receives orders for school uniforms, jackets, sportswear, and other items.

Ana is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy fabrics for producing school uniforms since demand is high during this season. This will enable her to satisfy all of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for producing school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, dishes and thioub

loans.name: Martun

texts.en: Martun T. lives in the village of Gorayk, in the Syunik region of Armenia. He keeps livestock. Martun wants to get engaged in farming but he doesn’t have enough financial means. He had already applied to SEF before. Now he wants to apply again to get a loan for buying seeds. Now Martun will develop agriculture and he will be able to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay for seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter L. is twenty-five-years-old, married and has two children aged five years old and two years old. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area located in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred as the "sugarbelt". 

Peter sells clothes to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to open outlets elsewhere. He also hopes to give his children quality education to the university level. He describes himself as hard-working and determined.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Blanca Graciela

texts.es:
Blanca de 30 años de edad, es soltera, tiene casa propia que cuenta con servicio agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Mórrope, a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de esta zona se dedican a  la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Blanca se dedica a la crianza, y venta  de animales (ovejas y aves de corral), desde hace 6 años, su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su domicilio. A sus animales los alimenta con comida  balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que llegan a su tamaño y peso ideal los vende en el mercado de su distrito o a comerciantes foráneos (personas de otros lugares). Sus ventas incrementaran sus ingresos para cubrir todos sus gastos diarios.  

Ha solicitado  Blanca un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para realizar unos arreglos en el interior de su casa, especialmente su sala que le falta piso y otros acabados.  Con la venta de sus animales va poder pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar  su calidad de vida, los logros adquiridos por Blanca es gracias a su esfuerzo, trabajo y lo responsable que es como persona.
texts.en:
Blanca is 30 years old and single.  She owns her own home which has piped water and electricity, and is located in Mórrope district, some 40 minutes from Lambayeque department.  The residents of this area work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Blanca has been raising and selling animals (sheep and poultry) for six years.  Her farmyard is located outside her home.  She feeds her animals balanced feed, grains and natural pasture.  Once they have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in her district market or to traders from outside her area.  Her sales provide her with income which she uses to cover all her daily expenses.

Blanca has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to carry out some repairs inside her home, especially to her living room which needs flooring and other finishing touches.  With the sale of her animals, she will be able to repay her loan and improve her quality of life.  Blanca has achieved what she has thanks to her effort, hard work and responsibility.

loans.use: to improve the interior of her home

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Maria; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de llantas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y ella vende de todos los tamaños, la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de llantas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas al por mayor.                                             
                          
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Ana María, 36, is single and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with her tire-selling business.  Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She sells all sizes of tires and has been able to provide for her children with the income from her business.  She would like to expand her activity and has requested a loan to buy wholesale tires.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Duraliza

texts.en:
Duraliza is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Duraliza has a shop that sells candies, biscuits, breads and canned goods. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy biscuits, snacks and beverages.

Duraliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Duraliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one child. Despite his young age, he has built up good experience working in floor covering for the past eight years. 

In 2010, he decided to work independently, sticking with multiple projects in his village and its surroundings. He has a good number of clients asking for his services. Today, he is asking to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools to continue the expansion of his business and  further increase his productivity. He feels positive about his business' potentiA. in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to expand his business and increase his productivity

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín tiene 36 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Morropón en Piura.

Martín se dedica a la dirección de obras de construcción, es albañil desde hace 10 años y cuenta  con gran experiencia en su rubro, lo que le ha permitido tener clientela establecida en la zona.

Martín solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles  para comprar herramientas, como tablas andamios, que le permitan continuar con el óptimo desarrollo de su trabajo. Martín, además, necesita el préstamo para adquirir bienes de uso personal que le son de suma necesidad.

Martín es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchos deseos de superación, pues quiere darles la mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martínis 36 years old and lives with his 2 children in a developing community in the Morropón district in Piura. 

Martín works in construction management.  He has been a mason for 10 years and has a lot of experience in his profession which has allowed him to build an established clientele in his area.  

Martín is requesting a loan for 3000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa to buy tools such as scaffolding that will allow him to continue developing in his trade.

Martín is a hard-working man that wants to excel as he wants to give his children the best quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 59 years old and married with six children. Five of her children live separately from her in Bolivia while one child still lives with her while finishing university. Valentina is the owner of a small convenience store that sells a variety of basic necessities. Additionally, she is very active in her community, planning events and organizing other activities. 

Valentina is asking for a loan in order to pay for the university of her daughter who is living in Bolivia. She wants her daughter to get a strong education so that she can become a professional like her other children. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Helen  Group

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in the Philippines.
Helen raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs. 
Helen has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Helen hopes to have a bigger cage for her pigs.

Helen is the leader of a 5 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
Jose Humberto tiene 42 años de edad, es transportista, casado y padre de dos hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la Colonia Bella Vista en la ciudad de Danli. 

Jose se dedicaba a ser chofer de transporte pesado y recorria gran parte del pais llevando mercaderia, y casi no pasaba tiempo con su familia, asi que hace tres años atras se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar un numero de taxi y entonces sin pensarlo mucho decidió comprarlo y tambien un carro usado para taxear. Su horario laboral inicia temprano por las mañanas y culmina en la tarde-noche, y como es su propio jefe cuando sus esposa o hijos requieren de su tiempo él felizmente se los dedica. 

El prestamo que está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de llantas y para el arreglo del motor de su unidad. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Jose mantendrá su unidad en buen funcionamiento y podrá seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su desafio es ahorrar un poco de los ingresos diarios que le deja la taxeada para poder comprar una unidad nueva y dejar de gastar tanto en el mantenimiento de su actual unidad ya que esta vieja. 

Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera poder cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
José Humberto is 42 years old.  He is a truck driver, married, and the father of two children.  He and his family live in Colonia Bella Vista in the city of Danli.  
José transports heavy freight and travels extensively throughout the country carrying merchandise and consequently, hardly spends any time with his family.  So, three years ago, he was presented with the opportunity to purchase a taxi license and then without much thought, decided to buy it as well as a used car for  the taxi service.  His work day begins early in the morning and ends late at night.  As his own boss, when his wife and family need him, he happily sets aside time for them.
He needs the loan to buy tires and to repair the taxi’s engine.  With the support of this loan, José will maintain his vehicle in good condition and will be able to continue having a source of income to support his family.  His challenge is saving a little of his daily income so that he can purchase a new vehicle and stop spending so much on the maintenance of his current vehicle since it is old.
This is his first loan cycle with FAMA and he hopes to be able make his payments on time

loans.use: to pay labor on the repair of his vehicle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 40 years old. She has two children. She has been in the transportation business for the past 10 years operating a minibus. This is her primary business that gives her a monthly income of 43,000 KES. The business is located in the busy Malindi town.

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to service her minibus. She will save the anticipated profits to help her invest in the future.

loans.use: To service her minibus

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, 56, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Nelson, a taxi driver, have two children. She and her husband  manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leonora operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up for every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, they are one of the most common products that you can buy, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney (a small bus) down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3500 Phillipines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials and supplies like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leonora hopes to increase production and dreams to be able to give everyone in her family a good life through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. She is single and has a house for rent business in the Philippines.
Emelia has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for house improvement and repair. She has been in this business for five years now.
In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for house improvement or repair.

loans.name: Sokhna Elisabeth

texts.fr: Madame Sokhna est une veuve de 47 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis 2 ans dans le commerce de thioups et autres tissus divers.  La raison fondamentale du choix de son activité est  la volonté d’avoir une activité génératrice de revenus  qui lui permette de subvenir personnellement à ses besoins. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2007. elle a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 fr prévu pour l’achat d’autres marchandises diverses en vue des préparatifs de la fête  de Tabaski. Son intention est de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhna is a 47-year-old widow who lives in Senegal. She has been selling thioups and other fabrics for two years. The main reason for her choosing this particular occupation was the desire to have an income-generating activity that would allow her to support herself. 

She became a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches in August 2007. She has already obtained and repaid four previous loans. She is now seeking a loan of 100,000 francs to purchase various items in preparation for the Tabaski celebration. Her goal is to diversify her stock and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 36-year-old young woman. She is married with four sons and two daughters, Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. Dalal wants to finish her house by painting, installing tiles, installing windows and doors, etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for it. She needs to take a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Dalal gets the loan, she will be able to pay for these expenses and complete finishing her house. This loan will enable her to live with her family under better home conditions. Dalal is a conservative woman, so her husband Waleed is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for finishing her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora. Vive con Rodolfo, fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos de 24 y 13 años, instalados cómodamente en una casa de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Raquel, es la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, así como zapatos que trae a pedido desde la ciudad de Lima, para  luego venderlos de forma personal a sus vecinos y familiares, muchas veces al contado, así como también a crédito. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder socializar con las personas, brindarles un buen servicio en la atención, así como también  el contar con un ingreso económico, ya que con el sueldo de su pareja en una empresa privada, no les alcazaba teniendo muchas necesidades tanto en el vestir como en la alimentación. Tiene planes de continuar y hacer crecer el volumen de stock de sus mercaderías. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para crecer con su negocio, por eso dice, será puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente contenta con su banco comunal, pues hasta el momento le va muy bien. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa en mayor cantidad y anticipándose a la campaña navideña, desea ampliar su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Raquel, 42, is an enterprising, hardworking woman.  She lives with Rodolfo and they have two children who are 24 and 13 years old.  They all live together comfortably in their own house.

Raquel’s activity is selling women’s, men’s and children’s clothes as well as shoes that she brings on order from the city of Lima to then sell personally to her neighbors and family members often for cash but also on credit.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years.  What she likes about it is being able to socialize with people and provide them with good service as well as having a steady income since her spouse’s salary from his job in a private firm sometimes was insufficient to cover their food and clothing needs.  She plans to continue and to increase the volume of her stock merchandise.

This will be MFP loan #3 and she feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to grow in her business which is why she says she will be punctual with her payments like she’s been in previous loans.  On the other hand, she feels happy in her communal bank because they have been doing well to date.  She will use the requested amount to buy clothes in larger amounts to be ready for the Christmas season; she wants to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a hardworking businessman who is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. For the last 20 years, he has been selling ornaments such as earrings, necklaces and bangles to make a living. He also rents houses to supplement his income. He has employed two people to help him in managing the business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy iron sheets to be used to renovate his rental houses. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to be used to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
José, es ganadero, vive con su esposa y dos hijas, trabaja solamente él, lo inicio por cuenta propia, ya que le gusta mucho el trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería, no tiene un horario fijo y se dedica a él desde hace 10 años.
Él comprara una vaca, por eso solicita un préstamo, ya que tiene idea de ir aumentado su ganado, la compra le ayudara para mejorar y tener más oportunidades de superación.
La aspiración de él es tener casa propia y que su negocio sea cada día más prospero.
texts.en:
José is a livestock farmer.  He lives with his wife and two daughters and works alone.  He started his business on his own as he really enjoys farming and livestock raising.  He doesn't work fixed hours and has been in this business for 10 years.  José will buy a cow.  He is requesting a loan as he would like to increase the size of his herd.  This purchase will help him to improve and give him more opportunities to excel in life.

José's aspiration is to own his own home and for his business to continue thriving day by day.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Dil Kumari is 45 years old. She is married and has two children, age 25 and 23.  

In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  

In the future, Dil Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. 

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alba Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Alba del Socorro a sus 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos de papelería en un lugar adecuado en la sala de su casa, luego de quedar viuda hace algunos años, le tocó sacar sola a sus hijos adelante y con la ayuda de la papelería ha logrado sostenerse económicamente y afectivamente. Con el ánimo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, la señora Alba del Socorro necesita de la compra de surtido que le permita mejorar sus ventas y a largo plazo cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén y ver como profesionales a sus dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad.
texts.en: Alba del Socorro is 58 years old and runs a small office supply store from her house.  After her husband died several years ago, Alba needed to support her children on her own and the income from this business helped support the family.   Motivated to improve the quality of life for herself and her children, Alba wants to invest in her business and this loan will enable her to increase her sales.   Longer term, her dream is to have her own paper store and to see her children, now 18 and 16, with good jobs as well.

loans.use: to stock her store with notepads, books and pens.

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es: Un grupo con mucho optimismo y deseo de hacer negocio, es el grupo Libertadores, formado hace ya dos años, cuenta con 7 integrantes los cuales dan fe que si se puede salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Muestra de ello es la señora Maria de 57 años de edad, casada y con 7 hijos de los cuales  seis son independientes y uno aun esta a su cuidado, ella se dedica a la venta de tuberculos en un puesto en el mercado de su zona hace 40 años, Este negocio que le ha dado muchas satisfacciones como son la implementación de muebles en el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. con el reciente préstamo la señora Maria lo invertirá en comprar de mas tuberculos y así poder tener mayores ingresos y estabilidad económica en cuanto a los gastos del hogar. No puedo concluir sin antes mencionar el desempeño y el entusiasmo de cada integrante de  los Libertadores para llegar a un objetivo en común el cual es la estabilidad económica para sus familias y el progreso de sus negocios.
texts.en:
One very optimistic group, with a desire to do business, is the Libertadores ("Liberators").  Formed two years ago, it consists of seven members who have faith that one can succeed in spite of adversity.  

An example of that, Maria is 57 years old, married with seven children, six of whom are independent and one of whom remains in Maria's care.  For 40 years, Maria has worked selling tubers (a type of plant) in a stall in the market in her area.  This business has given her a lot of satisfaction, as it has provided for the furniture in her home and the schooling of her children.  

With this loan, Maria will invest it in her business and purchase more tubers.  This will allow her to increase her income and provide greater financial stability as to her household expenses.  

I cannot conclude without mentioning the hard work and enthusiasm of each member of the Libertadores in achieving their common goals, which are financial stability for their families and the success of their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase tubers (a type of plant).

loans.name: Ching Oer

texts.en: Ching Oer is a student living in Phnom Penh city and 19 years old. To support on her studying and her living, she can earn income via working as chef assistant in a small restaurant and selling some kind of vegetables. This is first time for Ching Oer with VisionFund. She will spend her loan portion to pay on tuition fee for her Bachelor’s degree. She hopes that she can get a good job with higher salary after graduated to improve on her family’s living to get better than last year.

loans.use: To pay on tuition fee for her Bachelor’s degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to renovate her pigs shed and buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
Fikret is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. 
He has had his business for 5 years.In the beginning of his business he borrowed $600 and bought 6 sheep.
You can see in the picture that he enjoys looking after the sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a horse.
Fikret is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in Fizuli region Kurdmahmudlu  village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti is 45 years old, and is married with three children. Two of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her family's income, Siti makes riced crackers and then sells it by going around her village on foot. In a week Siti can earn  of $10 and eventually she can earn around $40 in a month. She needs a loan of $50 and with this loan, she can buy more materials and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Sonnia

texts.es:
Business description

Sonnia has been buying and selling gas cylinders for 6 months. She does this from her Mother’s house as she helps her attend to her clients. She started this business because there is no one selling gas where she lives. She had saved up some money by working part time in a warehouse, and this is how she bought the gas cylinders. She works form 7am – 8pm every day.

Loan Use

Sonnia would like a loan in order to buy more gas cylinders as her business is located near a market and she does not have enough to satisfy her clients’ needs.

Personal Information

Sonnia is 20 years old and she lives with her parents. Apart from her business, she also works in a warehouse selling electro-domestic goods, which allows her to contribute to the household costs. She hopes that with the credit that she can invest in her business so that she can generate more profit to support her parents more. She also wishes to improve their home which is not yet finished and is made of cement and wood. This is how she would like a better future for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Sonnia lleva 6 meses dedicada a la compra y venta de cilindros de gas, ella tiene el negocio en casa de su mamá quien le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes. Ella empezó este negocio porque en el sector donde ella vive no hay personas que vendan gas. Ella había ahorrado dinero porque trabaja medio tiempo en un almacén y con parte del sueldo empezó a comprar los cilindros de gas. Su negocio se atiende desde las 7:00am hasta las 8:00pm todos los días.

Uso del Préstamo

Sonnia desea el crédito para comprar más cilindros de gas ya que su negocio esta ubicado cerca de un mercado y los cilindros que tiene no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Información Personal

Sonnia tiene 20 años de edad, ella vive en casa de sus padres. Ademas del negocio, ella trabaja en un almacén de electrodomésticos, lo que le permite ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Ella aspira con el crédito invertir en el negocio de tal forma que le genere mayor utilidad que le permita ser un buen soporte para sus padres. Además que ella desea ir mejorando su vivienda ya que esta en construcción mixta de cemento y madera. Para de esta manera tener un mejor futuro tanto ella como su familia.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders/Comprar cilindors de gas

loans.name: Lucía Martes

texts.en:
Since the death of her dearly beloved husband, Lucía, 63, has had to work very hard to support her five sons, all of whom live with her. Two of her children are part-time farm workers, two are on unemployment and the youngest was disabled in an accident and is not able to work.

Lucía started a small business three months ago and quickly realized that it was a great way to increase her income. She sells fresh chicken parts (legs, wings, giblets and so on) and boiled peas. Every day, she buys five live chickens from a poultry house near where she lives and sells the parts. A live chicken weighs four or five pounds, and costs about 30 pesos (or $1) per pound. Sold as parts, these chickens are worth more than 70 pesos per pound. Her boiled peas are popular because women in her township don’t want to use the energy needed to soften peas in their gas ovens.

Because these activities have proved so lucrative, Lucía has applied for a loan of $375 to expand her business. She'll use her loan to buy enough chickens and peas to substantially increase her income and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a new and very profitable business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cylinders of gas

loans.name: Victoria Women's Lending Group

texts.en:
Let’s all move to Kiyinde. Resting on the slopes of Lake Victoria, the source of the Nile, at an elevation of about 1,000 meters with gentle breezes coming off the lake, this fishing village, or landing as it referred to, is a jewel of tranquility. Here the Victoria Women’s Lending Group meets weekly. This sleepy village with views of a multitude of islands can only be reached by a one hour drive on very rutted roads. As you come into town you are taken back by its beauty and its babies. If, as I’m told, Uganda has one of the highest birthrates in the world, then Kiyinde is certainly doing its fair share in keeping that statistic. Remote villages tend to have high birthrates.

Fishing is the main industry in Kiyinde and I think the men go fishing and the women run the place. That was certainly the feeling as I met with this dynamic group of women who are members of the Victoria Lending Group. They are a joy to be around. As we walked through the streets, they all command a strong presence of hospitality and openness.

Ayisna is the chairperson and she owns a small grocery where she sells sugar, salt, maize flour, along with soft drinks and personal hygiene items. She is widowed and has 10 children and she cares for 4 orphans. With her loan she plans to add to her inventory at her store. She would eventually buy a cow and hopes to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: Ayisna plans to use her loan to buy more dry goods and staples for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jesus Enma

texts.es:
Jesús Enma is 50 years old and she completed only primary school. She has three children who are still dependant on her. She lives in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad. She raises small animals and also buys cattle, which she kills in order to sell their meat to buyers who come from Trujillo.

Jesús belongs to the “Progresistas” community bank, from which she received her first loan of S/. 300.00. With that money she bought 2 pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. With a loan of S/. 1,300.00, which she will pay back in 4 payments, she will buy 2 calves.

Jesús began by selling small animals, and bit by bit, she used the profits to start buying cattle and that is how she got into this business.

Currently, she is the treasurer of the popular, small restaurant cooperative called “Corazón de María”. Her greatest dream is to put a well-stocked store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús Enma tiene 50 años de edad, estudió sólo primaria completa. Tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco. departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la compra de reses, las cuales las mata para luego vender la carne a comerciantes que van a comprar desde Trujillo. La señora Jesús pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas” en el que recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00, con este dinero compró 2 cerdos, cuyes y gallinas. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 teneros pequeños. La señora Jesús primero empezó vendiendo animales menores, después poco a poco con las ganancias y los posteriores préstamos fue comprando reses y así empezó a trabajar en este negocio. Actualmente es tesorera del comedor popular “Corazón de Maria”. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda surtida en su casa.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married and has two grownup children. She lives in Melitopol, Ukraine, and owns a small business in the central city market. A skilled entrepreneur, wife, and mother, Nadezhda is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past ten years, she has sold sportswear and footwear in the central city market. The combination of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Nadezhda’s vending kiosk a point of attraction in the market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped her to develop a loyal customer base. With strong character and a desire to see her business grow, Nadezhda has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine for the past 7 years. 

Currently, Nadezhda has $2,000 of goods in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1,800 and her monthly net profit is approximately $600. Nadezhda is seeking a loan of $1,000 to increase her inventory. With additional income from her profits, Nadezhda hopes to continue to improve her family’s standard of living. Moreover, profit generated by her business will give Nadezhda a chance to pay for her son’s education at one of the local colleges.

loans.use: To increase inventory and the assortment of goods

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a very hard-working woman and since she moved to her new place of residence, she has noticed the alaming need of a place that sells basic products amongst her neighbours. This is why, in her humble home, she developed a small shop which, bit by bit and thanks to the good advice she has received from Prisma, sold more and did very well. For this school year she wants to increase the smaller products that she offers, such as paper, pens, notebooks etc, and with this in mind and with great enthusiasm she will keep working for the well-being of her family and her community; and this is why she would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa desde que se instaló en su nuevo lugar de residencia observó la alarmante necesidad de sus vecinos por obtener sus productos de primera necesidad en un establecimiento cercano a sus domicilios; por esa razón instaló en su humilde casita una pequeña bodega que poco a poco y gracias a la asesoría que le ha otorgado, Prisma para mejorar sus ventas ha ido obteniendo mejores resultados. Para esta época escolar desea incrementar sus productos ofertando también pequeños artículos como: papeles, lapiceros, cuadernos, etc; con este deseo en mente y su gran entusiasmo por seguir trabajando en bienestar de su familia y su comunidad solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To buy small school articles/Compra de pequeños artículos escolares.

loans.name: Asha's Magaoni Centre Group

texts.en:
Asha is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 19, 18, and 16. Asha is a cloth (khanga) seller; she started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Ziada, who has a business dealing in chips selling.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra A. is a lady that for a long time has worked in the business of breeding chickens and hens, having her own pen in the back of her house, in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

The business consists in breeding these animals to then sell them when grown and also selling eggs produced by the hens.

To improve her business, it is necessary to install a converter that provides power to the pen, this is the reason why she has come to Ceprodel to get a loan that allows her to buy the converter.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra A. es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha trabajado en el negocio de crianza de pollo y gallinas teniendo su propio corral en su casa de habitación en su patio en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

El negocio consiste en la crianza de estos animales para luego venderlos cuando están crecidos y de igual manera en la venta de los huevos cada vez que estos son puestos por las gallinas.

Para el mejoramiento de su corral le es necesario instalar un transformador que proporcione energía a la gallera, por este motivo es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el transformador el cual será instalado con el propósito de que pueda proporcionar energía eléctrica a la gallera para así llevar a cabo el proceso de crianza de estas aves.

loans.use: Purchase of a converter that provides power to chicken pen.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru:
Saida B. lives in Dushanbe. She is 57. She is married and has 3 children. She teaches in the Institute of Ecology. Her son is getting married, and she would like to receive a $1000 loan. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бурхонова Саида жительница города Душанбе. Возраст 57 лет . Замужем , имеет троих детей. Образование высшее . Работает преподавателем в Институте экологии. Собираетсчя женить сына и поэтому хочет получить кредит в размере 1000 долларов США. Погасить кредит он планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Son's marriage

loans.name: Gam Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Gam Thi P. is a 33 year old woman. She has 2 small children. In 2000, she became a TYM partner, making loans to invest in order to improve her family’s financial situation. She has been using most of the loans to buy scrap-iron in adjacent areas and then reselling it to manufacturers; the rest of the loans are invested in a live-stock farm. For 8 years, the family budget has been greatly growing; they saved money to build a small 4-roomed house and to provide their children with the most possible facilities. She plans to use the next loan of 9,000,000 to renovate the farm and buy 5 more pigs. Family’s frequent income is 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Gấm năm nay 33 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để làm ăn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chị đã sử dụng phần lớn vốn vay cho chồng đi thu mua phế liệu về bán, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi. Qua 8 năm tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế nhà chị đã tăng lên rõ rệt, anh chị đã tiết kiệm và xây được 4 gian nhà ngói và có điều kiện để đầu tư, chăm sóc cho các con nhiều hơn.Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000đ sể sủa sang chuồng trại và mua thêm 5 con lợn về nuôi.

Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in live-stock farm

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Miss Sophea, 26, is single and lives with her widowed mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two sisters.

Sophea has been a hairdresser for one year, a skill she learned in Phnom Penh City. After finishing her skill training early last year, she rented a shop to operate a beauty service in a suburb of Phnom Penh. Currently her business is doing very well, so she needs to buy her own shop but lacks the money. Therefore Sophea is requesting a loan of $800 to add to her own money to buy a beauty shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy a beauty shop.

loans.name: Thi Kim Dung's Group

texts.vi:
chị T. thị kim Dung Ms 09040020 năm nay 30 tuổi, chị cùng nhóm đã tham gia vay vốn qua một C. kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Đồng thời chị là một phụ nữ rất chịu khó, mặc dù là công nhân của công ty may nhưng chị vẫn làm thêm ruộng, tăng gia chăn nuôi lợn, gà...và chăm sóc 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Chồng chị làm thợ sửa chữa điện nước. Thu nhập của gia đình chị khá thường xuyên, ổn định từ 150.000 VND đến 200.000 VND / ngày. C. kỳ này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 4.704.000 VND để mua gà giống. Các thành viên trong nhóm của chị :

  • chị
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thị Kim Dung (Ms 09040020) is 30 years old this year. She and her group have participated through one loan cycle and were good on their repayment. Additionally, she is a very hardworking woman - eventhough she is a she is an employee of a sewing company, she also does the following: farms rice, raise pigs and chicken, and care for two school-aged children. Her husband works as a plumber and electrician (public utilities). The family's income is steady and ranges from 150,000 VND to 200,000 VND per day. This time around she signed up to borrow 4,704,000 VND to purchase chicken for raising. 

The other members of her group are:
<li> Ms.

loans.use: For raising pigs

loans.name: Mu

texts.en:
Mu P., 35, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Mu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, a spade, a shovel and bush knives for the plantation. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, cromoxzone, spade, shovel and bush knives

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: nLa señora Margarita V. de Pereira es de Bº San Pedro, tiene casa propia, tiene 53 años de edad, casada con el Sr. Marciano Castillo Sánchez de 40 años de edad  y tienen 2 hijos.n       Es propietaria de una despensa con 3 años de funcionamiento, tiene clientela formada, ya que tiene buena ubicación, y son personas muy conocidas en la zona.nEl señor tiene una Gomería al lado de la despensa, y ambos tienen buenos ingresos mensuales. Entre las mercaderías que más vende se encuentra: carne, leche, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, artículos para el hogar, enlatados, etc. nn     El cliente quiere ampliar su local para surtir más de mercaderías y aumentar cada día sus  ingresos. En esta ocasión, adquirirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías.n
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita V. de Pereira, from the San Pedro neighborhood, owns her own home and is 53 years old. She is married to Mr. Marciano Castillo Sánchez, 40 years old, and they have two children. For three years she has owned a small general store. The store has an established clientele because it is in a good location and the couple is very well-known in the area. Her husband has a tire shop beside the store, and together they have a good monthly income. Popular items sold at the store include meat, milk, vegetables, fruit, soda pop, items for the home, canned food, etc. Margarita wants to provide more products and thereby increase her daily income. She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, flour, vegetables, fruit, soda pop, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Mara Ken Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who live in Preak Samraong Village in Kandal Province have applied for this loan, which they will use for different purposes. Mrs. Mara K. is the village bank president and will use her portion of the loan to expand a pig-breeding business that is doing well. She is also a garment worker. Her husband, Mr. Chon Loehak, is a motorbike taxi driver and also helps her with her business when he has spare time. Mrs. Mara K. is 21 years old and the mother of two children who are one and three years old.

One member of this group has an end-of-term loan; the rest have monthly payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To expand a pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is a fifty-two year old widowed mother of four children.  She has been taking care of her four children since the demise of her husband.  She says her youngest child is currently in their final year as a pupil in the junior high school. 

She works very hard to be able to provide for her family.  Margaret bakes bread and distributes it to retailers in her community.  She has been baking and distributing bread for over fifteen years.  She buys the baking ingredients from the city, Kumasi. 

Margaret wants to expand her business so that she can distribute to a larger number of customers.  She wants to take advantage of the Christmas festivities to raise more income to support her family.  

Margaret is in a group called ‘Maranatha’ Trust Bank in her community.  The members in this group guarantee one another as collateral to access the loan, and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, etc in bulk.

loans.name: Chron

texts.en: Mr. Chron S. is 59 years old and now lives in Kraeng Roung village in Takeo province. He is a recycling collector. He now wants to expand his business by purchasing more recycling to resell to the factory. Thus, he is requesting a loan to buy empty bottles, cans, plastic, and so on. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions. His wife, Mrs. Choeur Yet, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chron S. is the father of eight children, five of whom are recycling collectors also while the remaining three are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy empty bottles, cans, plastic and so on for recycling collection

loans.name: Dope

texts.fr: Dope A. est une revendeuse de pagnes à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenus.. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Dope désire avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique. La vue est prise devant son magasin.
texts.en:
Dope A. sells "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 32, married and the mother of 2 children. She has been in this business for 3 years and it remains her primary source of income. So as to better cater for the needs of her clientele, Dope would like to replenish her shop with this loan. The photo is taken in front of her shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish her inventory

loans.name: Mujeres De Dios En Progreso Group

texts.en:
Emilia G. is a mother of nine ranging from 5 to 29 years old. She is the group coordinator for the group called "Mujeres de Dios en Progreso", or in English, "Women of God in Progress." This is Emilia's first loan and with it she hopes to be able to buy a variety of types of clothing and shoes to sell in her clothing business. Emilia said that a friend first told her of the loans she could get with Esperanza, and it immediately sparked an interest in her.

Emilia lives in a community near Puerto Plata called Callejon de la Loma. Some of her future goals are to improve her house and business and to progress more. She is hoping this loan and future loans can help her grow her business. She enjoys working in her home and spending time with her nine children.

On behalf of Emilia G., the Mujeres de Dios en Progreso group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: Replenishing supplies for a clothing business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
la sra. Reyna B. tiene 47 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en el colegio. ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, su negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos, con su esposo se ayudan para salir adelante con los gastos del hogar.
ella desea poner otra tienda en una comunidad cercana ya que mucha gente los domingos viaja hacia nacaome para comprar cosas y ella vende mucho, los clientes le comentan si ella tuviera una tienda por aquellos lados le fuera mejor, porque asi la gente compraria localmente y no tuviera que viajar.
por tal razon ella quiere comprar mas mercaderia y con las ganancias que tenga asi poder ver si puede poner otra tienda.
texts.en:
Reyna B. is 47 years old, married, and has 2 children who are in school. She dedicates herself to selling clothes and shoes. The business is her only source of income; along with her husband, they help themselves to get ahead with the household expenses. She wants to open another store in a community nearby, since many people travel toward Nacaome on Sundays to buy products and she sells quite a bit. Customers tell her that it would be better if she had a store closer to them because, then, they could buy locally and wouldn’t have to travel. For this reason, she would like to buy more merchandise to sell and, with the earnings from those sales, explore the possibility of opening another store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dress shirts, shoes, blouses, t-shirts.

loans.name: Husanboi

texts.ru: Хусанбой - мужчина 48 лет. Женат. Отец 2-х детей. Хусанбой занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Жена нигде не работает, а только помогает по хозяйству дома. Когда муж уходит на пастбище вместе со скотом, она смотрит за оставшимся скотом дома. Этим они зарабатывают на жизнь, чтобы прокормить своих детей.
texts.en:
Husanboi is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. He is involved in raising and selling cattle and small livestock. He buys the livestock at a market, raises it for about 2-3 months and then resells it at the same market. Husanboi’s wife is not employed and helps with household work. She also looks after the livestock at home whenever Husanboi takes other livestock to pasture. Husanboi’s family makes a living with this business and provides for their children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: Alba Nidia C. S. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Alba tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alba inicio este negocio por que no tenía trabajo y ella que una mujer trabajadora decidió establecer este negocio en su vivienda. Alba tiene 3 financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y estos han sido de apoyo para sacar adelante a su negocio. Por lo que sus propósitos son de incrementar sus ventas para su negocio. El financiamiento es par capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jabón y granos básicos. El sueño de Alba es trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Alba Nidia C. S. is a 51-year-old single mother with 3 children who all work. She has been running a general store for over 7 years. She started this business because she was unemployed at the time, and being the hardworking woman that she is, she decided to set up a general store in her home. Alba has obtained 3 loans, which have helped her business grow, from Fundación León 2000. Her goal is to boost sales. This loan will be used as business capital so that she can purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, soap, and staple grains. Alba dreams of working with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. sells goods in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods in her shop to sell. She is 42 years old. Her husband was shot dead in the power struggle between the Southerners against Khartoum government, which has been going on for two decades. She has five children and only three go to school. In the future, she also needs to buy a grinding mill for grinding maize.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services.  These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more goods in her shop

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Barrio Lindo” son relativamente nuevos aunque cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a anteriores financiamientos con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda la oportunidad D. generar mayores ingresos en sus pequeños negocios D. venta D. ropa, frutas, abarrotes y a la compra D. herramientas que les ayudara a realizar un mejor trabajo en sus actividades D. carpintería, albañilería y a mejorar sus herramientas actuales como es el caso D. los socios que se dedican a actividades como el transporte publico. Como expresa su presidenta la señora Elvira la competencia en el mercado va creciendo cada día, pero las socias no dejan que renovar sus productos haciéndolos acorD. a las preferencias D. sus clientes ya que D. ello depenD. sus ingresos y por enD. el sustento D. sus familias que es la razón D. su lucha diaria con la competencia en el mercado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Barrio Lindo” group are relatively young, but they have experience with group loans thanks to previous financing from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. The Agrocapital Foundation is giving the members this opportunity to generate more income in their small businesses, which incluD. activities such as selling clothing, fruits, and groceries. Other members will use their shares of the loan to purchase tools that will help them to do better work in such activities as carpentry and bricklaying, or to improve the tools that they currently have, as is the case with the members who make a living in activities like public transport. As Elvira, the group’s president, states, the competition in the market is growing each day, but the members don’t let that affect the products they are producing according to their customers’ preferences. The members depend on the income from their businesses to support their families, and that is why they are struggling daily with the competition in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj D. is 45 years old and married. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic housing tent) district on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. He runs a retail business, selling small household items such as sponges and loofahs at the local market. In 2008, he started renting a small stall because his business was doing well. Over the last two years, his working capital has increased by a factor of eight. Natsagdorj's main goal now is to own his own stall in near future. He plans to use this loan to buy more household items to sell and increase his inventory.

loans.use: To buy small household items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Santos Agustin

texts.es:
Santos Agustín A. A. tiene la edad de 26 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y asiste a la escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de disco. Hace mas de 9 años 
Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y estudia. La actividad económica de Santos ofrece los servicios de disco móvil. Comenzó realizando pequeñas fiestas locales en su comarca, y con el paso del tiempo fue obteniendo los equipos necesarios para su negocio, mas tarde realiza un contrato con el dueño de un restaurante para entretener las fiestas bailables.
