Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que este trabajo requiere que sus aparatos sean mucho más modernos por lo que serán invertidos en su negocio. El deseo de Santos es de seguir adelente con su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Agustín A. A. is 26 years old, married with one child. He is attending school. He works as a mobile disc jockey. He started out doing small local parties in his region, and as time went on he bought the necessary equipment for his business. Later, he signed a contract with a restaurant owner to entertain at dance parties. This is why he is requesting this loan for capital to invest in his business, since he needs much more modern gear. Santos wishes to move forward with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn was born in a family bearing the hardships in life. She really wants to jump out of the wall of poverty that hinders her and her family’s way to success. She is the 37-year-old mother to three. She is married to Edmundo, who is 32 years old and is a jeepney (small bus) driver. They live in Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines.

With her aspiration to break out from poverty, in 2006 Jocelyn joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Her previous loans were prudently used as capital in her business reselling chickens. She has been doing the business for three years already and she is happy with the profit it brings her.

Now on her 7th loan, Jocelyn requests the amount of 20,000 pesos as rolling capital for her resale of chickens. The loan will be used to pay for kilos of live chickens, payment for labor, and payment for transportation. She is confident that her business will continue to grow and bring them good proceeds as it is well-managed.

loans.use: To pay for kilos of live chickens, payment for labor, and payment for transportation

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
A. Floride is married. She sells a variety of goods. Floride sells mainly food, including pasta, flour, peanuts, rice, and couscous (spherical granules made by rolling and shaping moistened semolina wheat and then coating them with finely ground wheat flour). She has been involved in this activity for three years. She buys her products in Cotonou, a large city about an hour away.

Floride has already received two loans from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner in Benin, and they helped her to increase the size of her inventory. Floride is seeking a third loan in order to restock her goods. With more financial support, Floride hopes to someday start selling Beninese fabrics and jewelry.

loans.use: To buy more pasta, flour, peanuts, rice, and couscous

loans.name: Maria Gilma

texts.es: Maria Gilma G. tiene la edad de 44 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de cerdo hace mas de  4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicia este negocio  por la necesidad de trabajar ya que  no tenía un trabajo estable y decide establecer el negocio en su vivienda y empieza con la compra de un cerdo y al tener afluencia de clientes decide invertir más en su negocio, el financiamiento es para capital e trabajo destinado para la compra de  mas  cerdos. En futuro le gustaría establecer una pulperia.
texts.en:
Maria Gilma G. is 44 years old. The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the purchase and sale of pigs. She has spent more than 4 years with this business. She began the business due to the necessity of working, as she didn’t have a stable job. She decided to establish the business in her home, and she began with the purchase of one pig. After getting many clients she decided to invest more in her business. This loan is for working capital, destined for the purchase of more pigs. In the future, she would like to begin a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Jaime David

texts.es: El joven Jaime es originario de la comunidad de Paxtoca del municipio de Totonicapan su princimal fuente de ingreso es la albañil el aprendio el arte de la construcción con su querido padre hace ocho años, hace dos años se independizo de su querido padre hoy trabaja por su propia cuenta el necesita de un credito para la compra de instrumentos de trabajo, ya que los clientes necesitan de nuevos diseños para la construccion.
texts.en:
Jaime is originally from the Paxtoca community in the Totonicapan municipality. His primary source of income comes from his work as a bricklayer. Eight years ago he learned the art of construction from his beloved father. Two years ago he became independent of his dear father. He now works on his own. He needs a loan to buy work instruments. The customers need need designs for construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Jinja Misindye A Sempa Florence Group

texts.en: S. Florence is a hardworking business lady of thirty-eight years old, married with six children schooling and has two dependents schooling too. She is carrying out live stock activity which she has obtained for fifteen years so far. She is using the loan to purchase pigs, cows and so forth for live stock. S. Florence is so much interested in agriculture that is why she is investing in live stock. Her future hope is prospering and raising her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, cows and so forth for live stock.

loans.name: Glorie

texts.en:
Glorie E. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old. Glorie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Glorie operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Glorie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glorie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glorie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for vegetable vending. This will be the first loan taken out by Glorie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for vegetable vending

loans.name: Mrs. Onn Ell Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all living in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Onn E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members and they each will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Onn E. is a 41-year-old widow and now she is a Khmer cake seller. Since her business is going wE., she wants to expand it. Currently, she does not have enough money to buy more ingredients to make more cakes to sE. to earn more income to support her living conditions. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making Khmer cakes

loans.name: Deolinda Celestino

texts.pt:
Deolinda Celestino B. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, separada e mãe de 3 filhos de 13, 10 e 4 anos de idade, os mais velhos vão a escola. Fez 10ª classe, mais tarde continuou com a formação de professores, no Instituto de Magistério Primário da Matola. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Nunca mudou da cidade onde vive, após da sua separação continuou a residir com os seus filhos, trabalha como professora, quadro do Ministério da Educação, aufere um salário de 7.600.00mt por mes. Com a ajuda do subsídio enviado mensalmente pelo pai dos filhos, consegue alimentar a família e poupar algum valor na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus colegas e este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.500.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (aros de portas, janelas, cimento e outros) para melhorar a sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de todos para a mesma actividade.

Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos no futuro, para poder concluir com a sua obra, compra de mobiliário e oferecer melhores condições de habitação para os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Deolinda Celestino B. was born in the city of Matola in the province of Maputo. She is separated and the mother of 3 three children, who are 13, 10, and 4. The oldest ones go to school. She studied through 10th grade and later continued studying to be a teacher in the Instituto de Magistério Primário in Matola. She lives in her own home with her children and doesn't support anyone else besides them. She never moved from the city where she lives. After her separation, she continued living with her children, and she works as a teacher for the Ministry of Education. She earns a salary of 7,600 meticais per month. With the help of a subsidy that the father of her children sends her every month, she feeds her family and saves some in her bank account. She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her colleagues, and this is her 3rd loan. It is for 20,500 meticais and she will use it to buy construction materials (doors, windows, cement, etc.) to improve her home. Her previous loans were also used for this purpose. She hopes to request more loans in the future to be able to finish her home, to buy furniture, and to offer better living conditions to her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu C.. She is 49 years old, married, and is from So-so Town Lane in Waterloo. She has six children: three boys and three girls, one in secondary school, one in primary school, and the rest don’t go to school.

Isatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken three previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu sells palm oil at home. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing more palm oil for sale. She hopes to use the current loan for the same purpose and increase her profit even more.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of San Vicente. She is 53 years old. Lilia is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as drinks, mineral water and grocery items in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Kireka Market Vendors Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Safina is 50 years old and the leader of her lending group. She is married with four children and has had a boutique as her business in Kireka for 10 years. She currently makes 50,000/= profit every week. Her main business challenge is having inadequate capital for expansion hence the reason for the little profit she makes. However, she tries so hard to attract more customers due to her good customer care skills and she would like to expand her business further for more profits. Safina needs a loan to be able to restock her boutique with more quality clothes for resale. She is such a friendly and hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Fe's Group

texts.en:
Fe M., from the town of Fugu Echague, is the 47-year-old group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe M.'s group.

Fe, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a weaving business whose main income comes from making and selling general woven products to tourists and local community members. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw materials to expand product offerings, she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Lenyvel

texts.en: Lenyvel C. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as noodles, salt, shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in her community. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Lenyvel has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Lenyvel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lenyvel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase products to sell. Lenyvel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 28 years old and is single but he takes care of two dependent relatives, the first being 20 years old and the second being 22 years old. Ernest lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, in the village called Gatsata. One of the family works as a teacher in the primary school and another is a nurse in a hospital. The dependents, even if are old enough, don’t have jobs which can give them monthly incomes, the reason why they are in Ernest’s charge.

Ernest owns a small shop selling different kinds of products such as cooking oil, rice, beer, soft drinks, and so on. He has been in this business since 2003, ensuring that he has enough experience in this field.

The reason why Ernest is requesting a loan is for the purpose of expanding his business because it is profitable. With this loan he will be able to earn more profits which will help him to solve his problems and save money for a secure future.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: María  Irene

texts.es:
La  señora María Irene Vanegas H., es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña en el cargo de operaria de limpieza, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, ella solicito el crédito por que desea comprar un poco de ropa y zapatos y utensilios de estudio para sus hijos.

La señora María Irene Vanegas H. habita en el barrio san Agustín en casa de sus padres, mientras ella realiza su trabajo de limpieza por las calles de Chinandega sus familiares cuidan de sus hijos uno de 4 años y el otro de 12 años de edad, durante el tiempo que tiene de trabajar con ceprodel ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y de buenas costumbres pues lleva ya 6 créditos con la institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Irene Vanegas H. is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega where she works as part of the cleaning crew. She is a single mother with two school-age children. She is asking for a loan to purchase clothes, shoes, and school supplies for her children. Mrs. María Irene Vanegas H. lives in the neighborhood of San Agustín, in her parents' house. While she cleans the streets of Chinandega, her relatives take care of her children, aged 4 and 12. During the time she has worked with Ceprodel, she has shown to be an enterprising woman and with good habits as she already has six credits with this organization.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal purchase for her sons

loans.name: Josette

texts.fr: Née en 1961 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, D. Josette vit depuis trente ans au quartier Adjracomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josette est divorcée de son mari et a un enfant à charge. L'enfant est scolarisé. Josette assure seule ses besoins et ceux de son enfant. Josette a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis 20 ans, Josette vend divers liqueurs à Dantokpa, marché inernational du Bénin, et aussi à son domicile. Josette achète ses liqueurs toujours à Dantokpa. Josette sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue d'agrandir son activité et d'acheter des liqueurs de grande marque pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, Josette D. has lived for the past thirty years in the Adjracomey district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the country. Josette is divorced from her husband and has one child in her care. The child is at school. Josette provides for own needs and those of her child. She left school at secondary level. For the past 20 years Josette has sold a variety of liqueurs in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market, and also from her home. She always buys her liqueurs in Dantokpa. She is applying for a first loan from ALIDé in order to expand her activity and buy top brand liqueurs in order to satisfy her customers more readily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various liqueurs

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mr. Phann P., is 51 year-old and his wife, Mrs. Kimsok Hoeung, is 51 years old. They have been married since 1985 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, three have full-time employment and the other two are in school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Phann was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Phann has been a construction contractor for ten years while his wife stays at home and does housework. He is requesting a loan of $600 to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where he lives

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Chuluuntsetseg Z. is a 35 year old widow who lives with her mother and 2-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has lived with her elderly mother since her husband's passing. 


Chuluuntsetseg earns her living by selling women's underwear at Narantuul, one of Mongolia's largest markets. She purchases her products cheaply in China and resells them at her counter. Chuluuntsetseg has been operating her business since 2005 and has gained significant experience over the past five years. Her working capital is currently 800,000 tugrugs. Chuluuntsetseg has been planning to expand her market stall. She also plans to repair her family home. She works very hard to provide a better life for her son and mother. Chuluuntsetseg says, “I would like to purchase another counter for my business”. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of women's underwear at wholesales price to resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and child. He has been running a painting business for 10 years. He is skilled in painting homes as well as furniture. He says that he is very committed to his work and proud of his experience. He says that finding better ways to advertise his business has been a challenge.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He plans to invest in a power generator and compressor for his work. He believes these investments will help increase his productivity.  Having a generator is important in Lebanon, as there are frequent power outages, often for multiple hours in the day. He hopes to further expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To invest in a power generator and compressor for his work.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
45-year-old Josie M. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Josie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Josie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and save as a reserve for emergencies. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: labour, sarclage et achat d’engrais

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Mr. Po L. is a middle-aged man whose wife is shown in the photo. She stays at home to take care of three small kids. She also raises pig and crops for a profit.

Po L. travels to the forest, where he cuts a pieces of chop-wood (firewood). He hurries to bring the chop-wood back to his house and sell it to people who need it as fuel to cook their food. By doing this, he is able to earn $6 each day to support his famiL.’s daiL. expenses.

Po L. faces a problem: his existing cart has frequentL. broken down when he uses it to pick up his firewood and it has been affecting his income. In order to help solve this problem, he has asked for a $700 loan in order to replace his broken cart.

loans.use: To replace his broken cart

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Chequén del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de verduras, ella cuenta con un puesto de venta instalado dentro de un mercado de la ciudad de Chepén conocido como La Parada, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de verduras frescas. Su negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que siempre trata de brindar productos de buena calidad y un trato amable. Con los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, en el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Irma desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas verduras, de modo que pueda incrementar su stock de productos y aumentar sus ventas, para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1600 nuevos soles.

Irma es una mujer trabajadora que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares, anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Irma, age 47, lives with her husband and their two children in the Chequén sector, Chepén district. It is an agricultural area with plenty of commercial movement. It is situated in the province of the same name in the La Libertad region. It is an hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over ten years she has been selling vegetables. She has a stand set up in the Parada market in the city of Chepén. She sells her customers all types of fresh vegetables. Her business is very well received because she always tries to offer good quality products and friendly service. With the income she gets from this activity she helps her husband, a farmer, to financially support the family. Irma wants to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables. She will do this so that she can increase her stock and increase her sales. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,600 soles in order to meet her goal. Irma is a hard-working woman who has always struggled to get ahead and help her family. She has had previous loans with our institution, and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables to increase her business of selling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to install metal grates, windows and doors on his house.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark O. is 52 years old and married to three wives; they have sixteen children who are all school-going children and are under 18 years. They live in a rural area called Ngiya in Siaya district. 

Mark is a farmer and normally sells farm produce to earn a living. He is applying for a loan from Kadet Ltd to buy “My Sunshine Box” which will help him in lighting his home. Mark’s children use lanterns for lighting and this is too cumbersome for them. They struggle a lot when doing their homework at night. Mark has serviced a loan before with KADET LTD, and he repaid it well without any difficulties.

He hopes and waits for the day when electricity will be installed in his rural home.

loans.use: Buy "My Sunshine Box"

loans.name: Purisimo

texts.en:
Purisimo Z. is from the village of Kimaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. He is 50 years old, married, and has 6 adult-age children. To earn a living, Purisimo owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, he runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where his primary source of income is derived from selling both food and everyday products in his local community. Purisimo has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2006, Purisimo joined HSPFI to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Purisimo has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This prior loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Purisimo is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 16,000 PHP ($375), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital purposes. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Purisimo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business on account of this loan to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang L. can pursue a daily income in the amount of $4 by doing farming. Eang L. is married with seven children, four of whom are married and have started their own homes, while the remaining three are single. Her husband also assists to work in the farm fields frequently alongside her. 

Growing potatoes and green beans is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. For the approaching farming season, Eang L. needs capital to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds to cultivate on her own farmland. This is why she requested a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds to grow on her own farmland.

loans.name: Otuma Ole

texts.en:
Otuma Ole S., 39 years old and married to Naengengunye S., has been a wheat farmer for the last six years. He supports a family of three people. Otuma learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign in his area of residence and is now requesting his first loan to buy pesticides to spray his growing wheat to prevent it from being invaded by pests. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for wheat in this region.

A hardworking man determined to achieve his goals, Otuma's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and have his own farm machinery.

loans.use: To buy pestcides for wheat.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona Brasil. Es comerciante, vende remolacha en rio seco y su esposo es panadero, dicha venta es su principal fuente de ingresos para su manutención. Ella tiene cuatro hijos
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para construir un cuarto.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Saturnina lives in her parents' house, which is located in the Brasil area of the city of El Alto. She has a business selling beets in Rio Seco and her husband is a baker. Her business is her main source of income to support herself. Saturnina has four children.

This loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement, stucco and bricks. This will enable her to build a room for her house. 

This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as cement, stucco and bricks

loans.name: Sorbeh I I I Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sorbeh III” group. They run small scale businesses based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Adama K.. Adama is age 37. She is married to a tailor and the couple has four children. Adama has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells palm oil, rice, sugar, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy these items in large supply to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina C. es una mujer D. 64 años dedicada a la confección D. todo tipo D. ropa en su propio taller ubicado en su casa,  en el barrio Nuevo Bosque D. Cartagena, e iniciado desD. hace 20 años, para ayudar a su esposo en os gastos del hogar; ella inició fabricando ropas para damas sobre medidas,  promocionándola entre    familiares y amigas y gradualmente pasó a desarrollar otras líneas,  porque se dedicó a capacitarse en ello. Así fue como aprendió a trabajar la ropa interior  e  infantil y también la línea D. caballeros. Sus principales clientes son mujeres y su linea estrella es la ropa interior, basada en el modelo que  sus clientas  le  llevan, que ella patrona perfectamente, y envía hacia los municipios en importantes volúmenes, porque su hija la apoya fuertemente   en este proceso y tiene un salario básico. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, aspira a comprar mediante la linea CrediKIVA, telas variadas, adornos e insumos con los cuales fabricará pantaletas, brasieres, y ropa para las fiestas que se avecinan D. fin D. año y con ello planea aumentar su capital D. trabajo, aprovechando el repunte D. sus ventas  en ocasión D. la temporada naviD.ña y D. año nuevo.
Paulina cuenta que su negocio ha sido la fuente D. trabajo D. ella y D. su hija,  igualmente  dice que  con el ha podido hacer un aporte al hogar para que sus hijos, que son 3 en las edades D. 28 a 32,  hayan salido adelante. Ahora su gran sueño  apunta a crear un punto D. venta especializado en ropa interior donD. pueda generar puestos D. trabajo especialmente para mujeres jefas D. hogar, porque es un tema que la hace muy sensible y quiere darle una mano a ellas especialmente en los municipios. Y este es justamente su gran desafío porque requiere el cumplimiento D. esta meta D. generar y buscar los recursos necesarios para el logro D. este propósito.
texts.en:
Paulina C., 64, makes all kinds of clothes in a shop she has in her home in Cartagena’s Nuevo Bosque neighborhood.  She started the business 20 years ago to help her husband meet household expenses.  She started out making women’s clothing to order among family and friends and gradually started developing other lines because she dedicated herself to train for this.  This is how she learned how to make underwear and infant wear as well as men’s clothing.  Her main customers are women and her star line is underwear that based on the models her customers bring her, she patterns exactly.  She sends important amounts to the cities because her daughter is a great support in this process which earns her a basic salary.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she hopes to use a Kiva loan to buy assorted fabric, decorations and supplies to make panties, brassieres and party clothes for the approaching end of year festivities.  She plans to increase her working capital to take advantage of the sales spike that occurs during the Christmas and New Year seasons.

Paulina’s business is a source of employment for her and her daughter.  She says that she’s also been able to contribute through it to the success of her three children who are between the ages of 28 and 32.  Now her dream is to create a sales point specializing in underwear so that she can generate employment opportunities for female heads of household because this is a topic that is very dear to her and she wants to give them a hand, especially in the towns.  This is precisely her great challenge because she wants to reach the goal of generating and obtaining the necessary resources to reach this purpose.

loans.use: To buy assorted fabric and supplies to make panties, brassieres and party clothes for the approaching end of year festivities.

loans.name: Rwamunyari Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
A. Charles, with hand raised, is the leader of Rwamunyari Kwetungura group. He is 38 years old and married with 2 children, aged 2 and 6 years. He is an agriculturalist involved in the growing and sale of matooke from Rwamunyari for over 5 years now.  All along, he has been helped by his wife. 

Charles says that his customers are mostly restaurant owners and the general public, and he is able to make 20,000 UGX in weekly profits. Charles says that his business is seasonal and this is why sometimes he switches and includes other produce like the sale of Irish potatoes in his business. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy fertilizers for his plantation. As a result of taking loans, Charles has been able to save and as a result bought a big chunk of land for agriculture. Before this business, Charles was involved in the sale of maize. He is a determined man who goes by his decisions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for plantation

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Christophe is 33 years old and married. He has three children who are between one and ten years old. Currently one of his children is enrolled in school. Christophe works as a tailor, and he has spent six years in this business. 

Christophe would like to use this loan to purchase more equipment and necessary materials for his tailoring business. He said that his business started with little capital, but now he is finally seeing a profit, which will be used for school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for making garments for sale.

loans.name: Javier Fernando

texts.es:
Javier de 22 años, es un joven emprendedor que para continuar con la actividad económica de su papa comenzó a comprar víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral trabaja en su pequeña tienda vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta que anochece. Aun no tiene hijos ni está casado pero sus proyecciones es verse con su pareja e hijos por eso quiere comenzar a surtir su tienda para darles una buena vida en un futuro. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, arroz, azúcar, enlatados etc. En el futuro tiene planificado tener una papelería para asegurar su futuro económico.
texts.en:
Javier is 22 years old and is an enterprising young man who began to purchase groceries to add to a small store in order to continue his father’s business.

Living in a periurban zone called Perimetral, he works at his small store selling rice, canned goods, drinks, etc. from 7am until nightfall. He still does not have children and he isn’t married, but he sees himself with a partner and children in the future. This is why he wants to begin to stock his store in order to provide them with a good life.

With the loan, he wants to purchase drinks, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. In the future, he plans to have a stationery store to ensure his future finances.

loans.use: Rice, sugar, drinks

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
K. Abdulatif is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, with which he provides sustenance for his humble home. Abdulatif is married and has 5 children. It is important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience due to his great dedication and the knowledge he has acquired from breeding his animals. The reason that Abdulatif looks for support from IMON International is that he needs to purchase livestock so he may sell it and continue with his arduous work with cattle in this sector.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. He is currently producing milk at low levels which he sells to local households. He is also employed by the Municipal Council of Kitale. 

He has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this business will assist him in educating his children. His target is to have 5 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years. He comments that the cost of feed in the local market is expensive and hence prohibits production.

Benard is 38 years old and married with 6 children between 4 and 16. Five of them are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz C. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old. Paz is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration & tailoring services of curtains, pillow covers & bed sheets to local community members. Paz has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Paz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles & thread. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Paz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles & thread

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is a married woman who lives in Rizal, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a bakery and a fishing business. Her husband Pedrito, who is 62 years old, works as a baker to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have 11 children who are between 18 and 39 years old. Quirina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Quirina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 16,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund the operation of her bakery and fishing businesses so that she can continue to save up for future house repairs and family needs. Quirina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund the operation of her bakery

loans.name: Emilia Simeona

texts.es: Doña Emilia Simeona T. C., es una señor casada, 45 años de esda, cursos el sexto año de educación primaria,, se dedica a la artesania, tejido de cortes típicos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo, cuenta con al apoyo de su conyugue, quien se dedica a la misma actividad, iniciaron su negocio, siendo operacios, quieren ampliar su capital de trabajo, por lo que solicitarion un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de materia prima en este caso mas hilo que es uno de los materiales utilzados par elaborar este trabajo, esperan mejorar su producción, sus ventas y sus ingresos con la inversion del prestamo.
texts.en: Emilia Simeona T. C. is 45 years old and married.  She studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  Emilia makes handicrafts.  She weaves traditional skirts and has 15 years experience in this line of work.  She has the support of her husband who is in the same business.  They would like to increase their working capital and so requested a loan from ASDIR to buy raw materials.  They will buy more fabric which they use to make their products.  They hope to improve their production, their sales and their income with the investment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy material for her weaving business

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Desde hace 20 años Jorge se ha dedicado a la confección junto con su esposa, esta labor les ha permitido una buena calidad de vida, además sus clientes se sientes satisfechos con su servicio, sin embargo actualmente Jorge no tiene como suficiente capacidad de producción y por esto requiere comprar una máquina mas y varios insumos para así poderle cumplir a sus clientes.
texts.en: For twenty years, Jorge has worked with his wife sewing.  This job has provided them with a good quality of life, and their customers are satisfied with the service.  However, Jorge cannot currently produce enough to meet production demands and needs to buy another sewing machine and other supplies to be able to fill his clients' orders.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine and supplies

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 51 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son is a student. He operates an auto parts sales business with the help of his wife, at a rented stall at a local market called Uguumur. He started his business in 1995. At first he used to sell his goods at an outdoor market. After years of business operation, he gained experience and managed to rent a stall at an indoor market. Also, he established a good relationship both with his customers and partners.

Now his monthly net profit is 400,000-500,000 MNT, with a daily earning of 100,000 MNT. He buys used, old cars and makes them into small parts which are ready to be sold. He is an honest man who says, "I am planning to open my own auto repair shop in the future." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more spare parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Ceasaria

texts.en:
Ceasaria is 58 years old and is a married woman with one child. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Ceasaria has been engaged in farming for 20 years. She grows rice crops to sell to other nearby towns. She also bakes bread that she sells to the people in her neighborhood. Ceasaria has requested a loan to purchase flour for her baking, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase flour for her baking and fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena del Carmen es casada con el señor Efraín, en donde procrearon a una hija de nombre Surani Guadalupe de ocho años.

    Ella es la tercera vez que solicita el crédito pero esta  vez cambio de actividad y es para invertirlo  en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, en donde nos comenta que inicio hace cuatro meses y ve que le está dando resultado en la ganancia.

    En esta actividad la animo un hermano suyo quien también se dedica a lo mismo, pues él le daría la mercancía un mejor precio para así tener algo mejor que le ganancias así mas adelante agrandarlo con cosa de mejor calidad.

    su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad pueda ahorrar para que con el tiempo tenga más grande su negocio y sea distribuidora para otros que a un están iniciando.
texts.en:
Lorena del Carmen is married to Efraín, and they have a daughter, Surani Guadalupe, who is eight years old.

This is the third time she has requested a loan, even though this time she has changed activity: the loan she is requesting will be used to buy products to supply her general store. She told us she opened her shop four months ago, and since then it has provided her with a steady income.

One of her brothers encouraged her to open her shop, as he himself engages in the same kind of activity. However, in her shoes, he would sell her products at higher prices, in order to increase the income, so that in the future she would be able to improve the shop by offering better quality products.

Her biggest wish for her activity is that it will allow her to save enough money to enlarge her shop in the future; she also wishes to become a supplier for other shopkeepers starting up their activities.

loans.use: To buy products for her shop such as beans, sugar, oil and eggs.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene  55 años, es un hombre muy amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rayda de 54 años y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro, pues espera en el futuro vivir una vejez tranquila. Desde muy joven Felipe se interesó por la carpintería y la mecánica es por eso que decidió aprender y ejecutar esta profesión. Actualmente tiene su propio taller de carpintería y mecánica y le va muy bien, tiene muchos pedidos para cumplir y sabe que tiene que cumplirlos todos, si quiere que su negocio siga creciendo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es moldear la madera y sacar los diseños que él quiere. Lleva 34 años en éste trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es darle los toques finales a los trabajos, ya que le toma mucho tiempo. Anhela que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y se convierta en una de las carpinterías y mecánicas más conocidas de la ciudad de Pucallpa, por ello pide su ayuda para que pueda cumplir sus objetivos. Este sería el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que esta dispuesto a pagar a tiempo sus cuotas,  ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuoso con el resto de socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más madera, tubos y fierros para fabricar nuevos muebles y así cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Felipe is 55 and a very friendly man. He lives in his own home together with his wife Rayda, 54. He isn't afraid to work very hard, because he hopes one day to be able to relax in his old age. Since he was very young, Felipe had an interest in carpentry and mechanics, which is why he decided to learn and make it his profession. Currently he has his own carpentry and mechanical workshop and it's going very well. He has a lot of order to fill and knows that he has to finish them all if he wants his business to keep growing. What he likes most about his work is shaping the wood and getting the designs that he wants. He has been doing this for 34 years and considers the most difficult aspect to be making the final touches on the work, since it takes a lot of time. 

He longs for his business to grow with time and become one of the most well-known carpentry and mechanics workshops in the city of Pucallpa. He asks for help so that he can meet his objectives. This will be his second loan with MFP, and he is ready to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to cause problems for his village bank, where he is well-respected by the other members. With the 1500 nuevos soles that he has requested, he will buy more wood, tubes and iron to make new furniture and complete his orders.

loans.use: to buy more wood, tubes and iron for making furniture.

loans.name: Femelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Femelita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari sari (variety) store. Femelita is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Femelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Odon

texts.en:
Odon is a 62-year-old married man. He and his wife Francita have 5 children. He is presently living at Bliss, Mahayag, in the province of Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. He is a retired police officer who earns extra income as a farmer.

Odon has been farming for more than ten years. He has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 3 months and has requested a loan for farm financing. In the future, he hopes that his farm will grow and produce more crops so that he can earn more than what he needs.

loans.use: Intended for farm financing

loans.name: Juana Orestila

texts.es:
Juana de 40 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 años que estudia en escuela particular y otro de 1 año. Tiene una farmacia.

Empezó hace 10 años con una liquidación como enfermera de una clínica decidió establecer su propio negocio. Labora de 6H00 am A 9H00 pm. Ella vende en su farmacia todo tipo de medicina necesaria para su clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar vitrinas, recargas a celulares y pañales variedad de productos para su respectiva ventas. En un futuro quiere una copiadoras e instalar cabinas telefónicas para mayor ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana de 40 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 7 años que estudia en escuela particular y otro de 1 año. Tiene una farmacia.

Empezó hace 10 años con una liquidación como enfermera de una clínica decidió establecer su propio negocio. Labora de 6H00 am A 9H00 pm. Ella vende en su farmacia todo tipo de medicina necesaria para su clientela. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a comprar vitrinas, recargas a celulares y pañales variedad de productos para su respectiva ventas. En un futuro quiere una copiadoras e instalar cabinas telefónicas para mayor ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: to buy display cases, cell phone cards and diapers.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Se forma gracias a la iniciativa de una de las señoras que escucho hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y como le gustó mucho, decidió comentárselo a sus amigas y vecinas, es de ahí que deciden formarse y organizarse. Las Señoras son mujeres muy sacrificadas, en su mayoría cabeza de familia. Actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros y están en el 4 ciclo.
La Sra. Epifania vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la artesanía, así logra ayudar para el sustento de su familia. Ella comenta que esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace por que mediante su trabajo no solo genera ingresos para ayudar en la casa sino también promueve la artesanías paraguayas. Su sueño es tener una galería donde exhibir sus artesanías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, colorantes y demás insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito ya que sabe que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The women of the present committee are from the city of Caacupe. They formed at the initiative of one of their own who heard about the program for enterprising women, and since she liked the idea very much, decided to tell her friends and neighbors. As a result, they decided to get together and organize. They are very sacrificing women, in their majority heads of families. At present, there are 12 members and they are in their 4th loan cycle.

Mrs. Epifania lives with her husband and children. She is an artisan who by means of her work, is able to help sustain her family. Epifania says that she is very proud of what she is able to do through her efforts, not only generating income to help with household expenses but also, promoting Paraguayan artisan crafts. Her dream is to have a gallery where she can exhibit her artisan work.

Epifania is requesting a loan to buy cloth, thread, coloring and other supplies for the elaboration of her artisan crafts. She has her heart set on the loan, since she knows it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: buy cloth, paint, thread and other supplies to elaborate artisan crafts.

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: Adolfo Antonio tiene 31 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ganado. Esta actividad es muy popular en nuestro país, pues la mayoría de las personas tienen este medio de vida para sobrevivir. Hace más de 8 años, que se dedica a este negocio cuando dio inicio fue por su familia, fue así que Adolfo aprendió de este negocio debido a la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de vacas, terneros y toros.
texts.en: Adolfo Antonio is 31 years old. He makes a living buying and selling cattle. This type of work is very popular in his country, as it is the way of life for the majority of people. Adolfo Antonio has been in this business for over eight years. He started because of his family and learned this business because of the need to cover his household expenses. He is requesting this loan to buy cows, calves and bulls.

loans.use: to buy cows, calves and bulls

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. У нее двое сыновей. Светлана живет в Мелитополе и торгует подростковой одеждой на местном Рижском рынке. Она занимается этим бизнесом уже 15 лет. У нее хороший опыт работы и умение правильно общаться с покупателями. У нее в товаре около 35 000 гривен. 

Светлана планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен, чтобы закупить товар к школьному сезону, а именно школьные формы, блузки, брюки, юбки и т.д. Светлана целеустремленный предприниматель. Она привязана к своему бизнесу  и хочет вкладывать в его дальнейшее развитие и процветание.  

Пометка: история  на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Svetlana is married with two sons. She lives in Melitipol and sells teen clothing at the local market Riga. She's been in the business for 15 years. She has good work experience and communicates well with customers. She has around 35,000 in inventory. Svetlana is planning to use a loan of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase goods for the school season, namely school uniforms, blouses, pants, skirts, etc. Svetlana is a driven entrepreneur. She is devoted to her business and wants to invest in its further development and prosperity.

loans.use: purchase goods for the school season, in particular, school uniforms, blouses, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is from the village of Partskhanakanebi, West Georgia. He is 53 years old and lives with his mother who is 79 years old. 

Elguja requested credit for the expansion of his rabbit-breeding farm. He has 85 rabbits. He sells them on the Kutaisi and Samtredia (nearby towns) open markets. Elguja also has 2 pigs and sells piglets in the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 580 Laris, including the monthly pension of Elguja’s mother. 

Elguja requested credit to purchase materials for a rabbit hutch expansion, as the existing rabbit hutch is too small and doesn’t allow him to keep more rabbits. Also, part of the requested funds will be used to purchase rabbit feed for the winter season. After the expansion of the rabbit hutch, Elguja will keep more rabbits and increase sales. He will get more income and will be able to improve the living conditions for himself and his old mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a rabbit hutch expansion and feed for the rabbits

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old, married, and has three children.They live in the province of Isabela where her husband plants rice as the family's primary source of income. 

Virginia is hardworking woman who she raises piglets. Though the hog raising business is difficult to manage, she wakes up early to clean the sty and feed the piglets. She recently started selling meat. 

Virgina is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy stock feeds for the daily maintenance of her hogs and meat for her vending activity. She hopes that this loan will provide her with an increased income for her family. With the business she manages, she is able to cover up all of her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase feed stock for daily maintenance of hog raising business and meat for her retailing business

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
The Kertha Bakti group is made up of 15 women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 22,500,000 Rupiah (IDR), and each member will receive 1,500,000 IDR. The group was formed out of these women's common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in receiving education on best practices for raising pigs. This is their fourth loan with MUK. 

Ni Luh is the head of the Kertha Bakti group. She is married and has three children. Her younger son is a toddler and her older son is in school. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Luh would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to sell the piglets after five months for others to fatten. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: El señor Gabino es chofer de transporte libre y su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida. Con el dinero del crédito comprará aros para las llantas de su vehiculo, pues necesita hacer este cambio inmediatamente.  Con los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad de transporte y los ingresos de la esposa por venta de comida cubren los gastos de la familia. Vive en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona German Busch en la ciudad de El Alto. Gabino es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un crédito.
texts.en:
Gabino is an independent taxi driver, and his wife sells food.

He will use the money from the loan to buy hubcaps for his vehicle’s tires.  He needs to make this change immediately.

The income from his transportation business and the income from his wife selling food cover the family’s expenses.

He lives in a rented house in the German Busch area of the city of El Alto.  Gabino is married and has one child.  This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy hubcaps for his vehicle’s tires.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old lady who is married with two children. 

Yasmeen has established a small beauty salon in a room in her house where she works alone as a hair stylist and makeup artist. She also has a few dresses for rental to bring in more income for the family.

Now Yasmeen has applied for this loan in order to improve the beauty salon she has to be more professional by adding new equipment and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and cosmetics

loans.name: Modo

texts.en:
Modo is a 28-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling vegetables in Yei, South Sudan for the last four years.

Modo requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Narly Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Narly a sus 37 años de edad y madre de dos hijos de 17 y 4 años de edad, es cabeza de familia y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de almuerzos en semana y los fines de semana de comidas rápidas.  Esta labor la aprendió de su padre quien tenía un local que posteriormente cerró debido al cansancio que sentía su padre debido a su avanzada edad. Desde su casa la Señora Narly tiene su negocio con el fin de estar pendiente de sus dos hijos y dedicarles más tiempo.
Actualmente la señora Narly desea comprar un carro de comidas rápidas e insumos tales como panes, verduras, carnes, salsas y platos desechables, esto con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Narly, at 37, is the mother of two children aged 17 and 4, and she is the head of the household.  She has a business making and selling lunches during the week, and she sells fast food on the weekends.  She learned this trade from her father, who had a restaurant that he later closed due to the fatigue that he felt because of his advanced age.  Narly runs her business from her house so that she can keep an eye on her 2 children and have more time to spend with them. 

Now Narly wants to buy a fast food cart and supplies such as bread, vegetables, meat, salsas and disposable plates, with the goal of increasing her income and providing for her children's welfare and giving them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart and supplies such as bread, vegetables, meat, salsas and disposable plates

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: La señora Ana Lucía a sus 43 años de edad es madre de un hijo; se dedica desde hace más de 12 años en su propio taller a la confección de prendas de vestir y uniformes. La señora Ana Lucía aprendió esta labor de una amiga quien le enseño. La señora Ana Lucía trabaja en su taller con una vecina y un familiar. La señora Ana Lucía desea comprar una maquina filetiadora con la cual pueda mejorar los tiempos de entrega de los pedidos. Con lo anterior, la señora Ana Lucía podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la señora Ana Lucía es tener un gran taller de confecciones y con este generar empleos directos para sus amigos y familiares.
texts.en: At the age of 43, Mrs. Ana Lucía has one child and has worked in her own sewing workshop for 12 years. She makes clothing and uniforms, and learned this work from a friend. Ana Lucia works with a neighbour and a family member in her workshop. She wants to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to improve her production; it will take her less time to complete an order with this machine. With this loan, Ana Lucia will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life. Her dream is to have a large workshop and generate direct employment for her friends and family.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Evelin Cecilia

texts.es:
Evelin, vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltero, administra una tienda y crianza de cerdos, ella inicio con su madre, dedicándose siempre al negocio de porqueriza, lo tienen en la casa donde viven, no hay un horario especifico para atender las actividades que demanda.
Ella quiere comprar mercadería para la tienda, por eso solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, boquitas, dulces, esto le ayudara para surtir el negocio y para tener más variedad para los clientes.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y que su familia cuente con su apoyo y vivan en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Evelin lives with her parents and brothers and is single. She runs a store and raises pigs. She began these businesses with her mother and she has always worked at the pork business. They run the business from the house where they live and there isn't a specific timetable by which they carry out the needed work.
She wants to buy supplies for the store, and so she is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, snacks, and snacks. This will help her to stock the business and offer a greater variety to the customers.
Her hope is to grow the business so that her family can count on it's support and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, snacks, and candy.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa integrante del Banco comunal “Futuros Emprendedores” perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo artículos de artesanía en un puesto que ubica en diferentes ferias libres. Trabaja en su negocio desde hace 7 años.
En su local de artesanía y bazar, ofrece aros, joyas bañadas en oro y plata, además de cinturones, cintillos, collares y ropa hindú, para varón, dama y niños.
Rosa trabaja de martes a domingo, ya que los días lunes lo dedica para realizar las compras de mercadería.
Comenta que durante todo el año mantiene sus ventas, por lo que le va muy bien, sin embargo durante la temporada de navidad sus ventas aumentan considerablemente, por lo que sus ganancias las utiliza para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. 
Con el crédito comprará un generador, una carpa y mercadería para su negocio.
Una de sus metas es comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora utiliza un triciclo.
Rosa vive junto a sus dos hijos y una nieta de seis años de edad, uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus carreras universitarias, para que sean profesionales, lo que les permitiría tener una estabilidad económica. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con este negocio se deben a que le permite mantener económicamente su hogar. 
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que sin esta ayuda no hubiese podido invertir en su negocio.
Las capacitaciones han servido de guía para incrementar sus ganancias.
Por otro lado comenta que el grupo del cual forma parte es muy responsable y unido.
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Rosa started the Communal Bank, “Futuros Emprendedores” belonging to the municipality of Peñalolén.

She is the head of commerce, specifically selling artesian goods at a post located in various free markets. She has worked in this business for 7 years.

In her local crafts and bazaar, she offers rings, jewelry bathed in gold and silver, in addition to belts, rings, necklaces and hindu clothes, for men, ladies and children.

Rosa works Tuesday-Sunday, since Mondays she buys her merchandise. She says that during the year she maintains sales, and she is doing very well.  Nevertheless, during the Holiday Season her sales increase considerably and she utilizes her earnings to continue investing in her business. 

With the loan she will buy a generator, a tent and merchandise for her business. One of her goals is to buy a van to transport her merchandise, since now she uses a three-wheel bike. 

Rosa lives with her two children and her granddaughter of 6 years. One of her dreams is for her children to finish their undergraduate degrees, so that they can become professionals that will enable them to have economic stability.
 
The motivations of continuing with this business are due to the fact that it allows her to economically maintain her home.

She is grateful for the loan she has obtained through Fondo Esperanza, since without it she would not have been able to invest in her business. 

The training has served as a guide to increase her profits. On the other hand, she says that the group is very responsible and united. 
.
Peñalolén is located in a Metropolitan region. It has various attractive traits such as vineyards, historical buildings and natural excursion sites, elements that are transforming this municipality into a new tourism scene within the Metropolitan region.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a tent and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, es  una joven  muy emprendedora y responsable, actualmente  ella  trabaja  por  las  mañanas  y  en las  noches  estudia  en la  universidad,  ella  se acerco a la institución ya  que  nos  comenta  que desea  pagar   su colegiatura  semestral, esta  muy  contenta  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  gracias  al apoyo  podrá  continuar sus  estudios y  en poco  tiempo  lograra  concluir  con su mayor  sueño el cual es convertirse  en  una licenciada.
texts.en: Sandra is a responsible, very enterprising young woman.  She currently works in the morning and attends University at night.  She called on the Institution because she tells us that she wants to pay her semester’s tuition.  She’s very happy to have found us because thanks to the support she’ll get she will be able to continue with her studies and shortly reach her greatest dream which is to become a lawyer.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Desmond Massuba's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni,  is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 5,600,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Desmond is the leader of this group of teachers. Desmond was born in Jaima Sewafeh in eastern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-six years old and married to a nurse. The couple has three children together. Two are in college and the other is not of school-going age. Desmond has been a teacher for twenty-seven years. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees both for his children and for himself in order to pursue further studies.

loans.use: to pay college fees both for his children and for himself to pursue further studies.

loans.name: Izdehar

texts.en: Izdehar is a 31 year old married woman who has 2 family members from Al Karak Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for her home improvements, she wants to do maintenance for the balcony. She would like to expand her home. In the future she is planning on adding another rooms.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Mirian De Jesus

texts.es:
Dona Mirian of Jesus with 45 years in his youth graduated from chartered accountant and currently is studying difficulties although remote a degree in college. Previously he had not done since his parents did not have the resources to help you complete college but taught him to work the land. She is married with 3 children the oldest is 17 years who shared cycle path and then decided to emigrate to the United States to seek a better life status, the second daughter is 15 and is in his third year common cycle and the third daughter is 13 and is in his first year common cycle in a basic center in the same community. She's a very feisty and also works as a teacher in the basic center of the community to help her husband to generate more income for your family. Customers are wineries that it has exclusively engaged in the purchase and sale of coffee in another location specifically.
She has asked the COMIXMUL cooperative financing with which you plan to maintain a good portion of land on which the expenditure is large and does not have the capital to purchase agricultural inputs.
One of the dreams for the future is to have a hardware store in the community because there is much needed and which as enterprising woman fighter and has identified the need to satisfy one of its goals. She believes that other business can offer a better status of life to their children and fulfill its purpose, which is to leave them a strengthened balance sheet.
