loans.use: for the purchase of fertilizer, foliar pesticides among others for their coffee crops.

loans.name: Luận's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Luận is 39 years old and she is married.
 
She has had a retail business selling cake, sweet, milk,... and general thing for more than 10 years.
Luận lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Luận faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweet, milk,... and general thing to go around the district for sale.
In 2014, Luận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Luận has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Luận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweet, milk,... and general thing to resell

loans.name: Kozé Kalé

texts.en:
Kozé Kalé M. was born on December 24, 1970. She is married and the mother of five children. She also has three other dependents, children from her deceased brother. To help meet the needs of her household, she leaned the handicraft of making colorful waist cloths and has made a professional business out of it. This handicraft is a growth opportunity requiring a good deal of financing. Lacking this, Mrs. M. cannot produce her goods in high volume, while her waist cloths are in demand by the inhabitants of her area. An inventive woman, she puts all of her know-how into her work resulting in goods of exceptional quality. Thanks to her keen management sense, she was able to repay all the loans she has gotten.

Today, Mrs. M. is requesting a new loan of $850 as capital to acquire materials for increasing her production of colorful waist cloths. Uninterrupted production will provide her with substantial income for improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Kozé Kalé est née le 24 décembre 1970. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle prend également en charge trois (03) enfants de son frère décédé. Afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle apprit la fabrication artisanale des pagnes teintés et en fait une activité professionnelle. C’est un secteur porteur qui demande assez de financement. Ce qui fait que Madame M. n’a pas la capacité de faire une grande production alors que ses pagnes intéressent beaucoup les habitants de sa localité. Femme ingénieuse, elle met tout son savoir-faire au service de ce travail, ce qui confère à la production une qualité exceptionnelle. Grâce à son sens aigu de gestion, elle a su rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle a obtenus.

Ajourd’hui, Madame M. sollicite un nouveau crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des matériels de fabrication des pagnes teintés. Une production permanente permettra à Madame M. de disposer d’un revenu consistant en vue de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy material for making colorfully dyed cloth

loans.name: Tariyel

texts.en:
Tariyel has his own grocery store. He has run this business for 2 years. 
Having borrowed $700 he bought foodstuffs. This business has allowed his family to have a better income.
He is very optimistic that his business will succeed.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a refrigerator.
Tariyel is 37 years old, a father of 2 children and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married and she has a11-year-old son and a 17-year-old daughter. Four years ago, her husband was dismissed due to personnel cuts, he found another job but he was earning a lower salary and it wasn’t enough to clear all the family expenses. Due to this situation, Maria was forced to start her own business of selling jewelry. She has done well, now her husband and her older daughter help her and thanks to the quality of the products, she has gained a lot of clients.

Maria is requesting for a loan of $250 to buy more merchandise, like this she will to be able to cover the demand and to continue to grow like she has done up until now. She commits to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. You ca help to improve the well-bieng of this family, don’t hesitate and help them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria de los Ángeles es casada y tiene un hijo de 11 años y una hija de 17. Hace cuatro años su esposo fue despedido por recorte de personal, después encontró otro empleo pero en este recibía un menor salario y era insuficiente para la solventar los gastos de su hogar, ante esta situación Maria se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio con la venta de joyería, en el que le ha ido bien, ahora cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y su hija mayor y gracias a la calidad de sus productos ha estado ganando muchos clientes.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora lo ha hecho, Maria solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que atizará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Business Description

Señora Nancy started her business about 3 years ago with some money that her husband received selling ice-cream throughout the city. She has a mini-mart where she sells basic food supplies. Her husband helps her to run the business which is notably growing.

Loan Use

She would like to purchase more merchandise to stock up her store because she wants to make sure her clients are satisfied since her store is one of the 3 best stores in town.

Personal Information

She is 33 years old and she has 4 children. Three of the children are in school. She lives in a house made out of reed. Her goal is to keep her business growing so that she and her family can move ahead!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Nancy empezó su negocio hace tres años con un capital que lo obtuvo de su esposo gracias a la venta de helados en varios lugares del sector , ella tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad , en el negocio le ayuda su esposo y es notable su crecimiento.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su tienda y tener a sus clientes satisfechos ya que es una de las tres mejores tiendas del sector.

Información Personal

Tiene 33 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales tres estudian, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer en su negocio y de esta manera poder sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wayan Sarmi

texts.id:
Because she resides in a rural area, Wayan Sarmi loves breeding, and breeding pigs generates adequate income. From the loan, currently Wayan Sarmi is able to purchase 4 local breed pigs also know as the Bali pig and supplies adequate for several months. After 3 months of feeding the pigs will be suitable to be a mother pigs. To cover expenses, 3 will be sold for Rp 2.000.000 (USD250) and 1 kept for breeding. Net income attained from this after 3 months will be Rp 700.000 (about USD90), can be used to supplement income from her husband as a farmer; 2 children are still her dependent.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Karena terletak di daerah pedalaman Wayan Sarmi gemar beternak, ternak yang dirasa cukup menghasilkan yaitu beternak babi. Dari pinjaman yang dia dapatkan saat ini Wayan Sarmi dapat membeli 4 ekor babi jenis lokal atau babi Bali, dan juga membeli persediaan pakan untuk beberapa bulan berikutnya. Masa pemeliharaan penggemukan hanya 3 bulan dan sudah siap menjadi calon induk.Untuk meringankan biaya akan 3 ekor penggemukan dijual dengan harga Rp.2.000.000,- dan 1 babi dipersiapkan menjadi Induk. Keuntungan bersih dalam 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp.700.000,- dapat dipakai untuk menambah pendapatan suami yang seorang petani dan 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungannya.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
Andre always dreamt about marrying the woman with whom he fell deeply in love, but he needed to be able to offer her a future. He began to think about the possibilities available to him and he decided to take advantage and use his knowledge and experience with computers to open up an internet service business. Another benefit was that he was located across the street from a school. His business provides computer rental, battery charging and computer sales. Andre is grateful that this business provided him the means to overcome his expenses and he was able to get married.

Now, Andre believes that he should offer more computer related services to his clients, and so he's requesting a loan of $575 USD (to be paid in 6 months). With this loan Andre will be able to purchase new technical/computer accessories like: a scanner, a web camera, and other items which will make his services more attractive to his clients. With your help Andre's business will continue to grow and one day he will be able to start a family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Andrés siempre soñó con casarse con la mujer de quien se enamoró profundamente, pero necesitaba poder ofrecerle un futuro. Y comenzó a pensar de qué manera él podría sacar dinero para mantener a su esposa. Aprovechando los conocimientos en mantenimiento de computación y al ver que frente a su casa había una escuela, decidió abrir un cyber, y dar servicio de renta de computadoras, recarga de cartuchos, venta de equipo de computo. Gracias a este negocio Andrés a podido sobrellevar los gastos desde que se casó.

Sin embargo, Andrés cree necesario que su negocio se consolide y abarque más opciones dentro del mundo de la computación. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Andrés podrá comprar accesorios nuevos, como scanner, cámaras web, entre otras cosas que harán que el negocio sea más atractivo para los clientes. Con tu ayuda lograrás que el negocio de Andrés crezca cada vez más y en un futuro logre tener hijos.

loans.use: To purchase computer related products in order to offer better services in his internet business. (Comprar artúculos para ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes)

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 40-year-old entrepreneur. She lives with her husband and six of his children in Kisumu, Kenya. Carolyne runs a handicraft business with her husband that they initiated in 1990. The business is situated along a busy road often used by tourists. She uses locally available papyrus reeds that are found along the lake to make baskets, traditional seatts (selling prices ranges between US $55.55 to US $ 285.70) , caps and brooms used by the locals.

Her business has done quite well due to the added advantage of access to loan funds; she has combined the additional money with hard work and perseverance in order to increase her stock of items for sale and build a successful income-generating activity. Carolyne is proud of her accomplishments and now requires US $ 1000 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es:
Fatima Argentina is a single mother and has an 11-year-old boy. Due to the lack of income from her ex-husband, she found it necessary to start a business. Five years ago, she started a small business selling school supplies, which today has become a bookstore. She offers complete service to students who need it. She puts a lot of work into her business because her biggest dream is to be able to help her son get ahead and to provide him with a full education. Her store is located in the outlying market of Managua. She needs to buy school supplies for the school year that is coming up, and she needs to cover the demand of the clients who visit the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Fatima Argentina es madre soltera y tiene un niño de 11 años. Debido a la falta de ingreso por parte de su ex esposo se vió en la necesidad de poner un negocio, empezó hace 5 años montando una pequeña venta de útiles escolares, la cual hoy se ha convertido en una librería, en la cual ofrece un competo servicio a los estudiantes que lo requieren. Ella pone mucho empeño en su trabajo porque su mayor anhelo es poder sacar a su pequeño hijos, poder darle sus estudios completos. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado periférico de Managua. Necesita comprar útiles escolares por la que la época escolar está por venir y necesita cubrir las demandas de los clientes que visitan el mercado.

loans.use: To purchase notebooks, backpacks, school uniforms, and school books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store

loans.name: Teodora Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teodora C. lives in San Caralampio, La Concha, is married, and her husband is a vendor. He sells cleaning products for the home, they have two children studying in high school. They are a hard working family who by combining their efforts has been making ends meet. For 15 years they have worked the earth producing pineapple, which they sell in the markets in the capital. They are asking for a loan to buy products to maintain the crop which will be ready for harvest soon. For their profits they have many plans for the earnings, such as high school tuition for their children, invest in the husband’s business which brings monthly income, and other expenses. Their dream is that their children help with the pineapple production work. To see the sunrise every morning over their beautiful pineapple plantation is a very emotional experience for this hard working mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teodora C. habita en San Caralampio, La Concha, es casada y su esposo se dedica al Comercio. Vende productos de limpieza para el hogar, tienen dos hijos que estudian la secundaria. Ellos son una familia trabajadora que uniendo sus esfuerzos han salido adelante, desde hace 15 años trabajan las tierras produciendo piña, la cual venden en los mercados de la capital, solicitan el crédito para comprar productos de mantenimiento para la cosecha que pronto estará lista, sobre esta ganancia tienen muchos planes como gastos de colegio de sus hijos, invertir en el negocio de su esposo que les representa un ingreso mensual y otros. Su ilusión es que sus hijos le ayuden en el trabajo de la producción de piña, ver todas las mañanas el amanecer sobre su hermosa plantío de piña es una gran emoción para esta madre emprendedora.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural maintenance supplies

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María de la Paz is married and has two children ages 13 and 10, both of whom are students. Her husband works as an employee of a business in their area. She started the business four years ago to contribute to the family expenses, as there were frequent money shortages. Four years ago she began selling household items by catalog, and now she buys packages and sells much more.

She requests a loan of $775, which she will repay over 6 months, to remodel her store and be able to exhibit more merchandise. With your help María will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María de la Paz es casada y tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años, ambos son estudiantes. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de la localidad. Inicio su negocio para solventar los gastos familiares ya que las carencias eran muchas hace 4 años inicio con la venta de artículos para el hogar por catalogo, actualmente compra por paquetes y vende muchos mas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y poder exhibir más mercancía. Con tu apoyo María saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Remodel store

loans.name: Jinja Agency Women's Group

texts.en:
K. Rashidah, the Chairperson for Jinja Agency Lending group, is an exception. She is a “hawker” and sells new clothes for young girls without a fixed location, but walks around busy markets and taxi parks carrying and selling them, a job she has done for 6 years. She is 50 years and married with 7 children, as she caters for 2 stepchildren and 4 grandies. Rashidah says life is good now, compared to when she was trading in used clothing, and she has been able to buy a fridge with the previous loan, stocked it with soda, and placed it in a friend’s shop.

With her portion of the group loan, she plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, which she buys from Kampala, the capital city, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice. She is really business oriented and respected as the group leader, and she has a 6 years’ experience with loans. Her dream is to be able to rent a store as her shop because moving around is not an easy job now that she is growing old.

loans.use: Kayingo Rashidah plans to buy more new girls’ clothing to sell, as well as stock the fridge with more soda, beer and juice.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru:
Sulton S. lives with his family in Yavan, Tajikistan. He is a 40 years old farmer, married with 6 children. Sulton grows vegetables on a piece of land which he owns. Currently this is a harvesting season after which the land has to be fertilized before sowing new crops. Sulton needs money to buy some good quality fertilizer. This is why he is applying for a loan. The loan will help him to reach his goal of making more money and providing for better life for his children. He is planning to pay the loan off in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer

Шамсиддинов Султон житель города Яван. Живет вместе со своей семьей. Ему 40 лет , он женат и имеет 6 детей. Занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли, который засеивает овощами. Наступил сезон сбора урожая и посева новых овощей. Для этого необходимо обработать , закупив удобрения . Для закупки качественных удобрений и получения качественного урожая , нужны деньги. Поэтому Султон обратился к нм за помощью. Получив . кредит он сможет достичь своех целей , которые дадут возможность заработать больше и дать своим детям лучшие условия. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is divorced with one child. She is a 45 year old trader. She has been trading in jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags for the past nine years. Beatrice says her working capital was provided by family members and friends, but has not been adequate for her business. It is not enough to purchase high quality products in good quantities. With the loan she will be able to purchase good quality stock for her customers.  She belongs to the community group called ‘Jehovah Nissi Trust Group’. Peer pressure and support provide additional incentive to repay, because if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy more jeans, trousers, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S. trades in yams in the community market of Obuasi in Ghana. She treks to farming communities to buy yams from the farmers and sells them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams to serve her customers. 

She dreams of expanding her business to include additional items, like plantains and cassava, to meet the needs of her customers and increase her income. 

Yaa is married with eight children and is a member of the community group called "Aseda wura". Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer support to repay the loans on time.

loans.use: To buy yams, cassava and plantain to sell.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi: Cũng giống như nhiều gia đình  sống ở nông thôn khác T. nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị T. đều từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Năm 2006 chị T. tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Chồng chị ngoaì thời gian đi làm T.ê cũng giúp đỡ vợ rất nhiều  nên công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển và cho T. nhập ổn định.  Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm lợn về nuôi.
texts.en:
Like most of the families in the region, Mrs T. and her family rely on farming and raising pigs as their main income. In 2006, Mrs T. joined TYM to get a loan to invest in her pig raising business. Her husband is a worker, he helps her out a lot so their pig raising business is well developed. Her family income is stable. This time she wishes to get a loan of 9.000.000 VND to buy more pigs

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale T., 30, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Fale's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy weed killer, pesticides, chemicals, gromozone, knives and sharpeners. Her husband is lending a great help in operating the business.

loans.use: buy  weedkiller, pesticides, chemicals, gromozones, knives, sharpeners

loans.name: Ni Putu Okayoni

texts.id: Okayoni dan keluarganya sangat menggantungkan  hidupnya dari hasil mengolah tanah  pertanian, khususnya tanaman sayur kacang panjang. Okayoni merasa sangat  senang dengan pekerjaan yang ditekuni ini, terlebih lagi setelah mendapat pinjaman periode pertama dari Dinari. Okayoni merasa hasil yang di perolehpun semakin meningkat. Hal ini tak terlepas dari hasil kerja keras dan bantuan modal yang di peroleh untuk penyediaan pupuk maupun obat-obatan yang di butuhkan oleh tanamannya.                                    nPada panen yang lalu Okayoni mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan yaitu sebesar Rp 2.000.000.-  Hasil ini sudah merupakan keuntungan bersih setelah dipotong biaya bibit, pupuk, obat-obatan dan tenaga kerja. Namun  semua itu dikerjakan selama hampir 4 bulan dari pengolahan tanah sampai selesai panen. nBersama dengan I Ketut Sudi Utama, suaminya, Okayoni saat ini telah menanam kembali bibit baru untuk musim berikutnya dan sangat berharap masih mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari karena keuntungan yang didapat belum cukup untuk membiayai seluruh keperluan usahanya dan juga sebagian besarnya telah dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan biaya pendidikan 3 orang anaknya. Apalagi saat ini biaya kebutuhan  semakin naik, termasuk juga didalamnya Pupuk dan Obat-obatan. Untuk menunjang usahanya, Okayoni bergabung dengan program Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. n
texts.en:
Okayoni and her husband are long bean farmers. Their lives are depending on the result of their farm. In the last harvest season, she got a very good harvest. With this she can repay her loan that she got from DINARI foundation. She earned a net income of IDR 2 million (around USD 210) from her effort of farming for 4 months.

With her husband, Mr. I Ketut Sudi Utama, she wants to get another loan from DINARI to enable her to buy seeds for the next farming seasons. This is because her income is not enough to start up the next farming seasons after being used to pay school fees for her 3 children and also to pay daily necessities.

She wants to join a 6 month DINARI program where she can get a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will pay the loan at the end of the program.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli bibit, pupuk dan anti hama)

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif is an 18-year-old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon. Afif is an employee in a furniture gallery. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to repair his car. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, Afif plans to own his private business.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Née vers 1971 à Adjohoun dans la vallée dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud du Bénin, Dame K. Célestine est mariée Fooly Jonas. Ancienne revendeuse des produits divers, elle s'est maintenant reconvertis en vendeuse de pain. Aujourd'hui, elle fabrique du pain que les gens viennent chercher à la maison, dans l'optique d'accroitre son activité, elle sollicite ce crédit pour le renforcement de l'activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1971 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé valley in southern Bénin, Ms. Célestine K. is married to Jonas Fooly. Formerly a seller of miscellaneous items, she now sells bread. Today, she makes bread that people come to buy from her house. With the vision of increasing her business, she seeks this loan to reinforce the business.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of wheat flour

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda Larano, a 43-year-old mother of two children, grows rice on her farm. Her parents taught her everything about how to plant rice, prepare the soil, and plow the field. She even knows when to apply the fertilizers and pesticides to insure a good harvest on her farm. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, a town of 35,757 people. Farming is her life. She has been a farmer for twelve years because she believes that she will have a bright future in this kind of endeavor. 

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer like urea and ammonium. She thinks that, by doing so, she could triple her yield and earn bigger income. In this way, she could have more to give to her family and her children. She dreams of sending all her children to college so that life will be easier for them when they grow up. 

CEVI continually helps Erlinda succeed in her business. Through CEVI's credit assistance, training, and insurance services, Erlinda can make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en: L., age 28, raises pigs in a stall next to her house. She will sell her pigs to a slaughterer six months after they mature. She is married to Teng, who is 26 years old, and who works as a carrying worker at the busy market. The young couple is responsible for two young children. L. is requesting a loan to buy a piglet to raise and to build a small store to begin working as a grocery seller.

loans.use: To buy piglet to raise and to build a small grocery store

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Gregoria es casada, tiene 58 años y 9 hijos, Gregoria tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. una empleada.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y leche.
El sueño D. Gregoria son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the Despertar (“Awaken”) Cooperative Bank. Gregoria is married, 58 years old, and has 9 children. Gregoria has a general store in her home where she sells general groceries, meats, vegetables, an activity she carries out every day with the help of one employee. Gregoria needs a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and milk. Gregoria’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Phearum P. lives in Trapaing Chambork village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because she usually pays much money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to help plow the field and reduce her expense for plowing.

Her husband, Kong Kem, is a driver who has a little salary. Phearum is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one who is a construction worker and the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy an ox to help plow the filed and reduce her expense for plowing.

loans.name: Sharifboi

texts.ru: Шарифбой - мужчина 45 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно-рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Жена домохозяйка. Шарифбой каждое утро гонит свой скот на пастбище, чтобы они питались горной травой. И потом гонит обратно домой. Только дойные коровы остаются дома. Жена помогает присматривать за оставшимся скотом. Этим она помогает мужу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Шарифбой в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Sharifboi is a 45 year old man. He is married and has 6 children. He fattens and sells large and small livestock. His wife is a homemaker. Sharifboi takes his livestock to the pasture every morning so that they can feed on mountain grasses and afterwards herds them back home. Only the dairy cows stay at home. His wife helps him to look after the leftover livestock. This way she helps her husband so that their family income improves. Sharifboi would like to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria V.  tiene 46 años, está casada, y tiene un hijo.  El cliente es propietario de una mercería bien surtida con artículos escolares ropas en general.  El negocio esta ubicada en un punto estratégico para la venta, en un  barrio de la ciudad de San Bernardino a unos tres Kilómetros del centro.
 
El negocio funciona desde 1998 en donde Maria trabaja con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que su hijo pueda estudiar y ser profesional en la vida. El cliente realiza sus ventas todos los días en su domicilio.

Cuenta que con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundación pudo comprar mercaderías (artículos escolares, ropas para niños y adultos). Hoy día su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es de seguir comprando mercaderías y agrandar el negocio así poder mejor y mayor atención a su clientela.
texts.en:
Maria V. is 46 years old: she is married and has one son. This client is the owner of a haberdashery well-stocked with school equipment and clothes in general. The business is strategically located for sale, in a suburb of San Bernardino town some three kilometre from the centre. The business has been operating since 1998, and Maria works hard and makes many sacrifices in order to provide her family with a better quality of life and so that her son can study and become a professional. This client makes sales everyday from her home. She recounts that with the loans which the Foundation have authorised, she has been able to buy merchandise (school equipment, adult and child clothing). Today her business is growing little by little thanks to her efforts and sacrifices. Her short-term objective is to continue buying merchandise and expand the business, in order to improve the services offered to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase child and adult clothing

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng H. is 60 years old and a resident of the province of Banteay Meanchey where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows both rice and vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of six children, all of whom are married.

Two of her children help support the family by working at different jobs; one sells boiled corn and the other one is a construction worker. Seng H. requests a loan in the amount of US$ 300 as capital to cultivate crops during the farming season.

loans.use: To cultivate crops during the farming season

loans.name: Rosa Sonia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Rosa es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta llamada “Emely Graf” esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad en un local alquilado. Además Rosa vende insumos de imprenta que ofrece a las demás imprentas.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papeles.
Los sueños de Rosa son implementar con maquinas modernas su negocio y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank Morenita II. Rosa is married, 37 years old, and has 3 children; Rosa and her husband have a printing press called “Emely Graf” that is located in the center of the city in a rented locale. In addition Rosa sells printing supplies and offers to the rest printing services. Rosa needs a loan of 750 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of paper. Rosa’s dreams are to run her business with modern machinery, and that her children receive a good education and are well fed.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase paper.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu Y., 50, is a villager living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she earns a living selling fritters from her home for income. She is married to Mr. Deum (shown in the picture), 47, who works as a local building worker. This family has given birth to two children who are still living in the family home. Because Tu Y. is lacking the capital to buy a vehicle in order to make transportation easier, she is looking for a loan to purchase a used motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia S. is from the village of Purok 9B, Zone 3, Kiwalan Iligan City. She is 55 years old. Julia is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Julia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Julia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 9B, Zone 3, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del

loans.name: Pamella Atieno

texts.en:
Pamella sells small dried fish called omena at the Oile market in Kisumu. She buys them at a nearby beach on Lake Victoria and transports them back to town to sell. A 40-year-old woman, Pamella has been selling omena for about 14 years. She will use the proceeds from her loan to buy more stock so that she can increase the volume of fish going through her business every day.

Pamella is a widow who is currently caring for ten children – six are her own, and four are orphans left to her care. She says that she currently has a hard time earning enough money to pay for all of their expenses – food, clothes, school fees, and medicines. She does not have anyone to look after the children while she is working, so is forced to bring those that are not in school along with her. Pamella says that with the money from her loan, she can diversify her suppliers and be more certain of getting a fair price on her purchases.

In addition to running her business, Pamella works as a community health worker with K-MET, the field partner providing this loan. She visits people in her community who are sick, and refers them to the appropriate medical service providers. She also educates her community on best practice in health-related issues, and tries to take care of those who need help with basic tasks.

loans.use: To purchase a larger stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is twenty-six years old. She is wife and mother of two children, currently her children are in school. She is a trader who trades in jeans clothes, blouses and skirts, women’s slippers, dressing bags etc. she has been in this business for three years. Augustina says her working capital is very low and therefore not adequate and this does not enable her to purchase high quantity and quality products. She believes that, with the loan she will be more resourced to meet the taste and preference of her customers. She wants to use the loan to include the sale of garment clothes, lace cloth, linen materials.

loans.use: To include the sales of garment clothes, lace and linen materials

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es:
A la edad de 31 años, la dama Nubia L. se dedica a la actividad de elaboración y venta de artesanías las que son comercializadas en su establecimiento y localidad en el departamento de Masaya. 

Ella es una persona muy esforzada que ha luchado por salir adelante y beneficar a su familia. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque solicitó el crédito oportuno para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar las artesanías. Es di importancia destacar que Masaya es la cuna de las artesanías en Nicaragua y es por esto que ella anhela recibir el crédito para comercializar las artesanías y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Nubia L. has been making and selling handicrafts from her store in the district of Masaya.

She is a very courageous person who has struggled to get ahead for the benefit of her family. The reason why she has come to CEPRODEL is so that she could request a loan to purchase raw materials for making her handicrafts. It is important to highlight that Masaya is known as the cradle of handcrafted works in Nicaragua. She hopes to receive her loan so that she can continue selling her handicrafts and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: La sra. Jaqueline se dedica al envasado y venta de condimentos en las ciudades de Oruro y El Alto de la ciudad de La Paz, anteriormente solo se dedicaba a su venta, ahora ella conjuntamente con su familia envasan el producto para su venta posterior, los productos que vende son aji, pimienta, comino, ajo y locoto molido, tienen ya un mercado seguro en la ciudad de Oruro. Ella vive con sus padres y con su hijo que esta estudiando, es muy buena cliente, muy puntual. El crédito será invertido en la compra de envases, tanto sobres como las cajas para el envasado de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jaqueline is dedicated to bottling and selling condiments in the cities of Oruro and El Alto, near La Paz. Previously, she was dedicated only to selling, but now she with her family bottle the products to posterior sell. The products she sells are aji-pepper, black and white pepper, cumin, garlic and ground chili pepper. She has already a secured market in the city of Oruro. She lives with her parents and with her son, who is in school. She is a very good client, very punctual. The loan will be used to buy bottles as well as packages and boxes to pack her products.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: will be used to buy packages to her products

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine, 50, is the chairperson of her group in Mukono. She is a businesswoman with a stall in Kasenge, where she sells fresh fruits and vegetables she gets from the Mukono and Nakawa markets every day. She does this because she wants to sell all her produce fresh and this has enabled her to keep her customers to herself. She also has a business of selling clothes from the same area for ladies, children and men, and this helps bring in an extra income. She has a dream of owning a boutique in the future.

She is married with six children, all in school, and she takes care of some other orphans and grandchildren. Justine needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Azamhon

texts.ru: Азамхон Турсунов проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Азамхон по специальности "пекарь". Он имеет лепечешную, где печет лепешки. У него имеются постоянные покупатели. Кредит просит для ремонта и восстановления лепешечной.
texts.en:
Azamhom T. lives in the town of Qurgan-tube. He is 33 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Azamhon's profession is a baker. He has a bakery where he makes flat breads. He has regular customers. He is asking for a loan to repair and restore his bakery.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For repair and restoration of bakery

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva B. is from the village of  Batangan, Valencia City. She is 26 years old. Eva is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a  loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This  will be the 1st loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Kyaterekera Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Jesca is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a 35 years old, hardworking and determined. She is a married lady with five children aged from 18 years to 4 months. She hopes to build a decent house for them.

Jesca has operated a business selling secondhand clothes from Jinja for four years. Although she is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week, she is faced with a scarcity of good products for sale. She needs a loan to help buy more clothes for a steady supply.

Jesca is grateful for her loans because they help her have enough stock yet of good quality. She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of bales of clothes so that she could earn more from increased sales.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Amador

texts.en:
Amador is a 51-year-old farmer. He is married and has six children to take care of, his oldest child being 23.

Amador tills his land for rice crops. When free of farming duties, he uses his skills as an electrician, repairing broken appliances. He works hard to provide for his family, especially his kids’ education.

Amador has been a member of CEVI for quite some time now. The financial service he obtains is really helpful to his business. He is now requesting a loan of  Php 10,000 which he will use to finance his farm. He will buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeung V., age 59, and her husband, Mr. Vun Kun, age 61, have been married since 1970 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, one works in a garment factory and the other one attends school. The family lives approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Oeung and her husband are farmers. They grow corn on their farmland in the village and hope to continue increasing the volume of their products. Therefore, Oeung is asking for a loan of $500 to pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to use on her farm.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline manages a 2-hectare rice field and a hog-raising business. She is 40 years old, married, and has children. She is happy to share that her business is currently going well. She wants to maintain its status so she can provide for her family’s growing needs. She applied for a loan of PHp 7,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used for farm inputs and feed for the hogs.

loans.use: farm inputs and hog feed

loans.name: Rebie

texts.en:
Rebie S. is from the village of Matugas Alto in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rebie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebie provides motorcycle transportation to local community members. Rebie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Rebie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Rebie is requesting a new loan of 2000 PHP to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle so she can provide better service. This will be Rebie's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Marcia De Jesus

texts.es: Marcia de 37 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Wilber Duarte, con quien procreo 2 hijos, Wilber de 7 años estudiando el 2do credo y una bebita de 20 meses de nombre Milagros.  Marcia trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa desde hace 13 años como enfermera, su esposo tambien es enfermero pero trabaja en el Centro de Salud de Santo Domingo.  Esta solicitando su 9no credito y espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva, pues desea poner la ceramica a la sala de su casa, ya que actualmente es embaldozada, y como la bebé esta en la edad de jugar en el piso desea lo mas pronto posible ejecutar este pequeño proyecto para evitar enfermedades, y si el dinero lo permite mejorar el baño,  expresa que gracias a los creditos que se le han concedido en esta institucion ha ido mejorando poco a poco su casa, construyendo su cocina y poniendole ceramica a los cuartos y al comedor.
texts.en:
Marcia is 37 years old and married to Mr. Wilber Duarte, with whom she has two children: 7 year old Wilber, who is in second grade, and a little 20-month daughter named Milagros. Marcia has worked at the Asuncion de Juigalpa Hospital for 13 years as a nurse. Her husband is also a nurse, but he works at the Health Center of Santo Domingo. She is asking for her ninth loan and hopes to be able to rely upon Kiva's support. She wants to tile her living room, and since the baby is of an age to play on the floor she wants to complete this little project as soon as possible to avoid illnesses. If there is money left over, she would like to make improvements to the bathroom. She shares that thanks to the loans provided to her by this institution, she has been improving her house little by little, building a kitchen and tiling the bedrooms and the dining room.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile the living room and improve the bathroom

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Mr. Lina L., age 40 and his wife, Mrs. Net Neang, 38, have been married for twelve years and have three children: two sons and one daughter, two of whom attend school. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Lina was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

Lina has just started his business selling coffee and tea six months ago. He buys it from Vietnam and distributes it to sell in other provinces. He hopes to expand his business to make it bigger so that he will be able to generate income to support his family as well. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand his coffee and tea business

loans.name: Riza's Group

texts.en:
Riza C. is from the village of Calatunan. She is 36 years old and the leader of a two member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the entire loan if either is delinquent or defaults.

To make a living, Riza owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store). Her husband as a carpenter.  Riza has been engaged in business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Riza joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. 

Riza has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.  Now she is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be her 7th loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 
----------------------------------
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap K. (pictured here), age 47, and her husband, Mr. Hoy Horm, 37, have been married since 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sopheap and her husband have been farming for 20 years. They grow many kinds of vegetables on their farmland in the village. Sopheap is asking for her first loan of US$ 300 to build a toilet for family use.

loans.use: To build a toilet for family use

loans.name: Lynn

texts.en:
Lynn A., from the village of Proper Langcangan Oroquieta City, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products such as canned goods, candies, and shampoos in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lynn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Lynn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: New Hope Group

texts.en:
S. B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called "New Hope." He is 61 years old, married, and has 6 children who range from 28 to 32 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go school due to poverty; he had to send his brothers to school and take care of his ill father.

For 11 years, S. has been selling building materials, such as cutlasses, nails, hinges, locks, and saws from a table at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. He talks to customers in a nice manner, which keeps customers returning.

S. started selling with 20.00 Liberian Dollars of working capital and now has about 40,000 Liberian Dollars for working capital. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more building materials to sell. His goal is to expand his business to other locations in Monrovia and educate his children. He describes himself as a good businessman.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, S. is holding the sign. A photo of Augustine B. is inset at the lower right of the group photo, because he was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Esther is married and has two school-age children. 

To make a living, Esther owns a specialty store which primarily sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to contribute to her family's financial needs.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saibou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Saibou Touré est un homme marié de 37 ans et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa famille et son enfant dans le quartier Niebala de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fait l’école moderne, très jeune il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des motos à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et cela sans succès.  Quelques années après il revient auprès de son oncle à Bougouni pour apprendre l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées.
Avec une expérience de  6 années, il maîtrise bien son activité.
Pour améliorer son commerce Monsieur Saibou Touré décida de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des pièces détachées à Bamako.
Il est à son troisième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Saibou Touré compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 750 FCFA.
Il envisage avec ce bénéfice construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Saibou Touré is a 37-year-old married man and the father of one child. He lives with his family and child in the Niebala district of Bougouni. Not having gone to a modern school, he started at a young age working in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of motorbikes in Bamako (capital of Mali), although unsuccessfully. A few years later, he came back to his uncle in Bougouni to learn about buying and selling spare parts. With six years of experience, he has a good command of his business. To improve his business, Saibou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy spare parts in Bamako. He is on his third individual loan with Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans have been properly repaid. With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 35,750 francs CFA. He envisions building a house with the profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 45, has been a dairy farmer for 14 years.  As an active member of Step By Step group in Faulu Kenya, she saves her money on a weekly basis, investing those funds into her business.  The members of the group also guarantee one another's loans, so Lucy is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow.  By adding another cow, she will achieve more milk production and hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gladys Severa

texts.es:
Gladys Severa M. M. tiene 35 años. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas, en la provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 7 niños, de 9 hasta 17 años.

Gladys es una socia de la ventanilla rural Recinto San Ramón, que esta ubicada en Nuevo San Ramón, a 12 Km. de Ventanas. Son 20 socios en total, que están trabajando en la agricultura de corto ciclo (cosecha en 6 meses). Esto es el primer crédito que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa.

Gladys trabaja en la casa, y apoya su esposo en la agricultura, cultivando maíz y arroz. Hacen sus ventas en Ventanas cada 6 meses. 

Solicita el préstamo para hacer maíz: comprar semillas y abonos. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a tener dinero a invertir. Su sueño es dar estudios a sus hijos y comprar lo que necesitan. Enfrenta plaga y langosta en los cultivos.

Le gusta pasar su tempo libre con sus hijos.

En la fotografica esta con su esposo.
texts.en:
Gladys Severa M. M. is 35 years old. She lives with her common-law husband in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has 7 children, ranging from age 9 to 17. Gladys is a member of the Recinto San Ramón communal bank, which is located in Nuevo San Ramón, 12 kilometers from Ventanas. The group has a total of 20 members, who work in short-cycle agriculture (with harvests after 6 months). This is their first loan with the Cooperative. Gladys works within the home and also supports her husband in agricultural work, growing corn and rice. They sell their crops in Ventanas every 6 months. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and compost to grow corn. She believes that this loan will help her earn money to invest. Her dream is to pay for her children's studies and buy them what they need. She has battled pests and locusts in her crops. She likes to spend her free time with her children. She is shown with her husband in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and compost to grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase basic grains, Nestle products and perishable products.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in a three room brick house in Riawind, Pakistan. It is a small city near Lahore and famous for its dairy products and agricultural industry.

Yasmeen is 23 years old, married to E. A.. She has two children: 4-year-old, Iram, and 1-year-old Ali. Both are very young and have not started to attend school yet.

Her husband operates a grocery shop in the market. He sells rice, cooking oil and other household grocery items to earn a living for his family. He has 8 years of experience in this business.

Yasmeen supports her family with her sewing business. She is good in her art and gets regular orders and fulfills them on a timely basis. She has a good reputation among her customers for her quality work.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his grocery business. With the loan amount he will buy groceries in bulk to increase the stock of his shop and income as well.

Yasmeen is very hopeful that this investment will help her husband to improve his business' condition.

Yasnmeen is in her 4th loan cycle. In previous years, she has proven herself a responsible client who has always paid loan installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He has been operating a public motor vehicle business for over a year.  His customers are the entire public who uses public transport means. Moses faces major challenges during police crackdown. He hopes to own another motor vehicle in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to open a shop for his wife, purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

His major aim of working with Yehu is because it provides sustainable financial services. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B. is from the village of Barangay 1, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Estrella is separated from her spouse and has one  very young child. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like steamed rice cake with cheese in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia J. is from the village of San Juan, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Aurelia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy laying hens

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio nacido el 26 de agosto en Chuquisaca hace 10 años el llego a Jorochito, mediante el sindicato llego a obtener su parcela en la Planchada a 32 Km de El Torno, ahí es donde vive y trabaja en la misma parcela, el se dedica al plantado de Maíz todo lo que el produce lo saca al mercado de El Torno directo al consumidor, es un apersona muy responsable y dinámica  trabaja mucho ya que el desea muy pronto hacer construir su casita y asa dar comodidad a su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas y también contratara tractor para el arado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sergio, born on August 26 in Chuquisaca, came to Jorochito ten years ago.  He was able to obtain via the syndicate (land distributing agency) his plot of land in La Planchada, 32 kilometers from El Torno, where he lives and farms corn.  What he harvests he sells directly to the consumer in El Torno’s market.

He is a responsible, dynamic person who works hard because he wants to be able to build his house soon to provide his family with more comfort.

He will use the loan to buy seed and to contract the services of a tractor to plow the land.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For the purchase of corn and to plow the fields.

loans.name: Emmanuel Okoko

texts.en:
Emmanuel Okoko K. is 31 years old, married and a father of one child. He runs a computer training college in Mombasa's Mikindani town, a business that has been in operation for six years.

Emmanuel is borrowing his first loan from KADET to finance his business.  He plans to buy more computers for his college, and hopes to expand his business to other towns in Mombasa with his profits and subsequent KADET loans. 

He hopes to be very successful in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more computers

loans.name: Suma Amparanaca Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “Suma Amparanaca” (en lengua aymara Buenas Manos) está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Senkata. Cuenta con nueve integrantes.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la presidenta, la señora Corina, por la tesorera, la señora Clotilde y como secretaria de actas Francisca. Los negocios de las señoras están relacionados con el comercio y servicio, como por ejemplo: venta de libros, kiosco surtido, venta de comida venta de ladrillos, tejidos, gimnasio, tejido de mantas.

La señora Corina, presidenta de la asociación “Suma Amparanaca”, es socia antigua, ella recuerda que solicitó su primer crédito el año 2000, luego dejó de solicitar el crédito hasta ahora que lo necesita.  La señora Corina cuenta con el negocio de tejido de mantas, inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, para comenzar tuvo que comprar muestras y revistas.   Ahora requiere de crédito para comprar lana.  La señora Corina está casada y es madre de seis hijos.
Cuando le consultan sobre  qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el grupo porque es unido y puntual.
texts.en:
The 'Suma Amparanaca' ('Good Hands' in the Aymara language) community bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Senkata regional office.  The group has nine members and its board is made up as follows: Corina, the president; Clotilde, the treasurer and Francisca, the secretary.  The ladies' businesses are related to commerce and services.  They include: book sales, kiosk, food sales, brick sales, knitting, gym, shawl knitting.

Corina, the group's president, is a long-standing member of our institution.  She remembers that she requested her first loan in 2000.  She then stopped requesting loans for a time but now needs one again.  Corina has a business knitting shawls.  She started her business on her own initiative.  In the beginning she had to buy patterns and magazines.  She is now requesting a loan to buy yarn.  Corina is married and has six children.

When we asked Corina what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the group because it is united and punctual.

loans.use: To buy yarn

loans.name: Tamara Liseth

texts.es:
Tamara es una pequeña comerciante de venta de comida y venta de ropa pues en ambos negocio ha captado clientela, es madre de dos hijos, en donde trabaja mucho para lograr dar a sus hijos lo necesarios ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre.
Vive junto con su mama quien apoya en sus ventas cada día. Iniciando con poco capital y aumentando el nivel de venta al ofrecer una variedad de platillos, a si como ropa variada. Gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos.
Con este nuevo crédito será para la compra de ropa, cosmético y parte invertirá en productos de pollo, carne, verduras, frutas para seguir preparando su rica comida. lo que generara ingresos para sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Tamara is a small business owner who sells food and clothing and has built up a customer base for both.  She is a single mother of two and works very hard to provide for her children, since she has no support from their father.  She lives next door to her mother, who helps her out in her business. She started off with a little capital and slowly increased her sales by offering a variety of dishes and clothing thanks to the funding she’s received from Afodenic in four cycles.  With her new loan she will purchase more clothing, cosmetics and will use part of it to purchase beef and poultry products, vegetables, and fruit so she can continue preparing her delicious dishes, which generate income that is used for personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for her business

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since he was young. Today, as a head of household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income. He works caring for his animals, getting up very early to gather grass so he can keep his livestock well-fed. Anvarjon sells the milk they produce, as well as the grasses that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking this current loan for the purchase of calves to expand his business. 

Anvarjon is sincerely grateful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda J. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 60 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Rosalinda owns and operates a business providing transportation services. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Chou C., from the province of Kompong Tom, is a 48-year-old man who works as a hairdresser in front of his house. He has been in this business since 2005 and earns about $2 each day. His wife sells Khmer cakes in and around the community. They are blessed with three single children: two of them are working at various occupations and they each contribute some of their income to help the family cover its daily expenses. Chou C. is looking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle in order to make transportation easier for his family.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for his family

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en:
Rosine is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: chicken barbecue, buying and selling charcoal and buying and selling livestock. She lives in Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosine is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy more stock to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga Lucia M. es una gran emprendedora, ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante por si sola, y quiere crecer como microempresaria.
Hace poco inicio su negocio de ropa de marca importada, hasta el momento le ha ido muy  bien pero necesita un préstamo para  abrir un tienda pequeña dentro de su casa, y también para comprar más mercadería. Por eso necesita    un préstamo de ₡594 000 ( quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de  los materiales y de mas mercadería. En el futuro le gustaría  poder importar ropa con alguien directamente desde USA.
Ella es socia de la empresa de crédito comunal San Francisco de la Palmera, una de las 100 empresas socias de EDESA .
texts.en:
Olga Lucia M. is a hardworking businesswoman. Although alone, she has managed to help her children get ahead. She now wants to expand her small business selling imported clothing which she began a short while ago. It’s been very successful, but she now needs a loan to open a small store inside her house and buy more merchandise.
