Olga is asking for 594,000 colones to buy construction material and merchandise. In the future she would like to import clothing directly from the USA. She is a member of the San Francisco de la Palmera community bank, one of the 100 businesses which are members of EDESA.

loans.use: to buy construction material and imported clothing

loans.name: Claudia Emilsen

texts.es:
Claudia Emilsen Álvarez es una mujer emprendedora, madre de 4 hijos y cabeza de familia. Hace ya 4 años se separó de su esposo y comenzó a trabajar en ventas por catálogo con la ilusión de sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Ella trabaja todos los días, todo el día, se preocupa por atender bien a sus clientes y por tal motivo ha conseguido éxito en su pequeño negocio, sin embargo actualmente carece de capital para comprar diferentes productos, que sus clientes le han pedido, y que necesita para tener mas variedad en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Claudio is an enterprising woman, mother of four and the head of her family.  Four years ago she and her husband separated and she started working in catalog sales with the goal of providing for her children.  

She works all day, everyday and is very concerned with customer service, which has lead to success in her small business.  Nevertheless, she is currently lacking capital for purchasing the varied products her clients have requested and that she needs in order to offer a wider variety of items for sale.

loans.use: To purchase various products

loans.name: Koumba

texts.fr:
Madame Koumba C. est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec ses enfants au quartier Pelengana sud avec plusieurs locataires, de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aide soignante de formation, en plus de ce métier, elle excelle dans les activités commerciales. Des articles électro-ménagers avec les téléviseurs, radios, magnétoscopes etc, elle opta pour l’achat vente des produits alimentaires tels le riz, le lait en poudre etc. Elle mène cette activité depuis 16 ans et bénéfice d’une clientèle fidèle qui est généralement le personnel  socio sanitaire et autres fonctionnaires.
 Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 66 mois, après avoir fait 3 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts  individuels tous  bien remboursés, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 8 sacs de lait en poudre, elle s’approvisionne à Tombouctou.  
Madame Koumba C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 90 000 FCFA,qui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et de terminer sa maison en construction
texts.en:
Mrs Koumba C., age 47, is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her children and several renters in Pelengana Sud, a neighborhood in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

A trained auxiliary nurse, she also excels in business. Instead of appliances such as televisions, radios, video recorders, she chose to sell food products such as rice, powdered milk, etc. She's been running this business for 16 years, and has faithful customers, mainly among socio-sanitary workers and other public servants.

Aiming to bolster her working capital to meet customer demand, she turned to Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, which she's been in contact with for 66 months. After three group and 4 personal loans, all repaid without problems, she's seeking her fifth loan. She intends to use it to buy 8 sacks of powdered milk. She gets her supplies in Tombouctou.

Mrs. Koumba C. selles for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 90'000 (ca US$ 200), which will enable her to take care of the family expenses and finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of powdered milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and flour for sale

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es:
Dania nació en la ciudad del Ayaviri departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su único hijo. Ella es contadora público y desde hace 15 años que abrió su estudio contable. Ella tiene crédito con la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una computadora personal y otras cosas más. 

Dania es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su hijo y su sueño es seguir creciendo como persona y que su familia también progrese.
texts.en:
Dania was born in the city of Ayaviri in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old and today she lives in the city of Cusco together with her only son. She is a public accountant and 15 years ago she opened her accounting firm. She has accessed a loan through Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to have this form of financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also likes to be part of her communal bank, named "Templo del Inca", because all of the members are very responsible and supportive individuals. She is thankful to al those people who will contribute to her loan. It will be very useful for the progress of her business. With the loan that she requests, she will purchase a personal computer and other products. 

Dania is a fighter and she is an enterprising woman who provides for her son. Her dream is to keep improving as a person and to continue to progress with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a personal computer and other products.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Cristina nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e maê de 1 filho de 11 anos idade e vai a Escola. Fez 9ª classe parou quando ficou gravida e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria e sustenta sua maê e uma irma que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade onde trabalha desde o periodo da manhã ate ao fim do dia e consegue um rendimento de cerca 7.000.00mta por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum.

Nunca teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas  que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, barrotes, chapas de zinco, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 3.500.00mt, 8.000.00,11.000.00mt, 12.000.00me e 12.000.00mt foram para o negocio e habitação.  

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para ampliar ainda mais o seu negocio, concluir e mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has an 11-year-old son who goes to school. Cristina finished 9th grade and quit school when she became pregnant. She did not go back because of financial problems. She lives in her own house and supports her mother and a sister, who both live with her.

Cristina has never left her hometown. She has her own business selling staple goods where she works from morning until day's end. She earns about 7,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses, and she even saves some money.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. This is Cristina's fifth loan with Hluvuku. She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, beams, zinc sheets, stone and other items) to continue building her house. The earlier loans were for 3,5000 meticais, 8,000 meticais, 11,000 meticais and 12,000 meticais and were for her business and for housing.

She promises to make her payments promptly so she can get more loans in the future. Cristina intends to ask for more loans to expand her business even more, finish her house and furnish it.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, beams, zinc sheets, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a food stall business, selling retail and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Mwanatumu dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase potatoes, bundles of  wheat flour, maize flour and green grocery items. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, wheat flour, maize flour and green grocery items.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child.

Bahati has operated a fried fish selling business for the past two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby, such as school-going children. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Due to changes in high and low tides in the sea, she experiences changes in the supply of fish for resale. Bahati dreams of expanding her fish selling business to increase her profits.

With the 10,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale and to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma tiene 45 años, habita en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Glicer y sus 2 queridos hijos a quienes ama. Su negocio esta ubicado en el centro artesanal del poblado, ella está convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementarán sus ventas, es por eso que se esmera mucho en no repetir modelos. Además de tener buenos ingresos con la venta de sus propias creaciones. “Mi esposo me ayuda en la confección de tapices y mantas”, menciona Enma, “mientras yo me dedico al tejido con palitos de madera”; de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 20 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. Pero le reconforta la idea de estar juntando dinero para comprarse una movilidad propia, ya que también recibe un porcentaje de S/.400 a S/. 500 soles por el cobro de luz a los pobladores de la zona. Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres al Futuro” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Además es muy querida en su banco comunal por ser una persona responsable, y ello lo demuestra cumpliendo puntualmente con sus cuotas. Enma de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mercadería como: tapices, chompas y demás productos para su tienda artesanal.
texts.en:
Enma is 45 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She is noted as being a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Glicer and her two children who she loves very much.

Enma's business is located in the craft center in town.  She is convinced that the variety of products she offers increases her sales.  For this reason, she takes a lot of care not to repeat designs.  In addition, she makes good income from selling her own creations.  "My husband helps me in making my tapestries and blankets" Enma says "while I knit with wooden needles".  In this way, Enma is able to pay for her children's education.  She has been in this business for 20 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her handicrafts to her sales stall as she lives a very long way away.  However, she is comforted by the fact that she is putting together some money in order to be able to buy her own vehicle as she also receives a percentage of .400 to .500 Peruvian soles from charging people in her area for electricity.

In the future, Enma hopes to put together the money she needs to set up a store where she can sell her items more peacefully.  She belongs to the 'Mujeres al Futuro' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because she is a responsible person and she demonstrates this by making her loan repayments on time.

With your support, Enma will invest the money that she has requested in buying merchandise such as: tapestries, sweaters and other products for her handicrafts store.

loans.use: to buy tapestries, sweaters and other hand-made products

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es: Iris Carolina de 29 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposo Samuel de 31 años  y dos hijos. Como toda mujer emprendedora Iris no quiso ser la excepción. Dentro de su hogar ha instalado un pequeño negocio  el cual consiste en una sala de belleza en donde ofrece todo tipo de corte, planchado y variedad de producto de belleza. Quiere surtir su negocio para ofrecer  mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Para esto necesita contar con los recursos económicos necesarios que le permitan realizar su sueño, es por esta razón que solicita el préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar diferentes artículos como: lociones tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas para manos, cremas para el cabello, champo, maquillaje, esmaltes, jabón, tintes, etc. que son los productos que más se venden en su negocio. Con lo que espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Iris Carolina is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, 31 year old Samuel, and their two children.  Like other entrepreneurial women, Iris didn’t want to be the exception.  She installed a small business in her home, where she has a beauty parlor and offers all sorts of cuts, styles, and also various beauty products.  She wants to stock her business so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She needs to be able to count on financial resources in order to make her dream come true, so she is asking for this loan through INTEGRAL so that she can buy different items, such as perfumes for men and women, hand creams, hair cream, shampoo, makeup, nail polish, soaps, hair coloring, etc.  These are the products that sell the best in her business.  With this she hopes to increase her income, which will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es: Zenovia, D. 65 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía del menor D.  sus 5 hijos, pues el resto se independizaron y trabajan en la ciudad. En armonía familiar los dos viven en el caserío D. Cumutay. La dulce mirada D. está inocente mujer, refleja la fuerza y vitalidad que posee. A pesar D. su edad continua con la siembra D. arveja, papa, maíz y algunas verduras, y dice que le gusta mucho su labor porque trabaja al lado D. su hijo, y juntos vigilan sus cultivos todos los días con los primeros rayos del sol. Dice que la recompensa a su labor constante la observa durante la época D. cosecha, pues obtiene regulares precios en la comercialización a los mayoristas que vienen  D. la ciudad. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna  vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia que le dio la vida, continúa trabajando. Además D. tener 5 vacas grandes y 3 pequeñas que le proporcionan la leche con lo que hace queso. Según cuenta venD. 15 moldes a la semana, ahí obtiene una ganancia extra. Ella es muy feliz y desea seguir trabajando en el campo, el resto D. su vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer D. cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donD. está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Zenovia D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales y la contrata D. peones para que le ayuden en su próxima siembra D. arveja, papa y maíz.
texts.en: Zenovia, 65, lives in her own home with the youngest of her 5 children.  The other children are independent and work in the city.  The two live together in harmony as a family in the rural settlement of Cumutay.  The sweet gaze of this innocent woman reflects her strength and vitality.  In spite of her age, she continues to cultivate peas, potatoes, corn and some other vegetables.  She says that she likes her work because she works alongsiD. her son, and together they watch over all of their cultivations each day starting with the first rays of the sun.  She says that the reward for her constant work is seen during the harvest time, as she gets fair prices from selling to the wholesalers who come from the city.  What she doesn't like is that many times when she doesn't proviD. adequate treatments to her crops, they get infected with diseases.  She remembers with sadness that once she lost almost all of her production, but with the experience that life has given her, she keeps on working.  In addition, she has 5 large cows and 3 small ones that proviD. her with milk, which she uses to make cheese.  According to Zenovia, she sells 15 units of cheese a week to obtain extra earnings.  She is very happy and wants to continue to work in the countrysiD. for the rest of her life.  She belongs to the communal bank  “Lindo Amanecer D. Cumutay," and this is her 5th loan with MFP.  She is very grateful to everyone who has maD. this loan possible, and so she pledges to make her payments on time.  Zenovia, once she gets her loan, will purchase natural fertilizers and will hire labor to help her with her next planting of peas, potatoes and corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers and to hire workers

loans.name: Kashebeya  K  Tukorerehamwe Group A

texts.en:
Many people go to great lengths to enforce growth in their business undertakings. The flood-tide of any kind of business success, however, comes with an unwavering hard work ethic, enterprise, tenacity and a sense of determination. These are some of the precepts that 41 year old Amos, an affable and buoyant father of 6, has reckoned on to make the inroads he has made in his tea farming business in the course of the last 20 years.

Amos has been riding high on success for the past 15 years. Along the way, notwithstanding, he has had to grapple with the inevitable hurdles that come with running any kind of business. He was mostly hard pressed in consolidating his finances in his business's fledgling years. This, in a way, meant stagnation in his activity. He had less farm inputs like harvest baskets, hoes for weeding, etc. He was also hard pressed in purchasing better manure for his farms. In the face of all this, his philosophy was to remain upbeat and hope for the best.

Amos says he set forth in his business with savings from his coffee sales enterprise. He plys his business in Kihihi, in the West of Uganda. He has not dispensed with the coffee sales business, however. Amos says, though, that he has much more leeway to make up. Where he has gotten so far is encouraging. He plans on buying more land to expand his tea farming business.

Monthly this business's gross profits total up to Uganda shillings 250,000. Amos says he intends to utilize this Kiva Loan to purchase high grade manure for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure for his farm.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 47-year-old married woman. She has an eight-year-old child.

Gemma is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Gemma said the farm is very helpful to her family. They are able to eat, buy food, and send her child to school. Gemma hopes to continue earning from her farm. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs. In the future, Gemma hopes to be successful in her endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 45 year old single lady with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Her dream is to build her own permanent house and expand her business.  Grace operates a clothing boutique.  She also has decorating materials for hire.  She has been in this business for five years.  Her major challenge has been untimely debt settlements which have affected her business plans.  Her dream is to have an events shop.  Grace needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to add to her boutique.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells spices, food seasonings and vegetables. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy spices, food seasonings and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 56 years old and is married with six adult children. She is from the village of Rizal. To make a living, Merlita owns and operates a business raising pigs that she fattens and sells. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells a grown pig. Merlita joined ASKI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Merlita is requesting a new 23,000 PHP loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Janet, who is in her early thirties, is married with two children. One of them goes to school and the other is a baby. For three years, she has had two businesses: selling fruits and vegetables, and selling charcoal. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for increasing stock of fruits, vegetables, and charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to make her businesses reA. big.

She is part of the loan group "Nazareth," which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of fruits, vegetables, and charcoal.

loans.name: Walter Jesus

texts.es:
Walter Jesus  tiene 33 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de nueve meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son las plagas. El sueño es comprar terrenos para poder sembrar  y cultivar para luego venderlo a un buen precio que sea rentable para la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver cómo juegan futbol.
texts.en:
Walter Jesus is 33 years old and lives with his common law partner and 9 month old daughter in the canton of Ventanas in the Ríos province.
The community bank LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO can be found in Recinto Caimito II, in the parish of Puerto Pechiche which is part of the Pueblo Viejo canton. This is a place of short-cycle agricultural workers who sow corn, rice, and pigeon beans.
Walter is a farmer and sows corn, rice, pigeon beans. He does his buying and selling in the canton of Ventanas. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy the agricultural supplies.
The challenges that he frequently faces are plagues of pests. His dream is to buy land to sow and cultivate to later sell at a good price that is profitable for his family.
En los tiempos libres he likes to watch soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, agricultural supplies like urea, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Miroir Plus Group

texts.en:
Liliane is the leader of the Miroir Plus group, which consists of 29 micro entrepreneurs who are united for the same goal to expand their businesses by loans received from MFI HOPE RDC.

Liliane earns a living by selling clothes and toys, a business she started 10 years ago. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children aged 3 to 20. 

Liliane received two loans from HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She is requesting a third loan, which she will use to expand her inventory, buying items for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase her profit. Liliane wants to sell more goods preferred by her customers. Her ambition is to expand her business, which is located in the eastern suburban area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase some clothing items for resale.

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Santa Clara” están en el  Décimo Primer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación paraguaya, con  21 integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas y realizan labores D. trabajos en equipos, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan actividades para la recaudación D. fondos.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Delia, quien se dedica a la venta D. prendas intimas, comenta que tiene muchos clientes, tanto hombres como mujeres, y es por ello que le va muy bien, quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. kiva, para la compra D. prendas intimas para hombres y mujeres, con ello podrá cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes y además D. eso podrá ofrecerles más variedad.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Santa Clara” and they are in their 11th cycle in Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program; it has 21 members.  It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being solidly united and responsible among themselves who carry out group tasks; they have an enterprising spirit because they carry out fund-raising activities.

One of the members is Delia who sells underwear; she comments that her customers are both women and men so she does very well.  She wants to continue growing in her business so is asking for help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy underwear for men and women to meet customer demand and to be able to offer more variety.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Revolucion De Ferrier 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Amboise est le coordinatrice de son groupe Revolution de ferrier. Il est  mariee il est possede 3 enfants.

Amboise  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir aven duit du quincaillerie. Amboise espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son bussness

Des autres membres Revolution de ferrier  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et ken kay.

Amboise dit que ses défis principal est de venie une grande commercant. Amboise habite dans la région de  ferrier d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité Amboise a dirigé son  commerce de quincallerie pendant les 6  dernières années.
texts.en:
Amboise is the coordinator of his group Revolution de ferrier. He is married and has three children. 

Amboise would like to use this loan to invest in hardware products. Amboise hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. 

Other members of Revolution de ferrier need a loan for businesses such as coal and odds and ends.

Amboise says that his main challenge is to become a great businessman. Amboise lives in the ferrier region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce. Amboise has been managing his hardware business for the past six years.

loans.use: to buy hardware products.

loans.name: Fifame 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFAME 1 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sènalonhan Victorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sènalonhan Victorine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Sènalonhan Victorine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Sènalonhan Victorine est mariée à un financier du nom de André. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sènalonhan Victorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Sènalonhan Victorine vend depuis sept ans, des conserves, des savons et des cartes de recharges dans son quartier. Sènalonhan Victorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sènalonhan Victorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group FIFAME 1 consists of four members who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s third time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The representative of the group is Sènalonhan Victorine, seen with a hand raised in the photo. Sènalonhan Victorine is 34 years old and lives in Benin. She abandoned her studies in primary school. She is married to a financier named André, and they have two dependent children who both go to school. Sènalonhan Victorine lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

In order to help provide for the family, Sènalonhan Victorine has been selling canned goods, soaps, and mobile phone recharge cards around her neighborhood for the past seven years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Eager to achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Sènalonhan Victorine is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of her group. Both previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, and mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase machines for spa services.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su grupo familiar, cuatro hijos y su esposo, sus hijos son de las edades de 16, 14, 13, 10 años, todos son dependientes, ella administra una pequeña granja de aves de corral, y su esposo es agricultor sembrando maíz y frijol. Actualmente están en el proceso de recolectar la cosecha, para esto solicita un préstamo ya que deben ella y su esposo buscar mozos, para que puedan recolectar el maíz y inicien la preparación de la molienda de caña de azúcar.
Este préstamo les ayudara para mejorar directamente su negocio, que es la venta de granos como el maíz, además que otra fuente de ingreso como la molienda y venta de sus derivados, también la podrán iniciar con este préstamo.
Ella sueña con mejorar el futuro para sus hijos, ya que quiere apoyarles en los estudios y que estos aprendan un oficio que pueda servirles para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her family, which consists of her husband and four children. Her children are ages 16, 14, 13, and 10, and all of them are dependents. She currently manages a small poultry farm while her husband grows corn and beans.

They are currently in the process of gathering their harvest, so Rosa is requesting a loan so that she and her husband can hire workers to gather the corn and prepare the sugar cane for processing. This loan will directly improve their business of selling grains, such as corn. In addition, they will generate additional income by milling the grain and selling the by-products. The loan will also help them start this venture.

Rosa dreams of providing her children with a better future, supporting their studies, and helping them learn a trade so that they can earn a living.

loans.use: to hire workers for gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Tamba Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 7,000,000.00 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Their leader is Tamba.  Born in Njagbwema Fiama, in eastern Sierra Leone, the fifty-three-year-old is married and has seven children – two in primary school, three in secondary school and two grownups. Tamba has been a professional teacher for twenty-eight years. He has applied for this loan in order to buy corrugated metal sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets to roof his house

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, aged 33, has been involved in a embroidered cloth selling business for about five years. She buys a variety of printed and embroidered clothing from the main city market, and then sells to the people of the local community. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. The winter season is going to be starting and she wants to buy clothes for the winter season.

Fouzia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. Fouzia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a different clothes for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is 47 years old green grocer at Kilifi Kenya. He is a father of seven who has sold coconut in Kilifi for the last six years earning greatly from his sales.

This marks his fourth borrowing to venture in a transport business, he will use the money to purchase a motorcycle for transporting people and goods and the anticipated profit to expand his grocery and educate his children. He hopes to have a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Essi A., 33 years old, is married and the mother of five children. Tireless and very devoted, she has the sensibility of a good educator and struggles to ensure that her children succeed. She lives in Lomé, where she sells corn mush. With this modest business, she manages to help with household expenses. But the family still lives in hardship due to the burden of these expenses.

Very experienced with preparing corn mush, Mrs. A. seeks to improve her business for greater income. And to do this, she needs more funds. Both honest and sincere, she was able to repay two initial loans. She is currently requesting a new loan of $750 as capital to buy and stock corn, as well as sugar. She would thus be able to boost her income to ensure the needs of her family are met.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 33 ans environ, Madame A. Essi est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle a le sens d’une bonne éducatrice et se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Elle vit à Lomé où elle exerce comme activité la vente de bouillie de maïs. Avec cette petite activité, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Mais le poids de ces charges fait que la famille vit toujours dans des conditions difficiles. Madame A., très expérimentée dans la préparation de la bouillie, cherche à améliorer cette activité afin d’avoir un revenu plus consistant. Et pour le faire elle a besoin de moyens financier plus important. Honnête et sincère, elle a su rembourser les deux premiers crédits qu’elle a obtenus. Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et le stockage du maïs ainsi que du sucre. Elle pourra ainsi augmenter son revenu pour assurer les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and stocking corn

loans.name: Ehsen

texts.en:
Ehsen has 4 years of experience in this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Mahmudlu village. He is married and has 2 children.
In the beginning of his business he did not have enough money to improve his business.
One day he borrowed $400 and bought equipment for changing tires.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy other equipment to service all types of cars.
This would enable him to improve his busines, increase profits and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy the equipment for repairing tires

loans.name: Pablino

texts.en:
Pablino is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. In his youth, he learned his profession working in a car repair shop of his relatives. Nowadays, he owns his own garage, with all necessary tools. In addition he owns a business selling drinks, which he runs with his wife.

Pablino is from a modest family, and with a lot of effort he was able to make is dream of business ownership come true.

At this moment he owns all tools and equipment needed to perform any type of car repair. Pablino has practiced this profession for more than 20 years now, and counts with a large number of customers. One of the characteristics that differentiates his garage from others is that he can provide mobile car repairs.

He plans to enlarge his roof, because his workshop largely is lacking one.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablino tiene 33 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Durante su juventud se capacitó en el taller mecánico de unos parientes donde aprendió el oficio. Hoy día ya cuenta con su propio taller, con todas las herramientas necesarias, además posee un negocio de venta de bebidas, el cual maneja su esposa. Pablino es de un origen muy humilde que con gran esfuerzo su llego a poder concretar su sueño de tener su propio negocio.

Actualmente posee todas las herramientas y equipos necesarios para efectuar cualquier tipo de reparación mecánica. Pablino está dedicado al oficio hace más de 20 años y cuenta con un gran número de clientes. Una característica diferente que posee su taller con respecto a los otros, es que el realiza servicio de auxilio mecánico in situ.

Planea ampliar su galpón, ya que el espacio que tiene no cuenta en gran parte con techo.

loans.use: To buy lubricants and paint for cars

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Mr. Ilkin is an IDP from the occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is 27 and single. Ilkin started his own business in 2006. He received two loans (in 2006-$300, in 2007 - $600) from Normicro Baku branch and used these loans to open a shop and purchase merchandise.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Suaebah

texts.en: Suaebah is 28 years old and is married. She has no children and lives with her family. She has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables, etc., and she usually earns $17 per day. Her husband, Ali, is a teacher and earns a small salary. Suaebah requests a $100 loan to buy some goods to complete the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy some goods

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 31 years old and happily married with 3 children. She is from Mebamu, a town in Lagos state, and she sells electronics and electrical materials. She has been in business since 2003 and needs the loan of $250 to buy more electrical materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old, married with 7 children, and she cares for 5 orphans. She both farms and sells second hand clothes. Most people in rural areas farm a small plot of land next to their home, just enough for their family. They are sustenance farmers. Since there are no jobs, unless you start up your own business, sustenance farming is a necessity. The land in Kiyinde is quite fertile, so there is no problem with supplying your family with the basic staple foods, add a few chickens and some fish from Lake Victoria and life is pretty good. The developed world has a view of poverty in the developing world that is largely skewed by marketing.

Mary supplies the family with some income by also selling second hand clothing. She will travel several hours to Kampala and buy a bale of clothes for a set amount. A bale can contain several hundred items of used clothing. She will separate the items and set up a stand in her village to resell them for a small profit. With her loan she will pay her children’s school fees and continue buying bales for resale.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to continue buying more bales of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Koser's Group

texts.en:
I am Koser P.. I am a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son is eight and is in grade one while my daughter is not of school age yet.  My husband works at a nearby sweets shop for a small salary. I request a loan to buy a donkey cart to sell vegetables on it.
I know all the women in my loan group, they are nice and work very hard: Sakina B. wants to expand their meat shop. Waziran B. will use the loan to buy a cow. Irshad B. will buy a donkey cart to transport goods on order from one place to another. Allah M. will buy a cabin for their rickshaw.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Chepa

texts.es:
Chepa has a stall where she sells groceries and all types of preserves. Her residence is located in zone '8th of December' of the city of La Paz and her stall is located in the zone of Tembladerani, close to the Bolívar market in the Western Slope of the city of La Paz. This is the tenth time that she has requested a loan with Impro. Her credit record qualifies her as a good client since the repayment of the loans that she has completed were within the dates established in the contracts. The loan that she now requests will be used for the purchase of merchandise in large quantities in order to reduce costs. Her previous loans permit us to agree to this loan since she has experience as a merchant and all the previous loans were paid in a punctual manner.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Chepa tiene un puesto donde vende abarrotes y toda clase de conservas. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona 8 de diciembre de la ciudad de La Paz y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani, cerca al mercado Bolívar en la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Décima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro; su historial lo califica como cliente bueno ya que las cancelaciones que realiza son dentro de las fechas establecidas en los contratos. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado para la compra de mercadería en cantidad para de esta manera abaratar los costos. Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como comerciante y todos los créditos anteriores los pagó en forma puntual.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and preserves in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia has belonged to the Saint Isabel of Acosvinchos Communal Bank for 1 year. Lucia is a native of the district of Acosvinchos that this located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho. In her Communal Bank she has learned to feed her children, to avoid illnesses and to be punctual.

Lucia is married, is 30 years old and has 2 children. Lucia sells fruits in the market of the district on Sundays. With the aid of her son, she buys the fruits in the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho. Also, Lucia makes loaves of “chapla” bread and biscochos (a type of cookie), which she sells from her house and in the market. In addition, Lucia has a small grocery store in her house.

Lucia needs a loan of 1500 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, flour, noodles and oil.

The dreams of Lucia are that her children become professionals, to live in the city of Ayacucho and to run her business in the city.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lucia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Isabel de Acosvinchos hace 1 año, Josefina es natural del distrito de Acosvinchos que esta ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a como alimentar a sus hijos, evitar enfermedades y ser puntual.

Lucia es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Lucia vende frutas en el mercado del distrito los días domingos, con la ayuda de su hijo, las frutas lo compra del mercado Nery garcía en Ayacucho. También Lucia elabora panes “chapla”, biscochos, sus ventas los realiza en su casa y en el mercado. Además Lucia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Lucia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, harina, fideos y aceite.

Los sueños de Lucia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, vivir en la ciudad de Ayacucho y realizar su negocio en la ciudad.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, flour, noodles and oil.

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en: Mrs. Sokchea P., 44, lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and is married with four children. One child works in a garment factory, while the others are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Sok Soung, is pictured on the left in the photo. He is a farmer with a cultivatable field next to the village and can earn about $1.50 per day. Because of her poor living condition, Mrs. Sokchea P. doesn’t have enough money to buy vegetable seeds, and thus she would like to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex F.  sells used clothing. He is married and has 1 child. Business is doing very well but he wishes to increase sales. He is running out of stock.
	
He is asking for a $500 loan to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is a small entrepreneur from Kherson, Ukraine. She runs a venture selling different types of perfumes in a busy market called Dneprovskyi. Alla’s inventory always sells well because she offers a nice selection at reasonable prices. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Today she has over $13,000 invested in her business. Her net profit is about $3600 each month.

Alla is very accurate in all her business policies. She always weighs every pro and con before she takes any risk and puts her money at stake. This cautiousness has helped Alla to promptly repay eleven loans from Nadiya Ukraine. We believe this current loan will assist in the stable expansion of Alla’s business and will help guarantee her economic independence, which has always been her ultimate goal as an entrepreneur.

(Note: this is a short-term “express” loan that will be repaid in two months.)

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Adriana's Group

texts.en:
Norma, Adriana and Liz belong to the Girasoles Village Bank in Pamplona Alta in the district of San Juan of Miraflores, Lima.

Adriana is a married mother of seven grown children. Liz is one of her daughters, with three children of her own. Together they decided to sell artisan handicrafts and cured fabrics. They have a workshop in their house, but sell their products in downtown Lima.

Norma is a married mother of two children. She sells vegetables and soup in the markets by cart, working with her mother. Norma's husband drives a taxi that they rent on a daily basis.

Adriana, Liz and Norma need respective loans of 1,400, 1,200 and 400 Nuevo Peruvian Soles. Adriana and Liz will buy more materials and products for their fabric-work, while Norma will further stock her business.

Adriana and Liz hope to eventually separate and run personal, independent businesses. Norma and her husband have saved to buy a car and her husband will work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: Adriana, Liz and Norma need respective loans of 1,400, 1,200 and 400 Nuevo Peruvian Soles. Adriana and Liz will buy more materials and products for their fabric-work, while Norma will further stock her business.

loans.name: Apirial 2031-10 Group

texts.en:
Tamara M. is the group leader of this small group. She is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to buy a generator for home use. Tamara is 45 years old and is married to a farmer. She has three children in school ranging in age from nine to twenty one years old. Each week Tamara makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profits from her business.

Tamara is joined in her small group by Annani A., Lucia A., Mamal D., and Jenty S.. Annani A. sells tea and bread in a restaurant and wants to increase her stock. Lucia A. currently sells soap and rings at the market and wants a loan to expand her business. Mamal D. sells fried eggs, meat, beans, fresh fish and other items at a hotel. She, too, wants to expand her business. Jenty S. sells charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a generator for home use and expand retail inventory

loans.name: Sina Chaum's Group

texts.en:
Miss Sina C. (shown in picture on the left, with her group member) was selected by her group members to be the group leader for a loan from Maxima (Kiva's Field Partner). In the group there are two families including hers. All the group members live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Miss Sina C. (age 27) is single and lives with her parents. Sina has been a silk weaver for thirteen years, using a skill she learned from her village neighbor. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

2-Mrs. Sokhorn S. (age 25) and her husband, Mr. Sros C., 24, were married in 2004 and have one son. Sokhorn has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, using a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a silk weaver for eighteen years as well. Now Sokhor is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: José Humberto

texts.es: El señor José Humberto B. P. tiene la edad de 48 años habita en el barrio San Caralampio La Concepción  , con su esposa Ángela Rosa Lopez, ella es comerciante vende frutas y verduras en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, con las ganancias del negocio ayuda a don José con los gastos de la casa ya que tienen a cargo 2 hijos que estudian en secundaria , una niña de 12 años y 1 niño de 14 años, estos pequeños después que salen de clase la niña le ayuda a la mamá con los quehaceres del hogar y el varón se va con ella a buscar mercadería para el siguiente día, tienen 4 años de vender en este mercado . Este señor labora como guarda de seguridad en el hogar Belén desde hace 8 años este hogar este ubicado en el 10 ½ carretera Masaya. Esta familia cuenta con una pequeña cantidad de tierra la que cultivan para obtener otros ingresos. El solicita el crédito para mejoras de su vivienda ya que el techo esta en muy malas condiciones y cada vez que llueve tienen que colocar muchos recipientes por toda la casa para que no se le deterioren las pocas cosas que con mucho esfuerzos han logrado
texts.en:
Mr. José Humberto B. P. is 48 years old and lives in the San Caralampio La Concepción neighborhood with his wife, Angela Rosa Lopez, who is a produce vendor in the Mercado Oriental in Managua. With the profits earned from the business, she helps out José with the household expenses because they have 2 children in middle school—a 12-year-old girl and a 14-year-old boy. After getting home from school, the girl helps her mother with the household chores, while the boy accompanies his mother in search of the next day’s merchandise. They have been selling in this market for 4 years. Mr. B. has been working as a security guard at the Belén household, which is located on 10 ½ Masaya Highway, for 8 years. This family has a small plot of land that they cultivate in order to earn extra income. He is requesting this loan for home improvement because his roof is in disrepair, and everytime it rains, they have to place containers all over the house to collect the water so that it will not deteriorate the few things they have.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair home roof

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Jambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Hawa M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 14. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents had passed away due to HIV/AIDS.

Hawa has been running a kuku (chicken) business since 2007. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

She works at the business 16+ hours a day, 7 days a week, with the help of her children when they are home from school. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to build a chicken coop so she has more room for more chickens to expand her business. Hawa thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To build a chicken coop

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Nop Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen members is located in Angk Ta Nu village in Takeo Province. All the members plan to use their loan proceeds for different purposes. Mrs. Sarun N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is beautician who does makeup for wedding ceremonies. Since her business is going well, she wants to use her proceeds to buy additional cosmetic products. Her husband, Mr. Kat Sao, is a farmer. Mrs. Sarun N. is 29 years old and the mother of four children, three of whO. are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Thirteen members have end-of-term loans and the rest of have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products

loans.name: Birame

texts.fr: Birame travaille dans l'assurance depuis une dizaine d'année. Ce  marié et pére de 3 enfants entretient sa famille grâce aux revenus tirés de son activité. Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activté.
texts.en:
Birame has been working in the insurance business for approximately ten years. He's married and the father of three children, and he provides for his family thanks to the revenues of his business. He's seeking this loan to bolster his business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster his insurance business

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S. is a 33 year old rice farmer who also works raising pigs to sell for another source of income. She raises a sow, then sells its babies, and the business has done well. She is married with four children, all of whom are small teenagers and in school. Her rice crop is one source of income for her family's living, and she raises pigs for more income. To increase her income, Soy S. needs a loan to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Amele

texts.fr: Amele G. est une revendeuse des légumes au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Pour donner plus d’élan à son activité, elle souhaite avec ce crédit payer des légumes pour la revente.
texts.en:
Amele G. is a retailer of vegetables at the grand marketplace of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of four. To bring added vigor to her business, she would like to use this loan to pay for vegetables for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy some vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores en su propia casa. Se dedica a la  crianza de  animales y a la siembra de sus tierras de cultivo desde hace 5 años, lo cual realizaba como una actividad más para aumentar sus ingresos, pero ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos que le sirve para mantener a su familia. Es por eso que se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus quehaceres, pastar a sus animales y cuidar de sus cultivos, regresando a su casa al final del día. Inés quiere seguir progresando, por lo que desea emprender un nuevo negocio para prevenir posibles decadencias económicas. Es la tercera vez que Inés tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella disfruta de cada reunión de su banco comunal, y es una de las que persevera en la renovación de su crédito. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar papa y también para adquirir una máquina de coser para iniciarse en el negocio de la costura.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three small children in a house they own. She has dedicated herself to raising animals and planting crops on her farmland for the past 5 years. She started these activities in order to supplement her earnings, but now these undertakings have become the primary means of sustenance for her family. It’s for this reason that she rises very early to do her chores, graze her animals, and tend to her crops, returning home at the end of the day. Inés wants to continue to progress, which is why she wants to start a new enterprise to prevent any possibly financial deterioration. This is the third time Inés has a loan with MFP. She enjoys the meetings of her cooperative bank, and is one of the members who perseveres to renew her credit. The sum she requests is for the purchase of bags of fertilizer to plant potatoes, and also to purchase a sewing machine to start a business as a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa T., 45, is married with nine children.  She has three years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week. She has four previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase items for her business, to buy home improvement materials like floor mat and cement and to pay for her children's school uniforms and school fees.

loans.use: To buy canteen supplies, home improvement materials, school uniforms and school fees

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
Hải Trần (1044061359) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Nghệ An. She is married and has two infant children.

To make a living, Hải works in a family member's business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Hải has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Hải joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Hải has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Hải is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Hải plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional personal home products to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
WILMA R. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 de junio del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad y 2 hijos.  Su pareja es taxista (transportista).

Con el primer préstamo recibido de S/ 300.00 pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, con este dinero compró víveres.

En la actualidad vende una variedad de comida par todos los gustos, cocina platos de la selva, la costa y la sierra del país porque hay muchas personas de afuera que buscan ese tipo de alimentos por su rico sabor.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1 ,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más utensilios como son cucharas y platos.
 
“Me encanta la cocina y para que los cliente se vayan contentos preparo varios platos cada día.  Aprendí con Manuela Ramos que como mujer puedo administrar mi propio negocio y así generar mas ingreso para mi familia.
texts.en:
Wilma R. H. belongs to 'Las Estrellitas de Pucallpa' (The Little Stars of Pucallpa) community bank in a squatter settlement called '4 de Junio' in the Manantay district of Pucallpa city. She is 48-years old and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. With her first loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business of selling food, using the money to buy supplies. Currently she sells a variety of food for every preference, cooking regional dishes from the jungle, coastal, and mountain regions of the country, as there are many people from other areas that look for these types of foods for their delicious flavors. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, Wilma will buy more cooking utensils such as spoons and plates. "I love to cook and to make sure my customers leave happy, I prepare a variety of dishes everyday. With Manuela Ramos I learned how, as a woman, I can manage my own business and thus generate more income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils such as plates and cutlery.

loans.name: Téréko

texts.fr:
Madame  Téréko Diakité a 43 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle a choisi de faire une activité génératrice de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de se  spécialiser dans la fabrication et la vente de la poudre de “Djafarana” il y a environ 17 ans avec une ivoirienne qui était venue à Sikasso pour en faire son activité principale. Cette poudre appelée communément “Djafarana mugu” ou “Tamati mugu” est fabriquée à base de mil, de la graine de l’arbre ou légume de “Djafarana” et du beurre de karité.
Elle pile le mil et la graine de “Djafarana” pour en faire le mélange avec le beurre de karité qui va donner  par  la suite la poudre proprement dite.
Elle  collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts  précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 3 sacs de mil, 8 sacs de graine “Djafarana” et 30kg de beurre  de Karité. Elle s’approvisionne en graines de “Djafarana”, de mil et de beurre de karité dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso (Loulouni, Lobougoula, Gnangasso, etc.) sur commande.
La rotation de son activité est très élevée et elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui servira à assurer certaines de ses dépenses, aider  son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Téréko Diakité, age 43, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wife, and their children in Médine, a working-class district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to go to school due to societal reasons, she chose to work to earn an income. Thus, she decided to become specialize in making and selling "djafarana" powder about 17 years ago. She learned how to do this from a woman from Cote d'Ivoire who had come to Sikasso to make it her principal business. This powder, commonly called “djafarana mugu” or “tamati mugu”, is made with millet, the seeds of the djafarana tree or plant, and shea nut butter. She pounds the millet and the djafarana seeds to make the powder, to be mixed with shea nut butter, in turn yielding the powder itself as mentioned. Téréko has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for five years now. After several solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association of her area, she is on her second individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With the current loan, she intends to buy three sacks of millet, eight sacks of "djafarana" seeds, and 30 kg of shea nut butter. Supplies of the seeds, millet, and the butter are gotten in towns surrounding Sikasso City (Loulouni, Lobougoula, Gnangasso, etc.) by special order. Her business cycle is very rapid, and she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure that certain expenses are covered, to help her husband support the family, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet and djafarana and some shea nut butter

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly S. is from the village of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Merly is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Merly owns and operates a business in the food sector, selling hot cake. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling hot cake within her local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Merly is now requesting her second loan from GDMPC. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for making hot cake. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making hot cake

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
51-year-old Linda L. is an active member of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). Her family is blessed to have a large parcel of land yet they lack enough capital to utilize it for their rice farming business. That is why she is now applying for a loan from CEVI amounting to Php 15,000.00. 

Her long-term plan is typical of that of every economically poor Filipino: to lift her family from the mud of poverty. With CEVI, Linda finds every obstacle an opportunity to strive harder. This is what she has learned from the biblical reflections during CEVI cluster meetings.

loans.use: labor, fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is requesting a loan from Kiva of PHP7, 000, which she will use as additional working capital for her general store, located in the public market of Tumauini, Isabela. She has operated her business for 20 years. She patiently maintains her business in order to provide the daily necessities of her family and to give them a better life. She wants her business to grow more so she is asking for the financial assistance of Kiva lenders. 

Amalia has two children, they already finished their two-year course in college. She is married to Leon, who is a tricycle operator in their village. They help each other to give their family a good life. At the moment, the couple is saving funds for the repair of their house, since their children already graduated from college and are looking for jobs. Amalia hopes that the loan will be provided so they will have a better chance of achieving their goals.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Chhum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of twenty-two members, is located in Preak Ta Kaev village in the province of Kandal. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Leang C., who has been selected by the members as the village bank president, is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Kheng Huot, is a fisherman. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Leang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat for her husband’s fishing. This couple has three children; two are employed in a garment factoR., while the other is a fisherman who helps with his father’s work.

Twenty one members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a boat for her husband’s fishing

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna Y. est une femmme de 54 ans, elle marié et mère de huit (8) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis quatre ans et a une bonne expérience du crédit. Avec ses deux congélateurs verticaux elle développe une activité de vente de crême glacée, de jus de fruits naturels et de bouillie à base de céréales locaux. les bénéfices générés à partir de son activité lui permettent de payer la scolarité de certains de ses enfant et de contribuer à la nourriture et autres charges familiales.
texts.en:
Maïmouna Y. is a 54-year-old woman, married, and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 for four years. She has good experience with loans. With her two upright freezers, she is developing a business selling ice cream, natural fruit juices, and porridge made from local grains. The profits generated from her business enable her to cover the cost of schooling some of her children and to help with food and other family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her capacity to self-finance and to grow her business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of The Dawn village bank. She is 45 years-old, lives with her partner, and has three sons. Her youngest son (16) lives with her and is studying at public school.

Maura was orphaned by her father and was only able to complete fifth grade because she didn’t have the money to continue. She began to work selling sweets in the streets. At 16, she got engaged and decided to become a seamstress. She designed and sewed various bag designs to her neighbors. Next she began to design and sew different articles of clothing to sell.

Since Maura has joined FINCA her life has totally changed. Her economic status has improved and she is thankful for the loans. She encourages her neighbors by telling them that they can progress and improve.

Maura needs a loan of 3000 PEN to buy various rolls of fabric for making clothes and sheets. Her dream is to have a large business that sells sheets.

loans.use: Buy rolls of fabric to make clothes and sheets.

loans.name: Nicaragua Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nicaragua está integrado por Isabel Cristina G. R., Azucena Esmeralda P. G. y Argelia María R. G. originarias de la comarca Altos Norte de Masaya. 

Isabel Cristina G. R. se dedica a la elaboración de Nacatamales, los cuales distribuye en Tipitapa. Esa es su principal fuente de ingresos, ella aprendió el oficio cuando su abuela los hacía y así inició su negocio.  Los realiza por encargo y los lleva a diferentes puntos de Tipitapa para su comercialización.  También poseen un taxi que su esposo maneja y le genera otra fuente de ingresos, el cual le sirve para desplazar sus productos con mayor facilidad. 

Su crédito lo invierte en materia prima para la elaboración de este delicioso plato típico y algunas veces lo utiliza para su carrito.

Azucena P. trabaja en compañía de Argelia R. en la compra y venta de ropa y zapatos de manera ambulante. Ellas viajan a León y ahí distribuyen su producto. Aún que trabajan con capital independiente son muy unidas y se apoyan mutuamente.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para sus nacatamales

loans.name: Silvia Helena

texts.es: La Señora de Nombre Silvia Helena Rodríguez B. tiene la edad de 42 años, es madre de 4 hijos que laboran de forma independiente y algunos le ayudan en el negocio. Silvia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y siempre la ha gustado ser una persona responsable y pagar a tiempo. La actividad económica es la venta de materiales de construcción, ella da inicio a esta actividad por su papa quien era el que estaba a cargo del negocio ella siempre lucho por mantener este negocio, ya que sabía que un futuro el día de mañana podría serle muy útil para el futuro. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de arena, ya que es destinada para la elaboración de bloques. El sueño de ella es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia Helena is 42 years old and the mother of 4 children who work independently now, though some help her in her business. Silvia has worked with the Leon 2000 Foundation for a long time and she has always enjoyed being a responsible person and paying her loans on time.

She sells construction materials. Silvia began this activity with her father who used to be in charge of the business. She has always struggled to maintain the business, knowing that it would serve her well in the future.

Now she asks for financing to buy sand for making cement blocks. Her dream is that her children will succeed in completing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SAND TO MAKE CEMENT BLOCKS

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: R. Louise est née en 1985 à Katagon dans les collines au Bénin. Louise vit depuis dix ans à Katagon Anianli et est mariée à NOUDEHOUENOU Zamba, un vulganisateur. Louise et Zamba ont deux enfants tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Louise est une coiffeuse qui mène également comme activité, la vente de produits de toilette à Anianli. Louise n'a jamais été à l'école et exerce cette activité depuis onze ans déjà. Louise achète ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié déjà de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Louise sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour accroître son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle.
texts.en:
R. Louise was born in 1985 in Katagon in Collines County in Bénin.  She has been living for ten years in Katagon Anianli and is married to NOUDEHOUENOU Zamba, a tire maker.  She and Zamba have two children who are both in school and dependents of theirs.   Louise is a hairdresser who also runs a business selling bath items, in Anianli.  She never attended school and has already been in this business for eleven years.  She purchases these items in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo.  She is a former ALIDé client who has benefited from two loans before, which she repaid.  Louise is requesting a third loan from ALIDé for growing her business and for satisfying her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
